loans.name: R-Jay

texts.en:
R-Jay is a 23-year old vocational school graduate and he lives in a rural village in Bago City. He belongs to a family of 12. His father is a rice farmer and his mother is a housewife and takes care of her grandchildren. R-jay has 9 siblings and his eldest sister is helping them financially. Both father and sister are earning a total monthly income Php 6,000.00 ($133) that is barely enough to provide their basic needs. 

Being the youngest child and living in poverty motivate R-Jay to find means to help his parents have more income. That’s why he braved the selection process of BagoSphere and successfully qualified for a 2-month training program that could lead to a call center job. R-Jay dreams of earning enough money to buy a house for his parents. Lenders' generosity in funding this loan will help R-Jay have a higher and better income.

loans.use: to pay for tuition for a 2-month call center training program that can get him a job paying about $270 monthly

loans.name: Meraflor

texts.en:
Meraflor is 51 years old and married, with 4 adult children. She lives in Bulalo, Baliangao.  

She has engaged in this business for 5 years.  She earns PHP 5,000 from her sari-sari store monthly and joined Paglaum in 2011.  She applied in Paglaum with the amount of PHP 20,000 to restock the store with basic commodities.  The profit she earns in this business are used to support school tuition fees and savings for the future.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities

loans.name: Julio

texts.en:
Julio is a father with a 20-year-old son. He lives in the Port-au-Prince area with his wife and his son. He has been living in his neighborhood since 2000. He is well known mostly in his church since he is one of the worship leaders there. 

In the past, he used to sell honey and grocery products, but now he is very excited to become an Enèji Pwòp retailer. He will be selling Land Enèji pwòp, Sunking Pro, Powapak, and recho gaz blan (1 ak 2 plas). Now that Julio has a good understanding about the Enèji pwòp products, he will be able to help his clients when they have questions. A loan will enable him to get that started and get back on his feet again. He attends a church that has about 800 members that is mainly his target market.

loans.use: To purchase Enèji pwòp products and resell to people in his church

loans.name: Monicah

texts.en:
Monicah is thirty-five years old from Nyahururu. She is divorced with four children aged one, four, five and twelve.

She operates a tailoring business in Nyahururu which she has been operating for ten years and earns a monthly income of KES 4,000. She has applied for her first loan of KES 10,000 from VisionFund Kenya. She plans to use the loan to boost her business by buying more materials.

She anticipates using the gains from her business to pay back her loan, educate her children and boost her business as well.

loans.use: To buy more materials for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Josphat

texts.en:
Josphat is 30 years old, married, and has two children. He operates a retail business selling scrap metal, which he has been doing for four years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are reliable customers. He describes his biggest business challenge to be low capital. 

Josphat requested his first loan from SMEP for 20,000 KES, which he will use to buy more stock of scrap metal to sell. His business goal is to expand within five years with the anticipated profits. He hopes to improve his living standards.

loans.use: to purchase stock of scrap metal to sell

loans.name: Marine

texts.en: Marine, who is a fifty-nine-year-old married woman, lives in a village in Bolokiani Lagodekhi district. She has a disabled husband, who gets monthly assistance from the local government of 100 GEL. Marine has a small monthly income from agricultural activities. She cultivates a plot of land and sells the harvested products locally. For further development her agricultural business needs some investment. Marine's request for money was approved by the joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, that gives people chance to start or re-start businesses. She will use the loan to set up a greenhouse. Marine will buy cellophane, fertilizers and cultivate land to grow vegetables and peppers. Marine will get the chance to increase her monthly income and gain financial stability. She is grateful for the support in helping her more easily take care of her husband and to live better.

loans.use: to set up greenhouse

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim is a 50-year-old vigorous lady; she has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. 

However, due to lack of availability of funds she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. For this reason she requested a loan of Rs 40,000 to Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of thread in different colors, along with packs of laces, zippers and buttons to create a means of increasing revenue so she may able to generate a healthier source of income. 

She is in her 8th loan cycle and has shown good repayment behavior.

loans.use: to buy more spools of thread in different colors, along with packs of laces, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Serigne Mouhamadou

texts.fr:
Serigne Mouhamadou est un jeune de 27 ans qui s’active dans le commerce de céréales. Il a démarré en 2004 avec ses propres moyens. Il possède un magasin où il vend des céréales : mil, mais, riz, mais aussi du foin, du ripasse. Et puisque les denrées sont moins chères à cette période de l’année, il choisit toujours de faire un crédit à cette période de l’année.
Il est célibataire, sans enfant et n’a pas de charges qui l’encombrent, sinon l’achat de carte téléphonique et de l’argent qu’il envoie régulièrement à ses parents pour les aider à subvenir à leurs besoins.  Il faut aussi noter qu’il possède deux taxis qui augmentent ses revenus et lui permet de mettre un peu d’argent de coté pour pouvoir réaliser un jour son vœu de devenir un grand commerçant et un grand transporteur.
texts.en:
Serigne Mouhamadou is 27 years old and a grain seller.  He started his business in 2004, using his own funds.  He owns a shop in which he sells grains such as millet, maize, rice, and also hay and "ripasse" (a type of cattle feed).  Since food products are cheaper during this time of year, he always chooses this season to take a loan.

He is single and doesn't have any children.  He has very few expenses (except those related to the purchase of phone cards), but he regularly sends some money to his parents to support them financially.  It should also be noted that he owns two taxis, which allow him to make an extra income and to save a little money.  His dream is to become a major seller and transporter.

loans.use: to buy millet, maize, hay and "ripasse" (a type of cattle feed) for resale.

loans.name: Santa

texts.en: Santa is a married woman who has six children, ages 2 to 13 years. She describes herself as persistent. She operates a retail business where she sells mandazi (East African doughnuts). She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a busy area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be low capital. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy wheat flour and other materials for preparing mandazi. Her business goal is to expand within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will improve her life. This is her first loan with SMEP. She will use the anticipated profits to improve the business.

loans.use: buy wheat flour and other materials for preparing mandazi (East African doughnuts)

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 40 years old, from Nyahururu. She is married to John and they are blessed with two children aged 17 and 11 years old.

She is a farmer, a business she has been running for the last fifteen years, and to enable her to buy farm inputs like maize-planting seeds and fertilizer, she has applied for her first loan of KES 30,000 from VisionFund Kenya.

Her monthly income right now is KES 30,000 and she has plans of using the anticipated profits from her expanded business to educate her children and to pay her loan back to VisionFund Kenya. In the future, she hopes to be a successful farmer.

loans.use: to buy maize-planting seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James lives in Nkubu with his wife and three  children. A farmer for 12 years, his primary income sources are milk, eggs, vegetables and bananas, crops that enable him to pay school fees for his children.

James chose Juhudi Kilimo because they reach farmers in the rural areas by offering asset finances. During the training, he learnt how to plan and budget his income as a farmer. Through the purchase of irrigation equipment, for which he is requesting this loan, he will be able to water his crops efficiently and produce more. This additional income will enable James to improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: to purchase irrigation equipment.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothing items to sell.

loans.name: Aiganysh

texts.ru: Айганыш 32 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 5 детей. У Айганыш - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Айганыш занимается животноводством, стартовав 14 лет назад, с покупки скота на 5,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Айганыш, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 3 дойные коровы, 1 лошадь, 8 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 8,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Айганыш обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом - на покупку коровы для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Айганыш планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en: Aiganysh is 32 years old, married, and together with her husband, is raising five children. Aiganysh has a secondary education. As the main source of income for her family, Aiganysh practices livestock breeding. She started this business 14 years ago, with an initial purchase of cattle in the amount of 5,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Aiganysh's hard work, she currently has 3 milk cows, 1 horse, and 8 sheep on her farm. Her monthly income is 8,000 som (KGS). For the purpose of further developing her business, Aiganysh turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." She is requesting a loan to buy a cow to increase the size of her herd. Aiganysh plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further acquisition of livestock.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Dusabimana Group

texts.fr:
Imelde fait parti du groupe Dusabimana  et habite  à Gitega. Elle a  35 ans et est mariée à Gérard. Ensemble ils ont  4 enfants  dont 2  étudient.

Elle fait le commerce du lait de beauté et de savons depuis 8 ans.

Elle est à  son quatorzième crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit Kiva qu’elle  obtient, elle va augmenter son capital et acheter une grande quantité de lait de beauté et de savons   à revendre pour gagner plus.

Dans les années  prochaines, il voudrait ouvrir un magasin au marché.
texts.en: Imelde is a member of the Dusabimana group and she lives in Gitega.  She is 35 years old and married to a man named Gérard.  Imelde and Gérard have four children, two of whom are in school.  Imelde has been selling skin lotion and soap for eight years.  This is her 14th loan with Turame.  With this loan, financed by Kiva, she will increase her capital and buy a large quantity of skin lotion and soap for resale.  Her goal is to increase her revenue.  In the coming years, she would also like to open a shop at the market.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of skin lotion and soap for resale.

loans.name: Vonile

texts.en: Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is forty-seven-year-old Vonile from Masvingo. She is widowed with three children, of which one is attending school. She also cares for two other dependents. Vonile runs a food business selling tea, coffee, english dishes, rice, chicken, beef and sadza. The business has been in operation for four years. She says the main challenges she faces are competition and the liquidity crunch facing the country. Vonile has requested a loan of $1200 to purchase pizza makers, milk shakes, an animal for meat, rice and mealie-meal. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to increase her income and hence improve her family welfare. In the future Vonile plans to open more branches in other cities.

loans.use: to purchase pizza makers, milk shakes, an animal for meat, rice and mealie-meal.

loans.name: Nertila

texts.en:
Nertila already has a milk cow; yet she wants to add one more with this loan. Her plans are to expand the livestock activity. In addition to the cow, she has chickens and pigs as well. 

The village where Nertila resides was built and populated after the 1990’s. The entire land surface was previously a marsh. It was converted to a residential area and loam, where villagers plant mainly wheat and potatoes and harvest large quantities of watermelon. Cows and goats are the animals that locals prefer the most.

Nertila is a 24-year-old mother of a 2-year-old and she is expecting to give birth to another one very soon.

loans.use: to expand the livestock activity by adding another milk cow .

loans.name: Grace Divine 1 Group

texts.fr:
Akou Mawussé est mariée et mère de 2 enfants. Elle habite à Adidogomé un quartier de Lomé. Commerçante de jus et d'eau glacée depuis 2005, elle a en 2012, financé par ces économies le commerce des œufs en détails. Son sens d’adaptation et de vie en groupe lui a permis d’être actuellement la présidente du groupe "grâce divine 1"
Dans le souci de satisfaction de sa clientèle, elle diversifie ses produits avec la vente de la farine de blé en 2014. Elle sollicite à cette occasion un crédit pour l’achat de 3 sacs de farine de blé.
Les autres membres du groupe sont des femmes commerçantes avec des produits accès diversifier tels que : l'igname, les pagnes, les produits alimentaires, du fil à coudre, des œufs et autres.
texts.en:
Akou Mawussé is married and the mother of two children.  She lives in Adidogomé, a neighborhood of Lomé.  She has been selling juices and ice water since 2005 and, with her savings, she was able to start selling eggs, on a retail basis, in 2012.  Her adaptability and sociability have allowed her to become the president of the "Grâce divine 1" group.

Eager to meet the needs of her customers, she has been diversifying her activity and started selling wheat flour in 2014.  She is now taking a loan to buy three bags of wheat flour.

The other members of the group are also involved in retail, and they sell various products such as yams, food products, "pagnes" (colorful West-African fabrics), sewing thread, eggs, etc.

loans.use: to buy three bags of wheat flour.

loans.name: Bagdagul

texts.ru: Багдагул швея, проживающая в городе Душанбе с мужем и детьми. Ей 51 год. Она занимается пошивом женских платьев национального стиля. Фасон и вышивку для платьев она придумывает сама и в каждый заказ вкладывает свою душу, в результате чего ее творение получается красиво и клиентки всегда остаются довольными ее услугами. Багдагул занимается швейным делом на протяжении 6 лет. За этот период она приобрела хороший опыт в этой области. Теперь она хотела бы расширить свою деятельность и получать больше заказов. Для этой цели она просит кредит. На сумму кредита она собирается приобрести новую модернизированную швейную машинку, что позволит улучшить скорость и качество ее работы. Этот кредит очень важен для нее.
texts.en:
Bagdagul is a seamstress who lives in the city of Dushanbe with her wife and children. She is 51 years old. She sews women's dresses in the national style. She thinks up the design and embroidery of the dresses herself and puts her own soul into every order, with the result being that her every creation ends up beautiful and clients are always happy with her services.

Bagdagul has been sewing for 6 years. In this time she has obtained good experience in the sphere. Now she would like to grow her business and receive more orders. She is asking for a loan for this goal. She plans to purchase a new modern sewing machine with the loan, which would allow her to improve the speed and quality of her work. This loan is very important for her.

loans.use: to buy a modern sewing machine

loans.name: Sabougnouma Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Sabougnouma est composé équitablement de femmes monogames et  polygames. Elles ont en moyenne 46 ans et 8 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Djalakorodji. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de, condiments (oignons, betteraves, tomates concentrée), épiceries et plastiques. Dans le but d’augmenter  leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1er cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Korika  (1ère debout sur la gauche dans la photo)est une grande vendeuse de condiments (oignons, betteraves, tomates concentrées,…). Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 10 cartons de tomate concentrée en gros à Bamako. La revente se fait en détail à Djalakorodji à une clientèle majoritairement  composée de femmes. Madame  Korika  espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité. Elle a pour objectif de subvenir aux besoins de la famille dans cette relation avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The Sabougnouma group is made up equally of women in monogamous and polygamous households. They are, on average, 46 years old and have eight children. They all live in Djalakorodji. 

The group members engage in small-scale commerce selling condiments (onions, beetroots, tomato paste), groceries, and plastic goods. 

In order to increase their business funds, the group members decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso. They are on their first group loan.

Korika (the woman on the far left in the photo) sells condiments (onions, beetroots, tomato paste, etc.). She plans to use her loan to buy ten boxes of tomato paste at wholesale from Bamako.

Sales will be made at retail in Djalakorodji to mostly female customers. 

With her loan, Korika hopes to earn an average monthly profit of 40,000 francs CFA, which will be used to reinvest in her business. 

With this collaboration with Soro Yiriwaso, she aims to support her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy condiments

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John, 36 years old, is from Nyahururu. He is married to Mary and blessed with four children ages 1, 4, 5 and 12.

John operates a tailoring business in Nyahururu which he has been operating for ten years. He earns a monthly income of KES. 4,000. He has applied for his first loan of KES. 30,000 from VisionFund Kenya. He plans to use the loan to boost his business by buying more materials. He anticipates to use the gains from his business to pay his loan, educate his children and boost his business as well.

loans.use: to buy more material for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a 36 year old married woman. She has 2 children, 2 and 5 years of age. She operates a retail business where she sells beauty salon products. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located in a strategic place. She describes her biggest business challenge to be low capital. 

Margaret will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more beauty products to sell. Her business goal is to expand within 5 years. She hopes that, in the future, she will improve her living standards. This is her first loan with SMEP. she will use the anticipated profits to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy more beauty products to sell

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is a farmer living in Nkubu area of Eastern Kenya. He has been doing farming for the past 8 years where his primary income source is milk, crops(Horticultural farming). In farming, he loves horticultural farming, which he says gives him enough money to improve his family's living standards. His biggest challenge is lack of enough money to buy farming supplies.

Moses chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because they offer low interest rates on their loans. During the training, he learned how to develop a savings culture. Through purchasing water pipes, his crops will do well and increase his income and thus, his family's living standards will improve.

loans.use: to purchase water pumps and pipes.

loans.name: Dzame

texts.en:
This is Dzame. She appreciates Kiva lenders for their financial support. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to buy more cereals for her business. She has been in this business for years now, and it keeps on growing. 

Dzame would like to apply for loan, to purchase maize and beans for resale. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

loans.use: to purchase maize and beans for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more rice, salt, maggi (bouillon) cubes, red oil, etc., for her business,

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothes, blankets and footwear.

loans.name: Allan

texts.en:
This is 32-year-old Allan. He is a Zoona mobile money transfer business owner. His business deals in the receiving and sending of money. Allan opted to write his own Kiva loan profile. This is his story:

My name is Allan and I have received two loans from Kiva. Now, I am requesting my third loan. First off, I would like to thank the lenders who have enabled me to grow my business. A great motivation of mine is to create a life filled with opportunities. This is what keeps me strong and focused in all that I do.  

The previous loans I received through Kiva helped me grow my business. Prior to getting a loan I had one Zoona outlet, now I have three outlets and plan to open two more. My business has been positively impacted by the ability to increase my working capital through loans.  

With the first loan I managed to open two additional shops and help my community build a bus stop shelter. The loans have also had a positive impact on my family. I have managed to send my brother and two cousins to school. In November of this year I am having my wedding as well. These loans have been a true blessing. My desire is to create a better life for my family, to be a role model for them, and to allow them to see the opportunity that comes from hard work. I will use this third loan to expand my businesses by adding more working capital to my shops, which will provide me with additional income. This will also improve service to customers and my community.

loans.use: to grow his mobile money business to service more customers in his community who need financial services.

loans.name: Ozoda

texts.ru: Озода любящая жена, любимая мама двоих сыновей, свекровь двоих невестки и бабушка шестерых внуков. Озода со всеми членами семьи дружно живет в одном доме на районе Хуросон. В их семьи главное взаимопонимание и дипломатия, что особенно важно для такой большой семьи. Озода по маленькому помогает мужу и детям обеспечивать семью. Она держит во дворе скотов, чтобы они обеспечивали детей и взрослых молоком и мясом. Полностью обеспечить такую большую семью трудно и Озода хочет внести свой вклад в семейный бюджет. Она решилась обратиться за кредитом для купли телят. Озода будет разводить телят на скотном дворе. Она надеется, что с Вашей помощью ей удастся заработать и улучшить жилищные и жизненные условия.
texts.en: Ozoda is a loving wife, a beloved mother to two sons, a mother-in-law to two daughter-in-laws and a grandmother to six grandchildren. Ozoda and all of the members of her family live harmoniously in one house in the Khuroson District. In their family, mutual understanding and diplomacy are key because these values are especially important for such a large family. Ozoda helps her husband and children provide for their family a little bit. She houses cattle in the backyard so that they can provide the children and adults with milk and meat. It is difficult to completely provide for such a large family and Ozoda wants to make a contribution to the family's budget. She decided to request a loan to buy calves. Ozoda will raise the calves in the barnyard. She hopes that, with your help, she will succeed in earning money and improve her house and living conditions.

loans.use: to buy calves.

loans.name: Boniface

texts.en:
Boniface is 29 years old and is from Nyahururu. He is married and blessed with one child who is three years old.

Boniface owns and operates a retail shop in Nyahururu town. He has been in the business for five years and earns a monthly income of 20,000 Kenya shillings (KES). He has applied for his second loan of 54,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya. He plans use the funds to boost his business.

He anticipates to use the gains from his business to pay his loan, boost his business, and take of family expenses. In the future he hopes to expand his retail business and better his living standards.

loans.use: To buy more stock for his retail shop.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is a married woman with seven children who are adults. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

Asha operates a food-making business, making consumables like beans and chapati (flat bread) for sale to passersby and neighbors.

With the loan, she wants to purchase food items such as wheat flour, cooking oil, sugar, and beans. She dreams of expanding her business to earn more income and establish a restaurant in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase food items such as wheat flour, cooking oil, sugar, and beans.

loans.name: Anne

texts.en:
Anne is asking for a loan because she believes that through it she will improve her business. The previous loan enabled her to to save money in her salon business. Anne is requesting a loan to purchase weaves, braids, shampoos for her business.

Anne feels that she was able to make a good investment with her previous loan, which to date has allowed her to maintain her level of profits to help her family cover their personal expenses.

loans.use: to purchase weaves, braids, shampoos for her business.

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en:
Dorcas is a 47 year old woman. She describes herself to be flexible. She operates a farm where she grows potatoes. Her business is located in a productive place. She describes her biggest business challenge to be frost in the area. 

Dorcas will use the KES 10,000 loan to buy seeds, fertilizer and other farm inputs. Her business goal is to expand her farm within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will do large scale farming. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Mejumaa

texts.en:
Mejumaa is a married woman with six children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity, nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For over five years, she has operated a fruits and vegetable stall business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. She dreams of establishing a grocery store in the future.

With the loan, she wants to purchase stock of green vegetables, fruit, tomatoes, potatoes and onions. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of green vegetables, fruit, tomatoes, potatoes and onions.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a television, PlayStation game CD, etc. to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more onions, rice, pepper salt etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase soap for her business.

loans.name: Joses

texts.en:
Joses lives and does farming in Nkubu area of Eastern Kenya. He is married and has one child. He loves farming and has been in it for 10 years with his primary income source being milk, maize, bananas. His biggest challenge is insufficient water.

Joses said that he chose Juhudi Kilimo because they will enable him to realize his dreams of being the best farmer in the country in the next five years. During the training, he learned how to develop a savings culture. This loan will ensure that there is a constant supply of water on his farm. This will improve productivity and income will increase as well. This will improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: to purchase water pump and pipes.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella is a 32-year-old single woman. She has three children with ages ranging from 2 years to 8 years. She describes herself to be determined. 

She operates a restaurant where she cooks food for sale. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in a conducive environment, and her primary customers are small-scale customers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be low returns. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy ingredients for preparing the food she sells. 

Her business goal is to be successful within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be prosperous. 

This is her second loan with SMEP. Her previous loan of KES 20,000 was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for preparing the food she sells.

loans.name: Muhache

texts.en:
Muhache is a married and has six children: four in school, one adult and one underage. She owns a house that has neither electricity, nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

She has operated a fish selling business for the last four years, selling at the market to her neighbors’ and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the loan, she wants to purchase more stock of fish for her business. She decided to join Yehu to acquire financial services for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of fish for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more lappa (fabric) for her business,

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase flour and to renovate his workplace.

loans.name: Qemal

texts.en:
Qemal wants to build a fence around his agricultural land, and this loan will help him achieve his goal.

Qemal is married and has three children. Agriculture/livestock is the activity that he has been pursuing for a very long time. He has three milk cows and two dynym or 2,000 square meters of agricultural land area and grapevines. Not only does he sell fresh produce and homemade wine to the locals, but he also has a full-time job with the water supply company. 

“Living not far from the main city where we sell most of our products makes it easier for us; it takes not more than one hour walking from our village. There are villagers who have transportation vehicles; hence, we use them to transport our goods,” said Qemal.

loans.use: to build a fence around his agricultural land.

loans.name: Daysi Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Daysi, es una empresaria de éxito, soltera con 30 años de edad, comercializa prendas de oro y plata al crédito en su localidad, administrando ella misma su negocio, y tiene 6 años de existir su negocio. El crédito lo necesita para invertir en prendas de oro y plata como anillos, brazaletes, pulseras de manos, pulseras de pies, cadenas, chapas etc. debido a que tiene una demanda amplia de estos productos.
texts.en:
Daysi is a successful business woman.  She is single and 30 years old.  She sells gold and silver jewelry on credit in her store.  She runs the business herself, and it has been open for six years.

She is in need of the loan to invest in gold and silver jewelry such as rings, bangles, bracelets, anklets, chains, metal taps for shoes, etc, as she has a high demand for these products.

loans.use: invest in the purchase of gold and silver jewelry such as chains, bangles, bracelets, anklets, metal taps for shoes and rings.

loans.name: Gulkaka

texts.ru: Гулкаке 64 года, вдова, одна воспитывает 3 детей. У Гулкаки - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Гулкака занимается животноводством, стартовав 20 лет назад, с покупки скота на 20,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Гулкаки, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, 5 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 23,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Гулкака обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом -на покупку овец для откорма с последующей реализацией на рынке по высокой цене. Доходы от кредита Гулкака планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en: Gulkaka is 64 years old, a widow, and is raising three children alone. Gulkaka has a secondary education. As the main source of income for her family, Gulkaka practices livestock breeding. She started this business 20 years ago, with an initial purchase of cattle in the amount of 20,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Gulkaka's hard work, she currently has one dairy cow and 5 sheep on her farm. Her monthly income is 23,000 som (KGS). For the purpose of further developing her business, Gulkaka turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." She is requesting a loan to buy sheep to fatten up for re-sale on the market at a good price. Gulkaka plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further acquisition of livestock.

loans.use: to buy sheep for fattening up and reselling.

loans.name: Rolando

texts.es: Don Rolando es originario de la comarca Tule Oriental en la ciudad de Boaco, casado y padre de seis hijos. Tiene 57 años de edad. Es de oficio Agricultor, se dedica a la siembra de Maíz, Frijoles, Malanga y Café. Inicio su negocio con las tierras que le dejo su papa y poco a poco fue obteniendo ingresos que le han permitido mejorar las condiciones de su hogar. Su meta próxima es terminar la cosecha de Café, Maíz y Malanga. Solicita el crédito para comprar: Abono y Alambre de púa para mejorar el cerco de la finca de café. Estima que el crédito le será de mucha ayuda ya que podrá comprar el abono necesario y mejorar su producción. Su plan futuro es mejorar la infraestructura de su casa.
texts.en:
Rolando is a native of the Tule Oriental region in the city of Boaco.  He is married and has six children.  He is 57 years old.  He works as a farmer, and is devoted to growing corn, beans, malanga and coffee.  He started this business with the land that his father left him and little by little, he started earning an income that allowed him to improve his living conditions.  His next goal is to finish his coffee, corn and malanga harvests.

He is seeking a loan to purchase manure and barbed wire to improve the fence around his coffee farm.  He believes that the loan will be very helpful as he will be able to purchase the manure that he needs to improve his production.  His plan for the future is to improve the infrastructure of his house.

loans.use: purchase manure and barbed wire to improve the fence around his coffee farm.

loans.name: Wala

texts.en:
Wala is 25 years old. She is a single lady living in a sector in Jordan called Irbid with her six siblings and her parents. She is a university student majoring in Communication Engineering. She is in her fourth year, and is only one step closer to graduation. 

She is planning to work in her study field after graduation to help her family financially, because they don’t have enough money to pay for her upcoming semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for her upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Tafil

texts.en:
Tafil is an ethnic Egyptian and a father of nine children. As seen in the picture, even though not very clear due to the lack of electricity when the photograph was taken, he runs a blacksmith shop. He wants to invest the loan he is requesting now on an electric motor.
 
Tafil also sells fresh veggies and fruits and sometimes eggs in the farmers' market of their nearby town.
 
A bit about Tafil’s village: traditional food is the rice pilaf made in a clay pan and homemade pies with cheese, spinach or leeks. As for the agricultural products, some of the most planted and harvested are oats, corn, wheat, onions, garlic, onions and okras.

loans.use: to buy an electric motor for his blacksmith shop.

loans.name: Hannah Nyambura

texts.en:
Hannah is 31 years old from Nyahururu. She is married to Michael and they are blessed with two children, aged 10 and 5 years old.

She is a poultry farmer, a business she has been running for the last three years. To enable her to buy poultry feed, she has applied for her first loan of KES 40,000 from VisionFund Kenya.

Her monthly income right now is KES 25,000, and she has plans on using the anticipated profits from her expanded business to educate her children and  pay her loan back to VisionFund Kenya

In the future, she hopes to be a successful farmer.

loans.use: to buy poultry feeds.

loans.name: Sharofat

texts.ru: Шарофат много лет не имела источника дохода. Так как ее муж имеет маленький доход и не в состоянии обеспечить своих детей со всеми не обходимыми средствами. Дети год за годом требуют больше благ. Шарофат решила организовать бизнес скотоводством, так как она с детства помогала родителям по скотоводству. Она узнала о курсе «Добейся Успеха» организованной Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и участвовала на этом курсе и получила много позитива для себя. После завершения курса она получила сертификат. Теперь она готова начать бизнес, однако она не имеет денег, чтобы купить скот. Скот она будет держать дома, где она имеет большой коровник. Она планирует купить скот, пересматривать несколько месяцев и перепродавать на местном рынке. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 1000 сомони для покупки скота. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Sharofat has not had her own source of income for many years. As her husband has a small income, they are not in the position to provide their children with all of the essentials. Year by year, her children demand more amenities. Sharofat decided to organize a cattle raising business, as she has helped her parents since childhood raise cattle. She learned about the course "Achieve Success" which was organized by the Associate of Businesswomen. She took part in this course and receiving many positive benefits for herself. After completing the course, she received a certificate. Now she is ready to start her own business, however she does not have enough money to buy cattle. She will house the cattle at her home, where she has a big cowshed. She plans to buy cattle, look after them for several months, and then resell them at the local market. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 1,000 somoni to buy cattle. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy cattle to start her new business.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a 36-year-old single woman. She has two children with ages ranging from 5 years to 11 years. She describes herself to be industrious. She operates a retail business where she sells shoes, vacuum flasks, cups, and other items. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in an area with potential, and her primary customers are regular customers. 

She describes her biggest business challenge to be changes in season. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of cups, vacuum flasks, and other items. Her business goal is to have a wholesale business within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will sustain her family through the business. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of cups, vacuum flasks, and other items.

loans.name: Alima

texts.en:
Alima lives in the coastal region of Kenya. She is a widowed woman with five children who are adults. She lives in her own house that neither has electricity nor piped water.

She sells makuti (roof-thatch materials made from palm leaves) and has been in this business for the past five years.

She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She is requesting a loan to purchase more makuti for resale. She expects to do this without any difficulties and continue working without any problems.

loans.use: to purchase more makuti for resale.

loans.name: Jumagul

texts.ru: Жумагул 25 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 3 детей. У Жумагул - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Жумагул занимается животноводством, стартовав 6 лет назад, с покупки скота на 50,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Жумагул, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 8 дойных коров, 1 лошадь, 22 овцы. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Жумагул обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом - на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Жумагул планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на дальнейшее обучение детей.
texts.en: Jumagul is 25 years old, married, and together with her husband, is raising three children. Doktur has a secondary education. As the main source of income for her family, Jumagul practices livestock breeding. She started this business 6 years ago with an initial purchase of cattle in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Jumagul's hard work, she currently has 8 milk cows, 1 horse, and 22 sheep on her farm. Her monthly income is 10,000 som (KGS). For the purpose of further developing her business, Jumagul turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." She is requesting a loan to buy cows to increase the size of her herd. Jumagul plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further acquisition of livestock. She also intends to save money for her children's future education.

loans.use: to buy cows.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase tools and raw material for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en: Fatima was born in 1970. She is a married woman, living in a sector in Jordan called Zarqa. She is a mother of three, and one of them is married. Her husband is a mechanic. One of Fatima's daughters is a university student majoring in Business Administration. She is in her first year, which is the beginning of her study journey. Because of the financial struggle Fatima and her husband have been facing, they can't pay for their daughter's upcoming semester fees. Because of that, Fatima has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fish, rice, oil, onion, and meat etc. for her business.

loans.name: Sitan

texts.fr:
Mme SITAN est âgée de 36 ans a 2 enfants et réside avec son mari dans une famille traditionnelle à KEBILA, une des sous-préfectures  de la 3eme région  administrative du MALI. Mme SITAN s’est vite intéressée aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment à l’achat et vente d’habits .Sa vente se fait à KEBILA chez elle à la maison, au marché et souvent de façon ambulante à travers la ville de KEBILA.  
Forte de ses 6 années d’expérience dans le domaine, Elle collabore avec Soro Yiriwaso pour augmenter  son fonds de commerce afin de satisfaire sa clientèle qui ne cesse de grandir et est à son  deuxième  prêt. Mme SITAN compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 20 dizaines pour enfants et 40 pagnes  pour femmes. EIle s’approvisionne à BAMAKO.EIle effectue ses ventes au comptant et parfois à crédit. Sa clientèle est composée de femmes.
Mme SITAN espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 90.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour  subvenir aux besoins de la famille, rembourser le prêt et réinvestir dans les activités.
texts.en:
Sitan is 36 years old, has 2 children, and lives with her husband in a traditional family in Kebila, one of the sub-districts of the third administrative region of Mali. Sitan became interested in business early on, specifically the purchase and sale of clothing.

She makes her sales in Kebila from her home, as well as from the market and door-to-door around the city of Kebila. With 6 years of experience in her field, Sitan partnered with Soro Yiriwaso to increase her business capital and to better meet the needs of her growing customer base. She is now on her second loan.

Sitan plans to use her loan to purchase 20 children's outfits and 40 pieces of "pagne" cloth for women. She stocks up in Bamako. She makes her sales for cash and sometimes for credit. Sitan's cusotmer base is made up of women. She hopes to earn a monthly profit of 90,000 francs CFA which she will use to provide for the needs of her family, to repay the loan, and to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to purchase clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase galvanized metal sheets and wooden poles to build a roof for her home.

loans.name: Sembrando Esperanza Group

texts.es: El grupo “Sembrando Esperanza” está conformado por socios trabajadores y entusiastas quienes se dedican a diversas actividades del comercio minorista. Elena tiene 41 años de edad y es soltera con 03 hijos. Ella se dedica a la venta de frutas como palta chirimoya manzana. También realiza la venta de carrizo para la elaboración de arreglos florales. Desea alquilar un local donde pueda expender su producto. El crédito lo invertiría en la compra de frutas como palta chirimoya manzana para su negocio. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el préstamo brindado. Elena es la segunda persona del lado izquierdo viste polo de color verde claro.
texts.en:
The Sembrando Esperanza group is made up of hardworking and enthusiastic members who have a variety of jobs in the retail business.

Elena is a 40-year old woman, single, and has three children. She sells fruit such as avocados, chirimoya, and apples. She also sells reeds for use in flower arrangements. Elena wishes to rent premises where she can display her products. She plans to use the loan money to buy fruit such as avocados, chirimoya, and apples for her business.

The group thanks Kiva lenders for this loan. Elena is the second person on the left and is wearing a pale green top.

loans.use: buy avocados, chirimoya, and apples

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is 21 years old. He lives in a sector of Jordan called Irbid with his family, which consists of six family members. Mohammad is now a university student majoring in Finance and Management Science. He is in his third year. He noticed his family struggling financially during this period so he has applied for an educational loan to pay for his upcoming semester fees in order to find a good job after graduation.

loans.use: to pay for his semester fees.

loans.name: Yusra

texts.en:
Yusra was born in 1968. She is married and a mother of six. Her husband is a retired man. Yusra decided to help her husband improve their living conditions. 

Eight years ago, she started making yogurt and cheese at her house and selling them from a room there. Now, she needs to buy a larger quantity of the materials she needs to be more productive. But she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To buy more materials that are needed for making yogurt and cheese.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is married with six children and three of her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of any additional family members. She has a business of selling used bras and clothes. 

She has applied for a loan of 700,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more bales of used bras and dresses. She has been in this business for 7 years working in the market six days out of every week and sells on wholesale only. She generates additional income from farming. Her major business challenges include the rainy season which hinders her customers to reach out to her and thieves. 

She is aspiring to import used clothes and also to get enough profits so as to build her own house. She decided to join MCDT SASCCO because of low interest charged. She resides in a rented house and the family has no access to electricity or piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fee and rent.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Virgen Maria De Inquilpata Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “VIRGEN MARIA DE INQUILPATA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Anta, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Roxana ella es conviviente y tiene 26 años y tiene 1 hijo; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta y crianza de animales, la socia cría los cuyes y gallinas los hace crecer y engordar y luego los vende en las diferentes ferias, por medio de este pequeño negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los cuyes y gallinas. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar cuyes y gallinas y alimentos para los cuyes y gallinas.

Las socias que estan pegadas a la foto grupal se les tomo la foto despues de la reunion porque pidieron permiso por motivos de trabajo.
 
 Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de animales, negocio de agricultura, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de queso.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the "Virgen Maria de Inquilpata" communal bank.  This bank is located in the Anta district, which belongs to the Anta province in Cusco.  The member Roxana is 26, lives with her partner and has a son.  The member works in her business of selling and raising animals.  She raises guinea pigs and chickens.  She makes them grow and fattens them, later she sells them in different fairs.  Through this small business, she has been able to get her children ahead.  Her dream is to have her own retail space where she can sell the chickens and guinea pigs.  The member is seeking a loan to purchase guinea pigs and chickens as well as food for the guinea pigs and chickens.  

The other members have businesses selling animals, farming, grocery stores, and selling cheese.  The member is grateful for those who are a part of this dream through this loan, and she is committed to making the payments according to the the established schedule.

loans.use: purchase guinea pigs and chickens, as well as food for the guinea pigs and chickens.

loans.name: Maritza Del Socorro

texts.es: Doña Maritza, es una mujer trabajadora que lucha a diario para darle los estudios a sus hijos, los cuales son dos los que se encuentran estudiando y tiene una bebita de 5 meses, ella se dedica a la actividad de comercialización de queso, el cual una parte lo elabora  de la leche que produce su  propio ganado, siendo una pequeña productora, junto a su esposo intenta salir adelante con su negocio solicitando este crédito  para invertir en 12 quintales de queso y con su producción aumentar las ventas, para mejorar su economía.
texts.en:
Sra. Maritza is a hardworking woman who makes a great effort every day so her children can go to school. Two of them are students and the third is a 5-month old baby.

Maritza sells cheese, some of which she makes from the milk produced by her own cows. Together with her husband she wants to grow the business so she is seeking a loan to buy 12 hundredweight of cheese so she can increase sales and improve her income.

loans.use: buy 12 hundredweight of cheese

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more soap and cosmetics for her business.

loans.name: Ghada

texts.en:
Ghada was born in 1974. She is married and a mother of six. Her husband works in agriculture, and he was the only provider for her family until she decided to help him to improve their living conditions.  

Two years ago, Ghada opened a small food market in a room in her house. Now, she needs to buy a kiosk near her house where she can offer her products and attract more customers. But she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To buy a kiosk where she can sell her products near her house.

loans.name: Santos

texts.es: Don Santos es originario de la comarca La Laguna en la ciudad de Boaco, viudo y padre de seis hijos ya independientes. Tiene 72 años de edad. Es de oficio Agricultor, se dedica a la siembra de Maíz y Frijol. Inicio su negocio con la ayuda de su papa quien le dejo de herencia unas manzanas de tierra para cultivo y fue así como poco a poco fue prosperando económicamente. Su meta próxima es preparar el terreno para la siembra de Frijol y Maíz. Solicita el crédito para comprar: Abono e insumos agrícolas para el cultivo de frijol. Estima que el crédito le será de mucha ayuda ya que podrá mejorar la producción de sus cultivos y así mejorar sus ingresos. Su plan futuro es comprar unos cerditos.
texts.en:
Sr. Santos is from the La Laguna part of the town of Boaco. He is a widower and the father of seven grown up children. He is 72 years old and works on the land growing corn and beans. 

Santos started his business with help from his father from whom he inherited several acres of land on which to grow crops. This is how he gradually prospered economically.

His next task is to prepare the land ready for planting corn and beans. He is seeking a loan to buy manure and other supplies for his bean crop. He believes that the money will be a great help to him and he will be able to increase production and income as a result. In the future Santos would like to buy some piglets.

loans.use: buy manure and other supplies for his bean crop

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en:
Mohammed is now 29 years old. He is a married man who lives in Sana'a, Yemen. He was able to take a loan last year to buy more goods for his grocery. He warmly thanks Kiva lenders who helped him in his first loan. That loan helped him very much in developing his grocery store and purchasing more goods as you can see in the photo. His profits  also increased since he become able to meet the demands of different types of customers. 

After he successfully repaid all the installments, he is requesting to take another loan to expand his business more and more by purchasing more goods.

loans.use: to buy more grocery products to offer to his clients.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “BUENA VISTA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Huayopata, perteneciente a la provincia de La Convención y departamento de Cusco.

La socia Rosa se sigue dedicando al negocio de agricultura, la socia tiene un terreno donde cultiva café, cacao  y platanos, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 hasta las 5:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender el cafe.La socia solicita el crédito para comprar semillas y fertilizantes.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the Communal Bank “Buena Vista”, which is located in the District of Huayopata in La Convención Province, Department of Cusco.

She continues to manage an agricultural business. Rosa has a plot of land on which she grows coffee, cacao, and bananas. She works from 8:00 A.M. to 5:00 P.M. Rosa has been in this business for several years and is doing very well. Her dream is to have a shop where she can sell her coffee.

Rosa is requesting a loan in order to buy seeds and fertilizers. She is pleased with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Sameera

texts.en:
Sameera was born in 1966. She is married and is a mother of three children. Her husband is a security man and he was the only provider for the family. 

Sameera noticed her husband's weak source of income which was not helping him cover his children's needs. So six years ago, she decided to help him by starting her business, selling fabrics and clothes in a room in her house. 

Now, she needs to expand her business by making closets where she can keep her products, so she can purchase a new collection of them. But, she doesn't have enough money to do so. Because of that, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to make closets where she can store her products.

loans.name: Justine

texts.en:
Justine is widowed and has two children, one of whom goes to school. She also takes care of her mother. Justine has a retail shop business and has been in this business for 10 years. She generates additional income from farming.  Justine works in the shop seven days out of every week and sells on both a retail and wholesale basis. Her major business challenges include seasonality and defaulters. She aspires to own a supermarket and also to sell at wholesale only.

Justine has applied for a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan shilling from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of blue band margarine, wheat flour, boxes of mineral water, and jerrycans of cooking oil. She decided to join MCDT-SACCO because they are cooperative. Justine resides in the family house and the family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent for her business and school fees for her last born child.

loans.use: To buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of blue band margarine, wheat flour, boxes of mineral water, and jerrycans of cooking oil

loans.name: Xhume

texts.en:
Xhume is an Egyptian Albanian mother of three children and she has been photographed with the youngest one in the cradle. Kindly note that in some rural areas amongst the poor children are raised in a cradle up until they are six months old.  Xhume recycles scrap metal for cash. Her husband is disabled and so is one of the two other children.

Xhume has recently built a little family home and she wants to install doors and windows. She is almost begging for lenders’ financial assistance. Here is what she said during her interview with the field staff: “It’s been very cold inside here, and the children cry a lot at night due to the cold. I try to cover them with old blankets, but they breathe cold. How can they stop? I don’t want the kids to continue sleeping in the cold and I would very much appreciate lenders’ help.”

loans.use: to install doors and windows in their little family home

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for her  business.

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan is married with two children and both her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. Joan has a beauty salon business and she has been in this business for six years. 

She has applied for a loan of UGX 700,000 (Uganda shillings) from  Micro Credit for Development and Transformation SACCO (MCDT SACCO) to buy more boxes of cream relaxers, weaves, braids, and hair oils. She doesn’t have any other income-generating activity. Her major business challenges include transportation and inconsistent electricity. 

She aspires to own a fully-stocked beauty salon and also to own a bridal salon. She resides in the family house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more boxes of cream relaxers, weaves, braids, and hair oils.

loans.name: Siguidolo Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe SIGUIDOLO est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 47 ans, et 4 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de Nala II, commune de Falako, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font la restauration, le commerce de céréale, de condiment, de la patate, d’igname, d’habillement, et du beignet. Les femmes du groupe SIGUIDOLO sont à leur deuxième prêt solidaire. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO.
La cliente Kadia   la personne au milieu dans le rang debout est analphabète, elle est actuellement vendeuse de beignet de haricot. Elle compte acheter 100 kg de haricot et du beurre de karité sur place avec les paysans du village. La vente se fait en espèce au marché du village et à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 10 000Fcfa, qui sera injecté dans l’élevage de petits animaux.
texts.en:
The group Siguidolo consists of married women. They are on average 47 years old and have 4 children. The all live in traditional families in the village of Nala II, Dioïla prefecture, Koulikoro region (second administrative region of the republic of Mali).

They met through family, neighborhood and friendship ties. They do catering, sell cereals, condiments, potatoes, yams, clothing and doughnuts. The women of the Siguidolo group are on their second group loan. With the goal of meeting the enormous demands of their clientele, they are appealing to Soro Yiriwaso.

The client Bintou, the person in the middle of the row of standing people, is illiterate. She currently sells doughnuts made from beans. She plans to buy 100 kg of beans and shea butter locally from the village farmers. She sells for cash at the village market to a mixed clientele. She plans to make a monthly profit of 10,000 FCFA, which will be reinjected in the breeding of small animals.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make doughnuts.

loans.name: Straton

texts.en: Straton is 34 years old. He is a father of three and they all go to school. He sells foodstuffs and has spent three years in the business. With the loan, he would like to buy more cassava, beans, sorghum and peanuts for sale. He plans to use the profits for making savings.

loans.use: to buy more cassava, beans and sorghum to sell

loans.name: Josphine

texts.en:
This is Josphine. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to buy more stock for her food stall. She appreciates Kiva lenders for their financial support. 

She would like to apply for a loan, this time to buy more stock of wheat flour, maize flour, and rice for her business.

She joined Yehu to boost her business. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

loans.use: to buy more stock of wheat flour, maize flour, and rice for her business.

loans.name: Fadia

texts.en: Fadia was born in 1981. She is married and the mother of four children. Her husband is an electrician and was the only provider for the family until she realized that his income was not enough to cover their family's needs.  Three years ago, she started sewing at home, making clothes and selling them. This business was profitable for her. Now she is requesting a loan to help her expand her business by buying a new sewing machine in addition to fabric to raise her productivity.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more fufu for her business.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam was born in 1976. She is a married woman, living in a sector of Jordan called Deiralla with her four children and her husband who works for a government entity. 

Mariam started financially helping her husband for one year by selling blankets. She noticed that this business was profitable and she decided to expand it. 

Now, she needs to add home products to her business in order to attract more customers. But, she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to add more home products to her business.

loans.name: Baloon Bay Group

texts.en:
These members are part of a group called Baloon Bay. They are married women who live with their husbands and children in nuclear families. They are, on average, 32 years old and have two children. These three women live in the same neighborhood near one another and are friends. The women sell secondhand clothing, fish (tilapia), cooking pots, slippers and coal pots. In order to increase their working capital, the group has decided to work with the field partner ID Ghana. This will be their second group loan.

Ernerstina (standing in the middle of the photo) is well known for cooking pots, slippers and coal pots. She will buy cooking pots, slippers and coal pots from Accra with her loan. She will then sell the items at her residence. Ernestina hopes to earn good monthly profit, and this will be reinvested into her business and used to provide for the smaller expenses of her children.

loans.use: To buy cooking pots, slippers and coal pots from Accra with her loan.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more home products to sell

loans.name: Ivan

texts.en:
Ivan, aged 43, lives in Fort Portal, Uganda. He has thee children, one of whom attends school. 

He is a teacher by profession and also deals in motorcycle transportation, with a retail shop for additional income. He ventured into these businesses to have several sources of income to aid him in improving on his family and their social well-being. 

Ivan faces a difficulty of inadequate capital to implement all his plans, and he intends to use the loan to buy doors and plaster his house.

loans.use: to buy doors and plaster his house.

loans.name: Emelinda Group

texts.en:
Magdaong is the featured borrower of Emelinda group. In acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, she chose to join two group members that she has been best friends with since they arrived to work in Lebanon.

Magdaong is a forty-three-year-old single mother who works as a house keeper to provide her beloved child with the necessary standard of living. She is a hard worker who has an agricultural business back in her hometown in the Philippines, which her beloved parents are taking good care of, and she is working hard to support it properly from Lebanon. Today she is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, to support her agriculture business back in the Philippines with the necessary seeds and fertilizers and essential agricultural supplies.  This will help her make sure that her own business will develop properly so that when she decides to go back home her agriculture business will cover her family's needs. 

Magdaong is the first lady from the left with a white top. As for the other group members, Emlinda is the lady at the center and Judelyn is on the right.

loans.use: To support her agriculture business back in the Philippines with the necessary seeds and fertilizers and essential agricultural supplies

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 26-year-old married man who has been working as a mechanic for ten years. Mohamad started working early to support his beloved family in their living; that's why he has very good experience and special talent in his field.

Today, Mahamad is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to buy necessary furniture requested to fullfil his house's needs.

Mohamad is working hard to start his own business in the future, to make sure that he can develop his career path. He is working hard to make it a dream come true through buying the necessary business items gradually. 

He will make sure to expand his business sector to cover almost all of his family's needs and requests.

loans.use: to buy necessary furniture requested to fullfil his house's needs.

loans.name: José Marcos

texts.es:
José tiene 51 años de edad, desafortunadamente solo estudió hasta sexto grado en la escuela, ahora él está acompañado  y su pareja se dedica a los oficios domésticos, tiene 5 hijos de los cuales 4 estudian y uno no porque está muy pequeño, por lo tanto su pareja y sus hijos son los únicos que dependen de él.
 
José se dedica a la agricultura desde que tenía 10  años de edad, este trabajo se lo enseño el papá,  pues su padre quería que él y sus hermanos aprendieran este oficio para  que en un futuro se pudieran defender, este trabajo le queda a una distancia de 20 minutos  y él viaja a pie, tiene un horario de trabajo de 6:00 AM a 12:00 MD.

José solicita este préstamo a CrediCampo,  para comprar una computadora a sus hijos que están estudiando, ya que uno estudia en el instituto y la necesita mucho, con el préstamo José podrá cubrir esta necesidad y se sentirá más seguro de que sus hijos no tengan que hacer tareas fuera de casa.
 
Él sueña con que Dios le preste vida para seguir cultivando la tierra y tener como llevar el sustento al hogar, pues la cosecha que en estos momentos está sacando, lo ha logrado con el sudor de su frente, y quiere seguir trabajando para sacar adelante a sus hijos y que se superen sacando una carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
José is 51 years old. Unfortunately, he was only able to complete his education through the sixth grade. He is now married and his partner takes charge of the household duties. José has five children, four of whom are in school while the other one is still too young. His partner and his children are the only people who are dependent on him.

José has been farming since the age of 10. He and his brothers learned the trade from their father so that they would be able to support themselves in the future. José works on a plot of land that is located 20 minutes away, so he must travel on foot. His work schedule is from 6:00 A.M. to 12:00 noon.

José is requesting this loan from CrediCampo so that he can buy a computer for his children who are studying. One child is at a school that assigns a lot of computer work, so José will be able to provide for this need with the loan. He would feel much better knowing that his children did not have to go elsewhere to do their homework.

José dreams that God will allow him to live so that he can continue farming the land in order to provide for his household. He is currently harvesting his crops through the sweat of his brow. José wants to continue working so that his children can get ahead and excel by obtaining a university degree.

loans.use: to buy a computer for his children's studies.

loans.name: Onua Do Group

texts.en:
The Onua Do Group consists of three members who live in the same area. They sell foodstuff, cooking items, roasted plantain, groceries, and dried fish.
Mavis, the featured borrower, is 39 years old and single. She sells groceries, such as rice, bread, eggs, detergent, diapers, sardines, Milo, milk, and sugar, which she has been doing for seven years. 

Mavis is going to invest her loan into buying grocery (rice, bread, eggs, detergent, diapers, sardines, Milo, milk, sugar and sell to customers.

Profit will be re injected into her business in order to increase her cash flow and put into savings.
This is her sixth loan cycle with ID-Ghana and second with kiva.
They will need GHS 2,700 to expand their businesses.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items  such as rice, bread, eggs, detergent, diapers, sardines, Milo, milk, and sugar to sell

loans.name: Nurash

texts.ru: Нураш 65 лет, вдова, после смерти мужа сама воспитала 4 детей. У Нураш - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Нураш занимается животноводством, стартовав 41 год назад, с покупки скота на 1,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Нураш, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы. Ежемесячный доход составляет 17,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Нураш обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом - на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Нураш планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на покупку новой автомашины.
texts.en: Nurash is 65 years old, a widow, and after the death of her husband, raised four children alone. Nurash has a secondary education. As the main source of income for her family, Nurash practices livestock breeding. She started this business 41 years ago, with an initial purchase of cattle in the amount of 1,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Nurash's hard work, she currently has 2 milk cows on her farm. Her monthly income is 17,000 som (KGS). For the purpose of further developing her business, Nurash turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." She is requesting a loan to buy cows to increase the size of her herd. Nurash plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further acquisition of livestock. She also intends to save money to buy a new car.

loans.use: to buy cows.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “BUENA VISTA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Huayopata, perteneciente a la provincia de La Convención y departamento de Cusco.

La socia Francisca se dedica al negocio de venta de golosinas como chupetes,galletas y gaseosas,la socia tiene un kiosko,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m ahsta las 5:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio,el sueño de la socia es tener una tienda de abarrotes.La socia solicita el credito para comprar galletas,dulces y gaseosas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Francisca is a member of the Communal Bank “Buena Vista”, which is located in the District of Huayopata in La Convención Province, Department of Cusco.

She has a business of selling snack foods such as lollipops, cookies, and sodas. Francisca has a kiosk where she works from 8:00 A.M. to 5:00 P.M. She has been in business for several years. Francisca dreams of owning a grocery store.

She is requesting a loan in order to buy cookies, sweets, and sodas. Francisca is pleased with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to buy cookies, sweets, and sodas to sell.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a married man and he has five children. He describes himself as experienced. Peter operates a welding business where he makes metal doors, chairs, and other items. He has been involved in this business for seven years. His primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge as a lack of capital. 

Peter will use this KES 10,000 loan to buy metal bars and other welding materials. His business goal is to be successful within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will be happy. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy metal bars and other welding materials

loans.name: Saed

texts.en:
Saed is a 37-year-old married man. He has a very big family that consists of nine children. He lives with his family in a village outside Sana'a governorate. 

Though he has a small piece of land in his village, he decided to move to Sana'a few years ago to find better work because the income he gets from agriculture is not enough to cover the expenses of his big family. He first worked in a bakery for some years. His ambition was bigger than becoming just a worker. He always wanted to have his own bakery. He worked day and night to make his dream comes true. 

Fortunately, he found a good bakery for sale. He was determined to buy it, especially since the price of the bakery is great. The only problem facing Saed is the money. He doesn’t have enough money, so he applied for a loan in the amount of 2,500,000 YER from Al-Amal Microfinance Bank to purchase the bakery. This bakery will create job opportunities for his sons to work with him, which will reflect positively on the economic situation of his family. It will also enable Saed to have a permanent and good income source and cover all the needs of his family. 

Saed looks forward to making some changes in the bakery to provide better service for his customers and opening other branches in different quarters.

loans.use: to buy a bakery.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a new collection of clothes, home products and cosmetics

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is married and has five children, two of whom go to school. She also takes care of additional family members - her grandchildren. Juliet has a pub business and has been in this business for six years. She generates additional income from selling produce. Juliet works at the market seven days out of every week and sells on a wholesale basis. Her major business challenges include transportation and seasonality.

Juliet has applied for a loan of 900,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more crates of beer, crates of soda, and cartons of mineral water and other spirits. She aspires to own a fully-stocked pub and also to educate her children up to the university level.  Juliet decided to join MCDT-SACCO   because of the low interest charged. She resides in the family house and the family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more crates of beer and soda, and cartons of mineral water and other spirits.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is married, with six children and four of her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. 

She has a business, selling soft drinks and she has been in this business for four years. 

She has applied for a loan of UGX 700,000 (Uganda shillings) from Micro Credit for Development and Transformation SACCO (MCDT SACCO) to buy more bags of passion fruits, crates of soda, boxes of mineral water, straws, and pineapples for making juice. 

Mariam works in the market six days out of every week and she sells on a retail basis. She generates additional income by working as a cleaner for the Kampala City Council. Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves. 

Mariam aspires to open up another branch, selling soft drinks, and also to become a wholesaler. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: to buy more bags of passion fruits, crates of soda, boxes of mineral water, straws, and pineapples for making juice.

loans.name: Rasoo

texts.en:
Rasoo appreciates her previous loan that improved her living standards. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and to earn a higher income.

She would like to apply for a loan to buy more stock of household consumables, wheat flour, maize flour, rice, and sugar. 

She thanks Yehu Microfinance Trust for their financial support.

loans.use: to buy more stock of household consumables, wheat flour, maize flour, rice, and sugar

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha is married and has eight children, two of whom are in school and the rest of whom are adults. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Mwanasha has operated a fish-selling business at the market for the past three years, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. Her major challenge is seasonality in her business.

Mwanasha is requesting a loan to purchase bundles of fish for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans at lower cost to improve her business

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his children's education.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy over sewing machine and fabric.

loans.name: Rafig

texts.en:
Rafig has a cafe where he serves national foods like “xash”, “xengel” and other things to his customers. Also he serves tea in the café. Rafig is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from Fuzuli city. Now he lives with his family in Dilagarda village of Fuzuli region. He is 33 years old, married and has two children. His children go to school.
