Today Rafig wants to support his business. Therefore he needs a loan in an amount of 1,300 Azerbaijan New Manat (AZN). With this he wants to buy products for his cafe. Rafig is greatly thankful to the Kiva organization for all its support.

loans.use: to buy products for his cafe.

loans.name: Yuriy

texts.ru:
Юрий живет и работает в Мелитополе. Он арендует торговую площадь в одном из местных магазинов, реализуя гардинно-тюлевые ткани и фурнитуру. Опыт работы в этой сфере у Юрия составляет уже около 20 лет. 
Юрий планирует приобрести новую партию товара на 15 000 гривен, чтоб обновить и освежить свой ассортимент, а именно купить тюль, шторы, карнизы и всякую фурнитуру, тем самым продолжая развивать свой бизнес.
texts.en:
Yuriy lives and works in Melitopol. He rents a floor space in one of the local stores to sell fabric for lace curtains and fixtures. Yuriy has around 20 years of work experience in this field.

Yuriy plans to purchase a new lot of merchandise for 15,000 hryvnia to refresh and update his collection. Specifically, he will buy curtain lace, drapes, curtain rods and all kinds of fixtures which will effectively expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase curtain lace, drapes, curtain rods and fixtures.

loans.name: Odonchimeg

texts.en:
Using her previous loan, Odonchimeg has renovated her Mongolian traditional ger (portable felt dwelling). Now her husband and two children live in this renovated ger. She has been working as a train attendant since 2010. Her husband has a position of train railroader. 

She is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 MNT (Mongolian tugriks) to grow vegetables such as carrots, cabbages and potatoes on her fenced land. As the weather is warming, it is essential to begin growing vegetables early. Growing vegetables will release oxygen, which is essential for cleaner air. By autumn, vegetables will be grown and the family will feed themselves instead of buying tomatoes, carrots and cabbages from market.

loans.use: to grow potato, carrot and cabbage

loans.name: Natavan

texts.en: Natavan is 39-years-old.  She is married with three children. Her eldest child is 21-years-old, who is studying at the university.  Her other child is 20-years-old, who is studying the first course of college and another is going to the eleventh grade.  Natavan has been in the sewing business for many years.  She sews skirts, blouses, and other women's dresses.  She also sews curtains. She receives periodic orders from her customers and then she prepares the orders. Today, she plans to increase her working capital by buying new materials. For this reason, she is requesting a loan in the amount of 2,100 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat). She is thankful to the Kiva organization for the loan. In the future, she wants to open a curtain store.

loans.use: to buy new materials

loans.name: Tserendejid

texts.en: Tserendejid, 56 years old, lives with her husband and daughter in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has been selling clothes by renting a stall at the trade center since the end of 2013. Before this business, she worked in Korea for twelve years and specialized in tailoring. She is requesting a loan of 3,000 USD to buy a sewing machine and textiles. This will significantly improve their living standard and allow her to afford managing her daughter's illness. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who cares her family deeply.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and textiles.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is a 29-year-old married woman. She has three children. She describes herself as a busy person. 

Lydia operates a retail business where she sells buckets, cups, soap, basins, and other plastic items. She has been involved in this business for seven years. Her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of enough stock. 

She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more stock of bags, cups, buckets, and other items. Her business goal is to open other businesses within five years. 

Lydia hopes that in the future she will have a big business. This is her first loan with SMEP - Deposit Taking Microfinance Limited.

loans.use: to buy more stock of bags, cups, buckets, and other items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more bags, slippers, and lappa (fabric) for her business.

loans.name: Omar

texts.en:
Omar is a 26-year-old single man. He describes himself to be a good time keeper. 

He operates a transportation business in which he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in a busy area and describes his biggest business challenge to be motorcycle breakdown. 

Omar will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy motorcycle spare parts to service his motorcycle. His business goal is to expand within five years. 

He hopes that in the future, he will improve his standard of living. This is his first loan with SMEP - Deposit Taking Microfinance Limited.

loans.use: to buy motorcycle spare parts

loans.name: Richirani

texts.en: Richirani is a 38-year-old female with four children aged 14, 12, seven and three years old whom she supports. This is her fourth loan of KES. 40,000. She was introduced to Vision Fund Kenya by the Vision fund officer. She has a retail shop. Her business is located at Majenjeni. She has been in this business for thirteen years and she earns a monthly income of KES. 7,550. She’s planning to use the loan to purchase more stock to sell to her customers. She will use the profit to expand the business. Her hopes and dreams for the future are to expand her business and educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell to her customers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To do renovations and create a healthy living environment

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay his brother's law degree tuition fees

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce has been running a retail shop business in Kangundo town and has been in the business for 10 years. She is 45 years old, single, and has three children.

She will be using the loan to buy a GoTV digital decoder to upgrade her standard of living and family development. Her business is doing well because of her good clientele. 

This is her seventh loan term and she has been repaying her previous loans successfully. Her future hopes are to be successful and self-reliant.

loans.use: to buy a GoTV digital decoder.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 28-year-old woman from Migori, married to Arphaxad, who is a civil servant and they have one child who is three years old. 

Mary operates a computer repair workshop, a business she’s done for three years now, earning a monthly income of KES 40,000.

Mary is taking  a loan of KES 60,000, this being her fourth loan with VisionFund Kenya, to use to buy a new computer and computer spare parts and chemicals for washing the computers. She will use her profits to expand her workshop.Mary has dreams of opening a mega-workshop and bringing up a happy family.

loans.use: to purchase new computers to sell and new parts to use to repair computers brought by her clients to be repaired.

loans.name: Joycephine

texts.en:
Joycephine is 35 years old, married and, together with her spouse, she has been blessed with two children. She has an egg supply business which she has been running for five years now. Her spouse also provides additional income. 

Joycephine will be using this loan to pay school fees for her child who is in school. 

This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya and her future hopes are to be successful in her business and also to educate her children.

loans.use: To pay school fees for her child.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a youth entrepreneur in Nairobi's,the capital city of Kenya. She was born and raised in Kinangop, a county in Kenya, but moved to Nairobi in search of a job.

Esther noticed recently that there were few sanitation facilities at Muthurwa market and took the initiative to find out whether there was a solution she could provide. She did her research and learnt about Fresh Life toilets. She was impressed by the impact Fresh Life Toilets had brought to the community and gained interest in owning one.

She seeks a loan to help her purchase and run two Fresh Life Toilets. She hopes that her toilets will sort out the sanitation issue and help her improve her livelihood with the income earned.

loans.use: to purchase and run two Fresh Life Toilets

loans.name: Abdugani

texts.ru:
Абдугани позитивный и трудолюбивый мужчина в возрасте 63 лет. Он женат и имеет пятерых детей. Абдугани не имеет высшего образования, и с юного возраста он занимается своим бизнесом. Он занимается необыкновенным делом. Его бизнес это убой скота и продажа мяса. Этот бизнес он ведёт уже много лет и от этого получает хороший заработок.

Абдугани торгует говяжьим и бараньим мясом на базаре, для этого он арендует торговую мясную лавку. В продаже также имеются говяжий и бараний жир, а также он продаёт шерсть от убитого скота обработчикам кожи. Каждую неделю Абдугани покупает скот на убой и продает их мясо. У него уже есть свои постоянные клиенты, люди покупают для потребления, а также закупают мясо в столовые для приготовления пищи. Сейчас Абдугани необходимо закупить несколько голов скота для убоя и дальнейшей продажи,но у него нет достаточной суммы денег, так как все свои сбережения он потратил на свадьбу своего сына. Поэтому Абдугани обратился в Арванд и хочет взять кредит на покупку скота для убоя. Он надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Abdugani is a positive and hardworking 63-year-old man. He is married and has five children. Abdugani does not have a higher education. From a young age, he has been practicing his business. He has an uncommon job. He slaughters cattle and sells the meat. He has run this business for many years already and he makes good earnings from it.

Abdugani sells beef and mutton at the bazaar. He rents a butcher's stall for this purpose. He also sells beef and mutton fat as well as the hides from the slaughtered cattle which can be processed into leather. Every week, Abdugani buys cattle to slaughter and sell their meat. He has his own loyal customers - people buy his meat for personal consumption as well as for dining halls to use for cooking dishes. Now Abdugani must buy several cattle for slaughter and future sale. However, he does not have enough money as he spent all of his savings on his son's wedding. This is why Abdugani is requesting a loan from Arvand to buy cattle for slaughter. He relies on a positive outcome and thanks Arvand in advance for their support.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase bread, rice, peanuts, red oil, pepper, etc. for her business

loans.name: Thandi

texts.en:
Thandi is 50 years old from Nyandarua South. They have two children nine and 18 years old.

Thandi has a farming business, which he has been operating for many years. He has applied for his second loan from Vision Fund Kenya to buy fertilizers and seedlings. Thandi will use the profits to pay school fees for the children.

He hopes to expand his farming in the near future and be able to educate his children well.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seedlings

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to recharge her vaults and to restock food cooking ingredients in the food cafe.

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en:
Dorothy is a 37-year-old married woman. She has four children, with ages ranging from 6 to 14 years old. Dorothy operates a retail business where she sells charcoal. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are reliable. She describes her biggest business challenge as low capital. 

Dorothy will use this KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of charcoal. Her business goal is to expand within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have improved her business and achieved her dreams. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more stock of charcoal

loans.name: Milkah

texts.en:
Milkah is 42 years old from Nyandarua South. They have three children. Milkah has a farming business that she has been doing for many years. 

She has applied for a school fees loan as her first loan from VisionFund Kenya, which she will use part of the loan to pay school fees for her children and use the rest to buy seedlings and fertilizers for use in the farm. Milkah will use the profits to buy a calf. 

She hopes to improve her livelihood and improve her living standards.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children and use the rest to buy seedlings and fertilizers

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en: Khadija is grateful for the support of the loan she got from Kiva. She is again requesting another loan to buy more roofing materials (palm leaves) for resale as this is her source of income.  She appreciates the support.

loans.use: to buy more roofing materials (palm leaves) for resale

loans.name: Jovia

texts.en: Jovia is a 24-year-old married female with two children living in Kasese, Uganda. She has a food business in the market where which she started to have a source of income. Her challenges are competition and lack of a refrigerator to keep her perishable products fresh. Jovia being a hardworking woman has a dream of building a permanent home and is asking for a loan to buy construction materials like cement and sand.

loans.use: to buy construction materials like cement and sand.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 28-year-old married woman. She has two children. She describes herself as capable and full of potential. She operates a retail business where she sells bananas. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in an area with potential and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge as the lack of capital. 

Mary will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of bananas to sell. Her business goal is to be very prosperous within five years. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of bananas

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert lives in Hoima, Uganda. He is 42 years old and married with 10 children, seven of whom attend school. For the last nine years he has been in the produce business. Price fluctuation and weather changes hinder his business. He earns additional income from motorcycle transport, commonly known as 'boda-boda' and rentals. His dream is to build a commercial house in town. Robert needs a loan to buy a piece of land in town.

This client took a photo with a motorcycle because it is the business he does.

loans.use: to buy a piece of land in town.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a divorced woman with no children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food. 

For the past two years, Fatuma has operated a kiosk business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She mentioned seasonality and theft as her major challenges. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With this loan, Fatuma wants to purchase sweets, biscuits, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans, and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase sweets, biscuits, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans, and cooking oil

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a very hardworking and enterprising woman who says that she has been able to greatly increase her income and help her family, thanks to her hard work.

Margaret is asking for a loan to buy ingredients such as wheat flour, maize flour and sugar for her business. She is grateful for the new support she has received.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as wheat flour, maize flour and sugar for her business

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a 34-year-old father of four children aged 12, 7, 5, 5 all attending school. He is a cattle-keeper and a milk trader around Kyakatuuma trading centre. He has worked six days a week and 10 hours day since 1995.

He is also a boda boda cyclist in Kyakatuuma town from which he generates an extra income. He hopes to use the loan to purchase more cows for his business and boost his milk business. He usually supplies his goods to fellow farmers and local people in Kyakatuuma and the surrounding areas.
He however faces a challenge for too much drought which affects his cows leading to low milk yields. He is described as an honest and hard-working man in business.

He requests banks to train them properly on how to use the money and the implications of not paying on time which he thinks will help them grow.

loans.use: To purchase cows.

loans.name: Dildayim

texts.ru: Дилдайым 53 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 6 детей. У Дилдайым - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Дилдайым занимается животноводством, стартовав 19 лет назад, с покупки скота на 1,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Дилдайым, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 1 лошадь, 1 теленок, 15 овец, 3 козы. Ежемесячный доход составляет 12,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Дилдайым обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом - на покупку овец для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Дилдайым планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на строительство нового дома.
texts.en: Dildayim is 53 years old, married, and together with her husband, is raising six children. Dildayim has a secondary education. As the main source of income for her family, Dildayim practices livestock breeding. She started this business 19 years ago, with an initial purchase of cattle in the amount of 1,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Dildayim's hard work, she currently has 2 milk cows, 1 horse, 1 calf, 15 sheep and 3 goats on her farm. Her monthly income is 12,000 som (KGS). For the purpose of further developing her business, Dildayim turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." She is requesting a loan to buy sheep to increase the size of her herd. Dildayim plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further acquisition of livestock. She also intends to save money to build a new house.

loans.use: to buy sheep.

loans.name: Juventud Unida Group

texts.es: El grupo “Juventud Unida” está conformado por 06 socios se encuentran muy contentos por estar pasando al 5 ciclo. Florentina tiene 34 años su estado civil es conviviente con 02 hijos de 15 años y 9 años a los cuales educa. Ella trabaja en la venta de abarrotes y bebidas en su bodega. Se dedica también a las recargas de saldo de celulares .Su mayor deseo es ampliar su negocio construir su vivienda y darle la educación profesional a sus hijos. El préstamo lo invertiría para implementar su bodega con gaseosas y recargas. El grupo agradece el préstamo de los inversionistas de KIVA. Florentina es la segunda persona del lado izquierdo viste un polo manga larga con cuello alto turquesa.
texts.en: The communal bank "Juventud Unida" is made up of 6 members who are very pleased to be entering into their 5th loan cycle.  Florentina is 34 years old.  She lives with a partner and has 2 children aged 15 and 9, who she is educating.  Florentina works selling groceries and beverages from her store.  She also sells cellular phone minutes.  Her main desire is to expand her store so that she can build her house and give her children a professional education.  She will invest this loan in her store, buying soft drinks and cellular recharges.  This group is grateful to the Kiva lenders for this loan. In the photo, Florentina is the second person from the left side, wearing a turquoise long-sleeved turtleneck shirt.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, soft drinks, and cellular phone minutes

loans.name: Husniddin

texts.ru:
Хуснидин жизнерадостный мужчина в возрасте 31 года. Он женат и имеет двоих детей. У него очень дружная семья. Живут они в сельской местности. Чтобы иметь доход в семье, он очень много трудится. Хуснидин работает учителем в местной школе, в свои годы ему удалось получить высшее образование. На этой работе он получает небольшую заработную плату. Но также, чтобы иметь достаточно средств на достойное проживание он занимается собственным бизнесом. Основным и стабильным бизнесом Хуснидина является животноводство.

Он разводит и продаёт скот. В этом деле ему помогает жена. Она ухаживает за скотом, а также продаёт полученное от скота молоко. Бизнес животноводства приносит Хуснидину хороший и стабильный доход. Поэтому он желает расширить этот бизнес. Ему необходимо купить ещё несколько голов скота для выращивания и дальнейшей продажи. Для этого Хуснидин обратился в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку скота. Он надеется, что этот бизнес будет успешно расширяться и приносить больше прибыли, чтобы качественно удовлетворять нужды семьи. Хуснидин заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Husniddin is a cheerful 31-year-old man. He is married and has two children. He has a close-knit family. They live in the countryside. In order to have an income for his family, he works quite a lot. Husniddin works as a teacher as a local school. In his day, he was able to get a higher education. He receives a small salary from this job. In order to have enough money to make a good living, he also has his own business. Husniddin's primary, stable business is cattle raising.

Husniddin raises and sells cattle. His wife helps him with this business. She looks after the cattle and also sells the milk obtained from them. The cattle raising business brings Husniddin a good, stable income. This is why he wants to expand his business. He must buy even more cattle for raising and then selling in the future. This is why Husniddin is requesting a loan from Arvand to buy cattle. He hopes that this business will expand successfully and bring in more profits so that he can do a good job fulfilling his family's needs. Husniddin thanks Arvand in advance for their assistance.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Davidson

texts.en: Davidson is a 27-year-old married man. He has two children, who are 4 and 7. Davidson describes himself as focused. He operates a retail business where he sells timber. He has been involved in this business for 6 years. His business is located in an urban area. He will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more stock of timber. His business goal is to expand within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will be happy. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more stock of timber

loans.name: Agapito

texts.es:
Agapito tiene 43 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el Caserío San Lorenzo que pertenece al distrito de Pucará, su población se dedica a la agricultura especialmente a los cultivos de frutales, arroz y café, comercio de los mismo y ganadería, ubicada a una hora de la ciudad de la Provincia de Jaén que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica al comercio de frutas de estación como lima, naranja, piña, papaya entre otros, su esposa le apoya en esta labor y Agapito también brinda servicio de transporte público en su propia mototaxi, trasladando pasajeros a lugares aledaños y dentro de su distrito, son una familia emprendedora.

Ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 000 nuevos soles para la compra de variedad de fruta de estación para ofrecer a sus clientes y de esta manera hacer crecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Agapito is 43 years old. He lives with his wife and children in the San Lorenzo neighborhood, part of the Pucara district, whose people specialize in farming (particularly fruits, rice, and coffee), commerce, and cattle ranching. It's located about an hour from the Jaen province in the Cajamarca region of Peru, up in the northern mountains.

He sells seasonal fruits, such as limes, oranges, pineapples, and papaya, among others, and his wife helps in him his work. Agapito also provides transportation services with his motor-taxi, carrying passengers both within his district and to more remote areas. They are an enterprising family.

He is requesting this loan for 2000 nuevos soles so that he can buy a variety of fruits in season to sell to his customers and thus grow his business.

loans.use: buy seasonal fruits for resale

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es: María tiene 41 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposo y sus 6 hijos(22, 19, 16, 12, 9 y 3 años de edad). Ella se gana la vida mediante a la venta de quezadillas y pasteles de carne en el mercado central de su localidad. María desea mejorar sus condiciones habitacionales y las de su familia por lo que desea construir el corredor de la vivienda para lo cual solicita este crédito a FUSAI para comprar lámina galvanizada, polines y madera. Espera poder contar con este apoyo dado que no puede hacerlo por su cuenta pero expresa tener la capacidad de pago que el crédito implica.
texts.en: María is 41 years old and lives in her own home with her husband and her six children (ages 22, 19, 16, 12, 9, and 3). She makes a living through the sale of quesadillas and meat pies in the central market of her neighborhood. María wants to improve her and her family's living situation and for this reason, she wants to construct a porch for the house. To do this, she is requesting this loan from FUSAI to buy galvanized metal sheets, rollers, and wood. She hopes to be able to count on this support because she could not do it with her own funds, however, she expresses that she has the capacity required to pay back the loan.

loans.use: to buy galvanized metal sheets, rollers, and wood to construct the roof of her porch.

loans.name: God's Is Good Group

texts.en:
This group is made up of five members who are part of the group called God's is Good from Dansoman. They are all adults from one of the capital towns of Accra in Ghana. They are all hardworking, trustworthy and have been responsible with their repayments of previous loans. The members know each other very well since they come from the same area. This is why they decided to take part in this group, to help each other out economically and invest in their individual businesses. These business include buying and selling general merchandise such as plastic products, secondhand clothing, jewelry, shoes, cosmetics and assorted soaps. 

Phylis, who is the featured borrower of this group, has the responsibility of being a family woman (with a husband and three children). She is a micro-businesswoman who makes a living selling plastic products and groceries through hawking. She starts her work day very early so she can provide a better service to her customers. The purpose of this loan is to have working capital to invest in her business by buying more plastic products and grocery items from the wholesale market. The God's is Good group is very grateful for the support which the Kiva lenders offer to people of limited resources. They will need a total sum of GHS 2,900 to expand their businesses.

loans.use: To buy more plastic products and grocery items from the wholesale market.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy additional goods to sell.

loans.name: Fredy David

texts.es: Con 25 años de edad  David es un joven soltero que vive con sus padres, su mamá trabaja de empleada domestica y su papá tiene un taller de pintura de carros. Él tiene dos actividades, se dedica a criar chanchos y trabaja en una panadería, el crédito lo invertirá comprando chancos que les tiene en la propiedad de su madre ya que él vive con sus padres. David es un joven de mucho empeño y sin malos vicios que aspira que su negocio crezca para mejorar sus ingresos y de esta manera ayudar en los gastos del hogar ya que comenta que así como sus padres le apoyaron, él quisiera devolver esta ayuda. De ser posible en el futuro desea tener una panadería propia.
texts.en:
At 25 years of age, David is a young single man who lives with his parents. His mother works as a domestic employee and his father has a car painting shop. David has two activities: he raises hogs and works in a bakery. The loan will be invested in the purchase of pigs which he keeps on his mother's property since he lives with his parents. 

David is a very enterprising young man with no bad vices. He aspires to have a growing business so that his income will increase and, in this manner, he will be able to help with household expenses. David comments that since his parents helped him, he wants to return their help. 

If it's possible in the future, he wants to have his own bakery.

loans.use: to buy pigs to raise and sell.

loans.name: Ana Cecilia

texts.es: En la ciudad de San Gabriel vive la señora Ana, una mujer casada de 42 años de edad, Ella y su esposo trabajan en su panadería que la tienen ya desde hace 18 años atrás, tienen 5 hijos pero  viven con uno de ellos de 14 años  que está asistiendo al colegio. Para el funcionamiento de la panadería tienen contratado a dos empleados y el crédito lo van a destinar para adquirir materia prima y productos para la elaboración del pan. La meta de Ana es adecuar mejor su negocio, comprar vitrinas y si las ventas mejoran contratar a más empleados. Ella aspira que su hijo vaya a la universidad y se convierta en un profesional.
texts.en: Ana lives in San Gabriel.  She is 42 years old, married and she and her husband work in the bakery they have had for 18 years.  They also have five children but only their 14 year old lives with them and attends high school.  They have two employees at the bakery and will use the money from this loan to buy supplies for baking bread.  Ana’s goal is to better her business, buy display cases, and increase her sales so she can hire more employees.  She wants her son to attend university and become a professional.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Maria Angelica

texts.es: María tiene 55 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a sus dos hijos de 16 y 23 años de edad. María se dedica a la venta de variedad de frutas y verduras en el mercado central de su localidad y es así como lleva el sustento a su hogar. María desea construir una pila para reguardar el agua ya que no cuenta con un lugar adecuado lo que conlleva al desperdicio. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de arena, ladrillo y cemento para proceder a la construcción lo antes posible de la pila.
texts.en:
María, 55, lives in her own house with her two children, ages 16 and 23.  She earns a living and supports her household selling a variety of fruits and vegetables in the main market of her town.

María wants to build a sink because she doesn't have an appropriate place for the water to run.  She's asking FUSAI for a loan to buy sand, bricks, and cement to start building her sink as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy sand, bricks, and cement to build a sink

loans.name: Promesa Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “PROMESA” iniciará el sexto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Senkata, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Rosa es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de comida y api, taller de carpintería, tienda de barrio, venta de fruta, venta de mantas de vicuña, trenzado de mantas, costura de calzado, venta de salteñas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Rosa es integrante, ella indica que hace tres años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de su amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio venta de api (merienda tradicional Boliviana); da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió por iniciativa propia al observar que este producto es muy consumido por las personas.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de api por mayor) que adquirirá de las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializara en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es viuda y tiene cinco hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones que ofrece el personal de la institución.
texts.en:
The communal bank, Promesa will begin it's sixth loan with Pro Mujer as part of the Senkata regional office. The group is made up of nine members and is headed by a board of directors of which Rosa is the president. The businesses that the communal bank members have are varied. Among them are food and api [a purple drink] sales, a carpenter workshop, a local store, fruit sales, vicuña blanket sales, blanket weaving, shoe manufacture, and salteña [meat pie] sales.

The loan they are requesting will benefit these small businesswomen, of which Rosa is one. She relates that three years ago she joined Pro Mujer through the invitation of a friend who is an employee of the institution. Currently, she has a business selling api (a traditional Bolivian drink). She mentions that she started this business through her own initiative after noting that this product is widely consumed. 

The loan she will take out now will be used to increase her capital (purchase api wholesale) which she acquires in the markets in El Alto. Later, after preparing it, she will sell it in her sales space. This work allows her to generate resources to support her family as she is widow and has five children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the trainings that the institution personnel offer.

loans.use: to buy api [a purple corn drink] wholesale.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: Maria vive en una casa de acabado fino que le pertenece a sus familiares y esta ubicada en la ciudad de La Paz. Es una mujer jubilada pero recibe una renta que le permite cubrir sus necesidades. Necesita credito para hacerse examenes médicos relacionados con malestares que vienen con la edad. Por respeto a la privacidad de Maria (ella tampoco quiere que se publiquen detalles de sus examenes médicos) no se va a mencionar la enfermedad que el medico sospecha, Maria pide que tomen su caso a consideracion.
texts.en:
Maria lives in a house with fine finishing touches that belongs to her relatives.  The house is in the city of La Paz.  She is retired, but she receives an income that allows her to cover her necessities.

She needs the loan for medical tests having to do with maladies that come with age.  To respect Maria’s privacy (who did not want to publish the details of her medical exam) the illness that the doctor suspects will not be given.  Maria asks that you consider her case.

loans.use: to pay for medical tests.

loans.name: Ventanilla Alta 2 Group

texts.es: Juliana es una mujer emprendedora que lleva en el grupo "Ventanilla alta 2" hace un año,es divorciada y madre de tres hijos uno de ellos menor de edad por quien lucha día a día, Juliana tiene su pequeño negocio de venta de golosina en su casa.Esta muy agradecida por el préstamo porque le permitirá comprar otros productos como ,abarrotes,gaseosas y más. Ella se ha propuesto en futuro implementar una bodega en sus casa.Además de su pequeño negocio ella tiene otro ingreso económico al cuidar un niño por las tardes.Juliana se siente entusiasmada por pertenecer a este grupo que le a dado la oportunidad de salir adelante.Juliana agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el respaldo y confianza que le brindan sin conocerla.
texts.en: Juliana is an enterprising woman who has been with the “Ventanilla ala 2” group for a year.  She is divorced and the mother of three children, one underage for whom she works hard every day.  She has a small business and sells snacks from her home.  She is very grateful for the loan because it allows her to buy products such as groceries, sodas, and more.  She eventually wants to open a holding area in her home. In addition to this small business, Juliana has another income; she cares for a child in the evenings.  Juliana is enthusiastic to be part of this group that has given her the opportunity to get ahead.  Juliana is grateful to the Kiva lenders.  THANK YOU VERY MUCH KIVA.

loans.use: to buy groceries, soda, candy and other products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy piglets

loans.name: Lena

texts.ru: Лене 55 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 3 детей. У Лены - медицинское образование, работает фельдшером. По характеру Лена очень ответственная, общительная, жизнерадостная. Вместе с мужем Лена занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 30 лет назад, с покупки скота на 700 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Лены, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 2 кобылы, 10 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 11,000 сом (KGS) от реализации молока, также обрабатывает 5,29 ГА земли, где в основном выращивает -зерновые культуры и эспарцет. Полученный урожай реализуют оптовым поставщикам. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Лена обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум"  за кредитом - на покупку бычков для увеличения поголовья скота. После закупки скота, они будут находиться в собственном хозяйстве. Летом скот будет под присмотром пастуха. Доходы от кредита Лена планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на оплату обучения сына в высших учебных заведениях.
texts.en: Lena is 55 years old and married. She and her husband have three children. Lena has received medical training and works as a physician’s assistant. By nature Lena is very responsible, outgoing, and optimistic. Together with her husband, Lena raises livestock and grows produce, having launched this business 30 years ago by buying livestock for 700 KGS. Thanks to Lena’s hard work, her farm now includes two dairy cows, two mares, and 10 sheep. Her monthly income from selling milk is 11,000 KGS. Lena also works 5.29 ha [13 acres] of land, where she mainly grows grains and sainfoin [a perennial herb used for forage]. She and her husband sell their harvest to wholesale dealers. In order to develop her farm further, Lena has turned to the Bai Tushum microfinance institution for a loan to buy cattle so as to increase her livestock headcount. After she buys the animals, she will keep them on her farm. In the summer the livestock will be taken care of by a shepherd. Lena plans to use the revenue from her loan for an additional livestock increase. She also plans to save up to pay for her son’s higher education.

loans.use: to buy steers.

loans.name: Federesi

texts.en: Federesi is a single mother of seven children, two of whom children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She has a business of selling of yellow and sweet bananas. Federesi has applied for a loan of 500,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy bunches of bananas. She generates additional income by working as a cleaner with Kampala city council. She works at the market seven days a week and sells on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include seasonality and perishability. She aspires to become a wholesaler and also to start going to villages for bunches of sweet and yellow bananas. She resides in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: to buy bunches of yellow and sweet bananas.

loans.name: Norah

texts.en: Norah is a 41-year-old widow. She has four children ranging in age from 9 to 22. She describes herself as committed. She operates a retail business where she sells cereals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be low numbers of customers. Norah will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more stock of cereals. She hopes that in the future, she will improve her standard of living. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cereals

loans.name: Kezi

texts.en: Kezi is married with four children and three of her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (young brother and sister). She has a business of selling chapatti and has been in this business for 10 years. She has applied for a loan of 500,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy more cooking oil and wheat flour.  She generates additional income from a stall selling tomatoes. She works at the market seven days out of every week and sells on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include ever increasing prices of cooking oil and wheat flour and defaulter. She is aspiring to own a fully stocked bakery and also to educate her children up to university. She decided to join MCDT-SACCO because she wanted to acquire additional capital for her business. She resides in the family house and the family has no access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include   school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more cooking oil and wheat flour.

loans.name: Luz Dari

texts.es:
Luz, madre de dos hijos, tiene un puesto de venta de comidas rápidas, que inició hace un tiempo, cuando su esposo perdió su empleo, con el fin de ayudar con los gastos del hogar. Inicialmente abría solo los fines de semana, pero atendiendo el pedido de sus clientes, actualmente abre desde los jueves y ha tenido muy buen resultado. Por lo que va a invertir su crédito en la compra de una freidora industrial, mesas y sillas y poder atender con mayor rapidez a los clientes de su negocio en crecimiento y seguir acreditándolo.

Luz sueña con dejar su empleo actual, para dedicarse por completo a la venta de comidas rápidas y poder establecerse en un local, así como mejorar sus ingresos familiares.
texts.en:
Luz is the mother of two children. She has a fast food stand that she established some time ago when her husband lost his job. This enabled her to help with the household expenses. At first she was only open on the weekends. Now she starts her business on Thursdays at the request of her customers and has achieved very good results.

Luz will invest her loan in the purchase of an industrial deep fryer, tables, and chairs. This will enable her to provide faster service to her customers, grow her business, and continue building her reputation.

Luz dreams of quitting her current job so that she can sell fast food full-time from an established location. As a result, she can improve her family’s income.

loans.use: to buy an industrial deep fryer, tables, and chairs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs and to pay for labor

loans.name: Cissy

texts.en:
Cissy is a single mother of two children, one of whom is in school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. Cissy has a business selling soft drinks. She has applied for a loan of 500,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more boxes of mineral water, crates of soda, sugar and passion fruits. 

Cissy has been in business for three years. She works in her shop seven days a week and sells on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include seasonality and defaulters. She is aspiring of becoming a wholesaler of juice and also to buy a plot of land and build a house. She resides in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees..

loans.use: to buy more mineral water, soda, sugar and passion fruits.

loans.name: Prene

texts.en:
Prene is a widowed mother of four; one of her daughter's is mentally challenged. One of her sons, who lives with his mother and challenged sister, works in construction. The loan she is requesting will be used for engagement related expenses of her son.
 
Prene is from northern Albania; the way she has dressed is traditional of that part of the region for all women.

She practices agriculture as a source of income in addition to what her son makes of his work. She then sells the fresh produce to the local farmers’ market.

loans.use: to pay for engagement related expenses of her son who lives with her and works in construction

loans.name: Nancy Yrene

texts.es: La señora Nancy tiene 43 años de edad, su esposo se dedica a trabajar de albañil y también a la agricultura, ella tiene 5 hijos, de los cuales una va a la escuela, una al colegio y un hijo asiste a la universidad, ella es una señora muy trabadora que se dedica a criar toda clase de animales menores y sobre todo chanchos mismos que los cría en el campo y se encuentra construyendo una chanchera para criarlos de mejor forma ya con los ingresos que le deja este negocio puede sustentar los gastos de educación de sus hijos. El crédito lo utilizará para la compra Chanchos y de balanceado para alimentar a estos. Nancy sueña con ver a sus hijos todos unos profesionales.
texts.en: Nancy is 43 years old. Her husband is dedicated to working as a stonemason and also does agriculture. Nancy has 5 children, 1 of whom goes to primary school, 1 is in high school, and 1 attends university. Nancy is a hard worker who raises all kinds of small animals, especially breeding pigs in the field. She is building a pig farm to raise them in better form. With the income she earns, she hopes to pay for the education fees of her children. This loan will be used to purchase pigs and to buy food to feed them. Nancy dreams of seeing her children as professionals.

loans.use: to buy pigs and feed

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy house building materials like cement, iron corrugated zincs, etc. for the construction of a dwelling house

loans.name: Hector Ruben

texts.es: El joven Héctor tiene 21 años y es Soltero,  estudia la carrera  de licenciatura en administración de Empresas en una de las universidades reconocidas  de  la Ciudad de La Cochabamba,  trabaja para pagar sus estudios El joven Héctor  trabaja vendiendo ropa, es de ahí que tiene un ingreso extra,  este es su primer crédito con la institución y el joven Héctor va a usar este préstamo para  pagar su carrera completa,  Hector enfrenta retos en su estudios que son Su trabajo no le permite dedicarse al 100% a su estudio, pero el joven tiene ganas de continuar y seguir adelante, su deseo cuando termine sus estudios es Quiere ejercer su profesión, mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia ya que el quiere apoyar a sus hermanos a que sigan estudiando y se superen en esta vida.
texts.en:
Héctor, 21 and single, is studying business administration at a well-known university in the city of Cochabamba.  He works to pay for his education and also sells clothing for extra income.  This is his first loan through the institution and Héctor will use it to pay for his full education.

His challenge is finding the time to study because his work does not let him dedicate himself 100% to it.  But this young man is determined to continue and get ahead.  His goal is to finish his education, work in this career and improve his and his family's quality of life. He wants to help his brothers continue studying and improve their lives.

loans.use: To pay for his education in advance.

loans.name: Myriam De Jesús

texts.es:
Myriam, a sus 51 años de edad, es casada y madre de 2 hijos a los que ha sacado adelante con gran esfuerzo y dedicación. Se gana la vida trabajando en su propio negocio, un estudio fotográfico que comenzó como hobby, pues desde muy joven siente un gusto especial por este arte. Luego de un tiempo, vio en esta actividad una oportunidad de negocio con el que podría generar recursos para aportar a la economía de su hogar. 
Actualmente solicita el apoyo del crédito para comprar una impresora multifuncional, con la que se pueda adaptar para generar mejores ingresos, así prestará un servicio completo y en menor tiempo, optimizando su producción.
Myriam manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es acreditar y fortalecer su negocio para poder dejar un buen legado a sus hijos y que sean ellos quienes impulsen la labor para lograr permanencia en el tiempo y les permita disfrutar una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Myriam is 51 years old, married, and has two children who she has helped succeed with great effort and dedication.  She earns a living working at her own business, a photography studio that started as a hobby.  Since she was young, she has felt a special enjoyment for this art.  Later, she saw that there was an opportunity for a business that could generate income to support her household.

She is currently requesting a loan to purchase a multifunction printer.  This will help her generate more income, since she will be able to provide a complete service in less time, which will optimize production.

Myriam says that her goal is to accredit and strengthen her business in order to leave her children a good legacy and that they drive the work to achieve permanence in time and that it allows them to enjoy a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase a multifunction printer.

loans.name: Atilano

texts.es:
Atilano tiene 27 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Callayuc una comunidad con paisajes verdes, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Cutervo que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la destilación de aguardiente, una bebida tradicional de la sierra del Perú, que es utilizada para días festivos, antiséptico y con fines curativos, tmabien se dedica a la crianza de ganado vacuno, tiene una familia unida, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 500 nuevos soles para la compra de mayor cantidad de caña que es materia prima de su producción y de esta manera producir mayor cantidad de aguardiente.
texts.en:
Atilano, 27, lives with his wife and children in the district of Callayuc, a community with green scenery.  The local people are involved in agriculture, commerce and livestock farming.  It is in the province of Cutervo which belongs to the Cajamarca Region in the northern mountain range of Peru.

He works making "aguardiente" (local liquor), which is a traditional beverage in the Peru mountains.  It is used for holidays, and as an antiseptic and for medicinal purposes.  He also works raising cattle and has a close family. He is requesting a loan in the amount of 1,500 PEN to buy more sugar cane which is the raw material for production.  This will allow him to produce more liquor.

loans.use: to buy more sugar cane in greater quantities to make "aguardiente" (a local liquor) in greater amounts

loans.name: Bolivia Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “BOLVIA” iniciará el sexto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Senkata, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Lucila es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tienda de barrio, servicio de transporte, costura de mandiles, venta de cosméticos, venta de verduras, tejido de mantas, venta de camas, venta de calzados

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Lucila es integrante, ella indica que hace cuatro años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una compañera de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda de barrio; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió al observar a su madre, quien tiene el mismo negocio en otra zona, con un capital prestado de Pro Mujer decide emprender un negocio independiente.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de arroz, azúcar, aceite por mayor) que adquirirá de las tiendas distribuidoras de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el crédito que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The Bolivia community bank is starting their sixth loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Senkata regional center.  The group is made up of nine members and is led by an executive board of which Lucila is the president.  The members have a variety of businesses, including: a neighborhood store, transportation services, sewing fishing nets, cosmetic sales, vegetable sales, knitting blankets, bed sales, and shoe sales.

The loan they are requesting will benefit all of their small businesses, including Lucila's.  She joined Pro Mujer four years ago at the invitation of a friend from the institution who visited her home.  She currently has a neighborhood store.  She started this business after observing her mother, who has a similar store in another area.  With capital borrowed from Pro Mujer, she decided to start her own business.  

She is requesting this loan for an increase in capital to purchase rice, sugar, and oil at wholesale.  She will purchase the items from distributors in El Alto and later sell them in her store.  This type of work allows her to generate income to support her family, since she is married and has two children. 

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responded that she likes the loans that the institution offers.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, and oil at wholesale.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria está haciendo el  último año de sus estudios en la carrera de Nutrición. Sus metas futuras son montar su propio consultorio  y ayudar a la gente que necesite atención en su salud.
Ella vive con sus padres quienes son su principal sostén y a quien quiere poder ayudar por medio de su trabajo.
Pide este préstamo para poder cubrir su matriculación de este año, y de esa forma poder seguir estudiando como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Maria in in the last year of studying el Nutrition. Her goals for the future are to open her own office and help people who need health care. 

She lives with her parents, who are her main support and whom she wants to help through her work. She is asking for this loan to cover her enrollment costs for this year so that she can keep studying as she has been doing.

loans.use: to pay for college enrollment costs.

loans.name: Pedro Rafael

texts.es: Pedro, es un hombre trabajador, tiene 42 años de edad, vive con su esposa en Tulcán, tiene 5 hijos de los cuales tiene 1 niño de 13 años de edad y sus 2 hijas de 8 y 5 años que asisten a la escuela, los demás ya mantienen su propio hogar. El desde hace aproximadamente 18 años atrás inicio con el negocio de comprar y vender terneros con el cual le va muy bien, hace un año atrás el solicitó un préstamo a FODEMI para comprar un ternero para luego venderlo, y le fue muy bien. Ahora necesita el préstamo para comprar 3 terneros y continuar con su negocio, él ya es conocido por la zona y tiene clientes fijos que le buscan para comprarle los terneros debido a que es cumplido y vende los terneros a buen precio. Su meta a futuro es poder tener su casa propia ya que vive arrendando y poder terminar de educar a sus hijos menores que viven con él.
texts.en: Pedro is a hard-working man. He is 42 years old and lives with his wife in Tulcán. The couple has three children: one son, thirteen years old, and two daughters, aged eight and five years old, who are all in school; the other two children now have their own homes. Around 18 years ago Pedro started his own business buying and selling calves. The business is going very well. A year ago he applied for a loan with "FODEMI" in order to buy a calf to resell, and this went very well. Pedro now needs a loan in order to buy three calves and to continue with his business. Pedro is now known in the area and has regular customers who come to him because he is a man of his word, and because he sells the calves at a good price. Pedro's future aim is to have his own house as he currently living in rented accommodation. He also wants to finish giving his children their education.

loans.use: to buy calves to sell later.

loans.name: Dúo Jerico Group

texts.es:
DUO JERICO
Este dúo lo forma doña María Olivia, tiene 30 años de edad y tiene 2 hijos solicita este crédito para ampliar su negocio de venta de tubo y prensa, también vende refacciones y comidas 3 veces a la semana, y tiene venta de ropa típica desde hace 4 años, ella quiere comprar tubo ya hecho, ya que le están pidiendo y lo que ella hace ya no es suficiente, también quiere comprar blusas y cortes, ya que su clientela le ha pedido pero por falta de capital no ha podido darles la ropa encargada a sus clientes,
texts.en:
DUO JERICO

This duo was formed by Mrs. Maria Olivia who is 30 years old and has two children. She asks for this loan to grow her business of selling tubes and newspapers. Mrs. Maria Olivia also sells refreshments and food three times a week. She has been selling traditional clothing for four years and wants to buy tubes of newspaper already made as she has lots of demand but does not make enough herself to meet the demand. She also wants to buy blouses and skirts because her customers have asked her for some but due to a lack of capital she has not been able to give these types of clothes to her customers.

loans.use: to buy materials to make refreshments that she sells at her business.

loans.name: Heidi Marisela

texts.es:
En la fotografía aparece Heidi con su hija.

Heidi de 28 años de edad, estudió hasta noveno grado en la escuela, está acompañada y su esposo es empleado en una empresa de lácteos. Únicamente tienen una hija a la que quieren y cuidan mucho. Ellos alquilan una casa, pues hace 4 años vivían junto con su suegra, pero no había buenas relaciones interpersonales y debido a que no funcionó, decidieron vivir en un lugar aparte.

Heidi tiene más de 4 años dedicándose a la crianza de cerdos en el patio de su casa. Inició este negocio por casualidad, pues una amiga le comentó que tenía un cerdito que lo estaba vendiendo pues necesitaba dinero en ese momento, Heidi por ayudarle decidió comprárselo, lo engordó y luego lo vendió, notó que era un buen negocio y por lo tanto decidió dedicarse a esta labor.


El préstamo solicitado por Heidi, es precisamente para la compra de 4 cerdos, los cuales  piensa engordar, para posteriormente venderlos y obtener ganancias.

Heidi sueña en un futuro, construir una galera donde pueda tener mayor cantidad de cerdos, para así lograr establecer mayores ventas que le proporcione una buena calidad de vida y estabilidad económica a ella y a su familia.
texts.en:
Heidi is shown in the photograph with her daughter.

Heidi, 28 years old, studied until the ninth grade in school. She has a partner and her husband is employed by a dairy business. They have only a daughter whom they care for and love very much. They rent a house since they had lived with her mother-in-law for four years, but interpersonal relations were not good. Consequently, due to the fact the situation was not working, the couple decided to live separately.

Heidi has raised pigs for more than four years in the patio of her house. She started the business by chance since she had a friend who told her she had a piglet she was selling because she needed money at the time. In order to help her, Heidi decided to buy it, fatten it and then sell it. She realized it was a good business and therefore decided to engage in this work.  

The loan requested by Heidi is precisely to purchase four pigs, which she intends to fatter and then later sell to make a profit.

Heidi dreams in the future of building a pig pen where she can hold a larger quantity of pigs so that she can have more sales, which will provide a good quality of life and economic stability for her and her family.

loans.use: to purchase four pigs.

loans.name: Gumercindo

texts.es:
Gumercindo vive en la ciudad de Huayopata que está ubicado en la provincia de La Convención del departamento del Cusco, él desde muy joven se dedico a la agricultura y le va muy bien pues tiene varios terrenos de cultivos como por ejemplo tiene frutales, café, té, cacao y coca, él es una persona responsable y amable que pertenece al banco comunal "Buena Vista" de la Asociación Arariwa desde hace varios años. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar fertilizantes. Gumercindo  agrace a los inversionistas por el préstamo y se compromete a pagar las cuotas con mucha responsabilidad.   
  
Huayopata es un Distrito Tealero, tiene un Centro Poblado San Pablo, su población aproximada es de 12 mil habitantes.
texts.en: Gumercindo lives in the city of Huayopata, which is located in the in province of La Convención in the department of Cusco. From a very young age, he made his living in agriculture and it has gone well for him. He has various plots of cultivated land; for example he has fruit, coffee, tea, cacao, and coca. He is a very responsible and kind person and has belonged to the communal bank, "Buena Vista" of the Asociación Arariwa for several years. In this moment, he needs a loan to buy fertlizer. Gumercindo is grateful to the lenders for this loan and promises to pay the installments responsibly.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Josue 1.9 Group

texts.es: Grupo formado por tres socias emprendedoras una de ellas es Maria tiene 38 años de edad, desde hace 20 años su negocio es la venta de refrescos naturales ambulante, antes trabajaba como domesticas en casas particulares, ella misma atiende su negocio, el credito lo invertirá en la compra de materia prima payana, semilla de jícaro, frambuesa, linaza, azúcar, vainilla, hielo, mandarina etc. Reyna es otra miembro del grupo su negocio es la venta de granos básicos y tiene 50 años y Ana tiene 48 años y su negocio es la venta de perecederos.
texts.en:
This group is made up of three members, one of which is Maria. She is 38 years old. For 20 years she has been selling natural drinks in the streets. She takes care of the business herself.  Before she worked as a domestic worker in private homes. Maria will invest the loan in the purchase of raw materials like papaya, jicaro seeds, raspberry, linseed, sugar, vanilla, ice, mandarins, etc.

Reyna is another member of the group. She is 50 years old and sells basic grains. Ana is 48 years old and she sells perishables.

loans.use: to buy raw materials like papaya, jicaro seeds, raspberry, linseed, sugar, vanilla, ice, mandarins, etc.

loans.name: Maria Milagro

texts.es: María tiene 47 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida y sus 5 hijos(23, 18, 12, 9 y 8 años de edad). Ella es una mujer emprendedora quien desde hace 3 años dio inicio a una pupusería en la cual gracias a su carisma y experiencia ha logrado ganarse la confianza de muchas personas. María solicita este crédito a FUSAI dado que desea terminar de construir su vivienda para lo cual necesita materiales como: lámina galvanizada y madera y así poder finalizar la vivienda y dar mayor seguridad a su familia.
texts.en:
María, age 47, lives in her own house with her life partner and their children (ages 23, 18, 12, 9, and 8).  She is an enterprising woman who started a ‘pupusa’ [a thick corn tortilla stuffed with cheese, fried pork rind, chicken, or refried beans] business three years ago.  Thanks to her charisma and experience, she has managed to gain the confidence of many people in her business.

María is requesting this loan from FUSAI because she wishes to finish building her house.  In order to do so she needs materials like galvanized metal sheeting and wood.  This way she will be able to finish the house and give her family greater security.

loans.use: to buy galvanized metal sheeting and wood in order to finish building her house.

loans.name: Lilliam Jerónima

texts.es:
La Señora Lilliam jerónima  posee un negocio de venta de mercadería en general, desde hace  diecisiete años ubicada en mercado metropolitano de león es madre soltera  de tres hijas,  ella  realiza esta  labor para llevar el sustento  a su hogar. 
 
Doña Lilliam  inicia sus labores desde muy temprano para ofrecerles a los visitantes del mercado los diferentes productos como bolsos, cosméticos, cartera, ropa  toallas de baño, ropa para bebes retirándose a su hogar.

El crédito que solicito a Ceprodel fue utilizado en  compra de ropa para  todo tipo y así ofrecerle a su clientela una variedad de productos de mejor calidad, por lo que tendría más ingresos para mejorar su nivel de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Lilliam has been running her general merchandise store for seventeen years, which is located in a city market of León. She is the single mother of three daughters. She does this work to support her household. 

Lilliam starts work very early to offer several products to market shoppers such as purses, cosmetics, wallets, clothing, bath towels, baby clothing.
 
The loan that she applied for from CEPRODEL was used to buy all types of clothing in order to provide her customers with a variety of better quality products. Therefore, she will have more income to improve her and her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy all types of clothing.

loans.name: Luis Eduardo

texts.es:
Luís de 25 años de edad, está estudiando Administración de Empresas en la Universidad, lleva 5to año de la carrera, no tiene hijos y vive solamente con su madre que se dedica a vender ropa en las calles, ella viaja para ir comprar la mercadería y luego venderla en diferentes cantones y caseríos del área. Sus 2  hermanos se encuentran en Estados Unidos y desde allá les ayudan económicamente, para que puedan llevar una vida relativamente cómoda.

Luís está becado en sus estudios en la universidad, por ser  seleccionado de fútbol para dicha universidad, también imparte clases de voleibol  y en las noches es arbitro en un torneo de futbol sala.

El préstamo solicitado es porque Luís ya quiere poner en práctica sus conocimientos en administración y abrir una peluquería, proyecto que tenía en mente desde hace mucho tiempo pues él también posee habilidades para el corte de cabello, también cuanta con la ayuda de 2 muchachos expertos en el corte de cabello que les servirán de empleados.

Él aspira a terminar su carrera y poder graduarse, para dedicarse de lleno a algún negocio propio (la peluquería) que le haga ganar experiencia en la administración y poder obtener mayores ingresos que lo hagan crecer económicamente.
.
texts.en:
Luis, 25 years old, is studying business administration at the university. He is in the fifth year of his degree. He has no children and lives with his mother, who sells clothing door to door. She travels to go buy the goods and then sells them in different villages in the area. His two siblings are in the United States and help them economically from there so that they can lead relatively comfortable lives.

Luis has a soccer scholarship for his university studies. He also gives volleyball classes and at night he is a referee for an indoor soccer tournament.

Luis has requested a loan so that he can put his business administration knowledge into practice and open a hair salon. He has been planning to pursue this project for a long time. He also has hair-cutting skills and has two other young men, both expert stylists, who will work for him.

He hopes to complete his degree and be able to graduate so he can fully devote himself to his own business (the hair salon), which will give him more experience in running a business and offer him greater earnings that will help him grow economically.

loans.use: to open a hair salon.

loans.name: El Jicarito Group

texts.es: Coordinado Arelys con 20 años de edad, ajuntada y actualmente con una hija de 3 años y una en espera. Su negocio es venta de ropa y calzado quien la ayuda también es la mamá la cual se abastece de mercadería en el principal mercado capitalino, invertirá en variedad de ropa, adultos, niños, jóvenes e igualmente en calzado, el grupo conformado por dos socias más, también por Rosa con 41 años dedicada al destace de cerdo en la localidad y Petronila con 45 años de edad realizando crianza de cerdo.
texts.en:
Arelys is twenty years old and lives with her partner. She currently has a three-year-old daughter and is expecting her second child. She works selling shoes and clothing and gets help with her business from her mother, who stocks up on merchandise at the main market in the capital. She will invest in a variety of clothing and shoes for men, women, juniors, and children.

This group comprises two other members. Rosa is 41 years old and works locally butchering pigs and Petronila is 45 years old and works raising pigs.

loans.use: to buy a variety of clothing and shoes for men, women, juniors, and children.

loans.name: Guillermina

texts.es:
Guillermina tiene 50 años de edad, solo pudo estudiar hasta sexto grado en la escuela ya que los escasos recursos económicos no le permitieron continuar, está casada pero su esposo no vive con ella pues se han separado, tiene cinco hijos de los cuales tres ya se casaron y dos viven con ella y que además trabajan.

Guillermina tiene en su casa un pequeño negocio de venta de medicina, el cual le genera ingresos; decidió dedicarse a este negocio por una amiga suya quien le ayudó a emprenderlo, siendo esta la actividad principal a la cual se dedica.

El préstamo que ella está solicitando a CrediCampo, lo necesita para construir un muro en su casa, ya que no pueden dejar solo el lugar y el muro protejerá su casa, la necesidad quedara sastisfecha porque su familia estará en un ambiente mas seguro.


Sus planes a futuro son arreglar poco a poco su casa y con los ingresos del negocio ir cancelando las cuotas del crédito para seguir trabajando con esta institución.
texts.en:
Guillermina has a small busines selling medicine out of her house, which makes her an income. She decided to have this businessbecause of a friend of hers who helped her to start it, as it was the main activity in which her friend worked.

She needs the loan she is requesting from CrediCampo to build a wall in her house, as she can´t leave the place alone and the wall will protect the house. The need being satisfied, she will be happy because her family will be in a safer environment.

Her plans for the future are to fix up her house little by little, and to make the payments on her loan with the money from her business so she can continue to work with this institution.

loans.use: to build a wall in her house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to transplant seedlings.

loans.name: Nhyira Group

texts.en:
These people are part of the group called Nhyira, and they are three in number. On average, they are 33 years old, and have three children each. They all live in the Dansoman neighborhood, in Accra-Ghana. They are friends or neighbors, and also know one another through their income-generating activities at Dansoman. They are involved in small retail, and sell maize, minerals and medicine. 
In order to have enough cash to buy fresh supplies of goods, the members of the group have decided to join ID-Ghana. This is their tenth loan cycle with ID-Ghana.

Elizabeth, the featured borrower, is a well-known cereal seller. In the photo, she is standing at far right in the photo. She is planning to use her loan to buy maize, in bulk, from the market. Most of her customers are women.  She is expecting to make a good monthly profit, which will be reinvested in her business and also used to take care of her children.

loans.use: To buy maize, in bulk, from the market.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to pay school fees for his children

loans.name: Jorge Alberto

texts.es: Jorge Alberto, mayor de edad padre soltero de un hijo ya mayor de edad, originario del municipio de Chinandega, ubicado en el occidente del país, es un microempresario propietario de un salón de belleza ubicado en su casa de habitación, donde ofrece sus servicios de corte en general, de cabello para damas y caballeros al igual ofrece servicios de pedicure, manicure, blower, planchado, alisado, ondulaciones, al igual que ofrece productos de cosméticos a sus clientes,  Jorge poco a poco ha logrado salir adelante por la  buena atención  que le ofrece a sus clientes, uno de los sueños de Jorge es poder en un futuro no muy lejano construir sus casa. El objetivo de este financiamiento es para capital de trabajo y fortalecer su inventario de productos de bellezas como: cosméticos, cremas faciales, tintes, entre otros, Jorge agradece mucho el apoyo que los inversionistas kivas les ofrece a personas de bajos recursos económicos.-
texts.en: Jorge Alberto is an older adult and is a single father of one grown-up son.  He is from the city of Chinandega, located in the western part of the country.  Jorge is a small businessman.  He owns a beauty salon located in his home and he offers men's and women's haircuts as well as pedicures, manicures, blowouts, hair straightening, smoothing, and permanents, as well as selling cosmetics to his clients.  Jorge has gradually gotten ahead in life through serving his clients well.  One of his dreams to to be able to build a house in the not too distant future.  The purpose of this loan is to have working capital and to stock beauty products such as cosmetics, moisturizers, hair dyes, etc.  Jorge is very thankful for the support Kiva lenders offer people with limited financial resources.

loans.use: to stock beauty products such as hair dyes, smoothing creams, moisturizers, etc.

loans.name: Dúo Balle De La Alameda Group

texts.es:
DUO VALLE DE LA ALAMEDA
La señorita Iris del Rosario  de 22 años, soltera,  desde hace 2 años posee una Tienda ubicada en Chimaltenango, que a base de esfuerzos logro establecer y mejorar su vivienda, a través de su negocio ella  ha mantenido y  a sacado adelante a su familia.
El sueño de la señorita Iris es poder mejorar la calidad de su vida y la de su familia a través del microcrédito que está solicitando a KIVA; con el préstamo quiere comprar mas productos de consumo diario para  seguir creciendo con su tienda,ya que sus clientes han aumentado y espera que le puedan ayudar para seguir adelante.
texts.en:
"Duo Valle de la Alameda" The Alameda Valley Duo
Iris del Rosario is 22 years old, and single. She has run her store, which is located in Chimaltenango, for the past two years. Through hard work she has managed to set up and improve her home; and through her business she has supported her family and helped them get ahead. 

Iris' dream is to improve the quality of life for her family, through the loan she is requesting from Kiva. With the loan she wants to purchase more products for daily consumption in order to continue growing her store, since her client base has grown. She hopes that this will help her get ahead.

loans.use: to purchase daily staples, which they will then sell.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.es:
El Señor Wilson es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable vive en una comunidad al sur de Honduras junto a su familia. Su negocio es la venta de frutas, desde hace 5 años, la cual funciona en diversos lugares cercanos a su municipio donde vive. 
Don Wilson necesita el préstamo para la compra de más productos como sandias y melones para seguir realizando su trabajo; el cual le brinda una gran parte de sus ingresos. Con el préstamo espera que sus ventas aumenten y que este le sirva de mucho ya que no cuenta con los productos necesarios para cubrir los pedidos solicitados por sus clientes a diario.
Don Wilson gracias a esto espera poder mejorar la calidad de vida de la familia con el aumento de los ingresos en el hogar y en un corto plazo hacer crecer su negocio para seguir apoyando a su familia y que sus hijos tengan los estudios y tener asi mayores oportunidades en la vida.



Choluteca, Honduras – Marzo del 2014
texts.en:
Wilson is a hard-working and responsible person who lives in a community in the south of Honduras with his family. His business is selling fruit. He has been doing this for 5 years in the various places close to his municipality. Wilson needs a loan to buy more products like watermelons and melons to continue doing his work, which is the source of most of his income. 

With the loan he hopes that his sales will increase and this will be very useful as he does not have enough product to cover the daily demand from his clients. Wilson hopes that thanks to the loan he will be able to improve the family's standard of living with the increase of revenue coming into the household. And in the short term he would like to expand his business and continue to support his family and that his children continue with their studies and have better opportunities in their lives.

Choluteca, Honduras – March 2014

loans.use: to buy watermelon and melons for his business.

loans.name: Candido

texts.es:
El señor Cándido es  una persona emprendedora honesta y seria, vive con su esposa y sus  hijos   en el  sur de Honduras. Su negocio es la  compra   y venta  de  frutas. 
Don Cándido el préstamo lo necesita para la compra de  frutas como piña, melón, bananos, etc.  Con el préstamo el espera que las ventas en su negocio aumenten al tener más  frutas  que ofrecer a los clientes y cubrir las necesidades de los mismos y con esto mejorar la situación  económica  de su  familia. 
Don Cándido espera que  en unos 3 años  su negocio siga  creciendo y  consolidándose  para que se convierta en la más grande y  reconocido de la zona y seguir  apoyando a su familia para que sus nietos terminen sus estudios y se conviertan en personas honestas  y con principios y valores.


Choluteca, Honduras –  Febrero   del   2014
texts.en:
Cándido is an honest and serious entrepreneur. He lives with his wife and his children in southern Honduras. His business is buying and selling fruit. Cándido needs the loan to buy fruit such as pineapples, melons, bananas, etc. With the loan, he hopes that the sales in his business will increase by having more fruit to offer his customers and cover their needs. In this way, he will improve his family's financial situation.

Cándido hopes that in about 3 years, his business will keep growing and consolidating so that it will become one of the biggest and best known in the area. He wants to keep supporting his family so that his grandchildren will finish their studies and become honest people with values and principles.  

Choluteca, Honduras –  February of 2014

loans.use: to buy pineapples, melons, bananas, etc., for his business.

loans.name: Jehova Es Mi  Luz Group

texts.es: La señora Milagro de 39 años, casada y tres hijos de las edades de 19, 18 y 8 años, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva y de calzado por encargo y sus hijas mayores le ayudan a complementar la venta, el propósito de obtener este crédito es reforzar la venta con variedad de ropa nueva como pantalón de varón, pantalón de dama, camisas de varón, camisas de damas, shores, zapatos de damas, zapatos de varón, zapatos de niños, etc. y así fortalecer su negocio y aumentar las ganancias,. El grupo también está conformado por las señoras Marta de 49 años, dedicada a la compra y venta de cosechas de las temporadas y Angélica de 23 años, la cual posee una pulpería en el domicilio.
texts.en:
Sra. Milagro is 39 years old, married, and has three children (ages 19, 18, and 8). She sells new clothes and shoes by accepting orders. Her grown daughters help with making sales. The purpose of obtaining this loan is to reinforce her sales of various new clothes such as men’s trousers, women’s trousers, men’s shirts, women’s shirts, shorts, women’s shoes, men’s shoes, children’s shoes, and other items. As a result, she will be able to strengthen her business and increase her earnings.

The group also includes the following members:
