• Sra. Marta is 49 years old and has a business of buying and selling seasonal crops.
• Sra. Angélica is 23 years old and has a grocery store in her home.

loans.use: to buy a variety of new clothes to sell.

loans.name: Las Praderas Group

texts.es: Este grupo es  coordinado por el señor José de 63 años,  que elabora artesanías de plástico como es palometas  y venta de refresco naturales , es casado y padre de dos hijos de las edades de 25 y 23 años, cuenta con la ayuda de su esposa para la elaboración de dichos productos. El credito lo  invertira en la compra de materia prima ,  para los refrescos como frutas,papaya, calala, melocoton, naranjas dulces, pitahaya, azúcar, bolsas,pajillas, hielo, rodamina entre otras. Otros de los integrantes es  Carlos de 37 años su negocio  es artesano del calzado y Johana de 23 años, su negocio es la te de un pequeño taller de costura.
texts.en: This group is coordinated by 63-year-old José, who makes plastic handicrafts shaped like fish and sells natural fruit drinks. He is married and the father of two children aged 25 and 23. He counts on his wife's help to make these products. He will invest the loan in buying raw material for the fruit drinks, such as fruit, papaya, passion fruit, melon, sweet oranges, dragon fruit, sugar, bags, straws, ice and rhodamine, among other items. The other members are 37-year-old Carlos, whose business is making shoes, and 23-year-old Johana, whose business is a small sewing shop.

loans.use: to buy raw material such as fresh fruit, papayas, passion fruit, melon, sweet oranges, dragon fruit, sugar, bags, straws, ice, rhodamine, etc.

loans.name: Phat

texts.en: Phat would like to take a loan to buy a large quantity and variety of SIM cards and mobile cards from wholesalers at low prices. Her previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers and increase sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity and variety of SIM cards and mobile cards

loans.name: Nga

texts.en:
Nga is 44 years old and married.  She has two children. She lives with her family in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns income as a security guard. Nga runs a shop selling electrical home appliances for earning a living. 

She started her business ten years ago. She intends to take a loan to gradually expand her business by buying different electrical home appliances for selling to her customers. 

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy electrical home appliances for selling at her store.

loans.name: Nhung

texts.en: Nhung would like to take a further loan to buy more vegetables to sell from her stall. Nhung's previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers and increase sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a large variety of vegetables for selling at her store.

loans.name: Micaela

texts.es: Micaela  tiene de 36 años de edad, vive con su familia en el municipio de Nahualá, departamento de Sololá, tiene 3 hijos, el primero tiene 15 años está en tercero básico, el segundo tiene 13 años está en segundo básico y el tercero tiene 10 años y está en quinto primaria, ella vio la oportunidad de vender ropa típica porque es  el traje que usan todas la mujeres de la comunidad y muy pocas veces baja la venta, ella solicita un crédito por la cantidad de Q. 4,000.00, para invertirlo en su negocio de ropa típica y así tener más surtido y con más variedad su mercadería.  Micaela es una mujer muy solidaría que quiere ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de la familia, con la ganancias que obtiene de las ventas mejorar  las condiciones de vida de su familia
texts.en: Micaela is 36 years old and lives with her family in the municipality of Nahualá, Sololá Department. The oldest is 15 and in the third year of Middle school. The next is 13 and in the second year of Middle school and the youngest is 10 and in the 4th year of Primary school. She saw the opportunity to sell traditional clothing as it is what all the women in her village use. Sales very seldom go down. She is requesting a loan for 4,000 GTQ to invest in her clothing business to be better stocked and have more variety in her merchandise. Micaela is a very socially responsible woman who wants to help her husband with the family expenses. She will use the profit she makes from her sales to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy and sell traditional clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies to care for her coffee crops.

loans.name: Jose Rolando

texts.es: José de 21 años de edad es un joven muy activo. Él vive con sus padres a quienes les da su apoyo desde hace tres años. José trabaja como ayudante de albañilería junto a su padre quien es un maestro de obra muy reconocido en su comunidad. José está muy entusiasmado con su oficio y espera llegar a tener la experiencia que su padre ha alcanzado en el campo de la construcción. José quiere continuar la construcción de una habitación en la vivienda de sus padres, pero no ha alcanzado a tener el monto total que requiere la obra. Por lo anterior José ha solicitado un crédito a FUSAI para comprar cemento, arena, grava y el ladrillos de bloque. Para José es su primer experiencia con un crédito, pero quiere mostrar su responsabilidad para abrir puertas a futuros compromisos.
texts.en:
José, age 21, is a very active young man.  He lives with his parents, and he has been giving them his support for three years.  José works as an assistant bricklayer with his father.  His father is a very well-known master builder in his community.

José is very enthusiastic about his trade.  He hopes to come to have the experience in the construction field that his father has achieved.

José wants to continue building a room in his parents’ house.  However, he has not managed to get the total amount required for the job.  In order to do the job, José is requesting a loan from FUSAI to buy cement, sand, gravel, and bricks.  This is José’s first loan experience.  He wants to demonstrate his responsibility in order to open doors to future commitments.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, and bricks.

loans.name: Yaya

texts.fr:
YAYA est né vers 1984 à GONGASSO, cercle de SIKASSO, 3ème Région administrative du Mali .Mr YAYA a une  femme et 1 enfant. Il réside à BOHI.
Mr YAYA s’est vite intéressé aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment à l’achat et vente de céréales .Sa vente se fait à KEBILA.  
Fort de  ses 4 années d’expérience dans le domaine, il collabore avec Soro Yiriwaso pour augmenter  son fonds de commerce afin de satisfaire sa clientèle qui ne cesse de grandir et est à son  troisième  prêt.
Mr  YAYA compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 10 sacs de mais et 10 sacs de mil. Il s’approvisionne à BOHI et environnants .Il effectue ses ventes au comptant  au marché et à la maison. Sa clientèle est mixte.
Mr YAYA espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 45.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour  subvenir aux besoins de la famille, rembourser le prêt et réinvestir dans les activités.
texts.en:
Yaya was born around 1984 is Congasso, the subdivision of Sikasso, the third administrative district of Mali. Mr. Yaya has a wife and one child. He lives in Bohi.

Early on, Mr. Yaya started to work in order to make a living, in particular buying and reselling cereals. He sells in Kebila.
On the strength of his four s of experience in his business, he collaborates with Soro Yiriwaso to bolster his working capital and satisfy constantly growing demand. He is on his third loan. Mr. Yaya plans to use his loan to buy 10 bags of corn and 10 bags of millet. He stocks up in Bohi and nearby. He sells for cash at the market and out of his home, to a mixed clientele. Mr. Yaya hopes to earn a monthly revenue of 45,000 West African francs, which will be used to provide for family needs,  pay off his loan and reinvest in his business.

loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: Marco Edison

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “BUENA VISTA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Huayopata, perteneciente a la provincia de La Convención y departamento de Cusco.

El socio Marco edison se sigue dedicando al negocio de agricultura, el socio tiene un terreno donde cultiva café, cacao  y plátanos, el socio trabaja desde las 8:00 hasta las 5:00 p.m, el socio ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño del socio es tener un local donde pueda vender el cafe.El socio solicita el crédito para comprar semillas y fertilizantes.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member, Marco Edison, belongs to Buena Vista Communal Bank, located in the Huayopata district of the province of La Convención in the department of Cusco.

Marco Edison still works in agriculture.  He has a plot of land where he works from 8 to 5 growing coffee, cacao, and bananas.  He has been in this business for several years and it's going very well for him.  His dream is to have a place to sell coffee.

Marco Edison's requesting the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer.  He's happy about the loan and promises to make his payments punctually.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia is 55 years old. She is married, and together with her husband, they have four children.

She has been doing farming for the last 20 years with a monthly income of 45,000.

This is her first loan with Vision Fund Kenya, and she intends to purchase fertilizer, seeds and animal feed in order to improve her farming and in return, boost her income.

Patricia will use the anticipated profits to increase the amount of livestock on her farm.

She hopes to provide better living standards for her family.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs

loans.name: Gloria Rubidia

texts.es: Gloria de 65 años de edad vive con su esposo en casa propia desde hace 30 años. El esposo de Gloria es un pequeño ganadero y ella tiene un chalet con venta de golosinas, bebidas gaseosas, panes con pollo y frutas  en la escuela del cantón en donde vive. Gloria supo del apoyo que FUSAI proporciona a personas de las comunidades con créditos accesibles para mejorar sus viviendas; por lo que inmediatamente solicitó un crédito para la remodelación del área de la cocina, construyendo las paredes de ladrillo de bloque. Los materiales que comprará con el dinero del crédito es: Cemento, arena, grava, hierro, bloque de 10x20x40 y una puerta. Ella tiene el apoyo de su esposo y cancelarán las cuotas que este crédito implica.
texts.en: Gloria, 65, has lived with her husband in her own house for 30 years.  Her husband is a small livestock farmer and Gloria has a locale where she sells sweets, soft drinks, chicken sandwiches, and fruit at the school in the canton where she lives.  She found out that FUSAI was providing loans to people in communities for improving their homes, so she immediately sought a loan to construct a brick wall to remodel her kitchen area.  Materials she'll buy with the loan include cement, sand, gravel, iron, a 10x20x40 block of bricks, and a door. Gloria has the support of her husband and will make all the payments the loan requires.

loans.use: to buy a 10x20x40 block, iron, cement, sand, gravel, and a door to remodel the kitchen area.

loans.name: Son

texts.en:
Son, 53, is married and has two children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. She earns an income running a shop selling beverages and  food in the evening in front of her house. 

She started this business three years ago. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying cooking equipment and furniture to better satisfy her customers.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy furniture and cooking equipment for her food stall.

loans.name: Lan

texts.en:
Lan is 45 years old, and married with three children. She and her husband has been running a beauty salon in front of their door for 24 years. She started this business to cover her expenses, and raise her children. They live in Ho Chi Minh City.

Lan is requesting a loan to buy hair care tools and equipment so she will be able to increase the turnover of her business. 

She hopes that through the loan she will be able to expand her business activities, and have money to reinvest to her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy hair care products, tools and equipment for her beauty sallon.

loans.name: Hanh

texts.en:
Hanh would like to take a further loan to buy more food and ingredients to make different kinds of meals to sell from her stall. 

Her previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers and increase sales. 

She also hopes that through the loan, she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy food and ingredients to make meals to sell.

loans.name: Quyen

texts.en:
Quyen would like to take a further loan to buy coffee, sugar, and milk to sell from her shop. 

Her previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. 

She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers and increase sales. 

She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase coffee, sugar, and milk for selling at her shop.

loans.name: To

texts.en:
To is requesting a new loan to buy a greater quantity and variety of materials to make ornaments, such as paper, glue and bamboo frames. 

To's previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. 

She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers and increase her sales. 

She also hopes that through the loan, she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity and variety of materials to make ornaments, such as paper, glue and bamboo frames.

loans.name: Danh

texts.en:
Danh, 54, lives in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City with her family, including four children and her husband. Her husband is a driver for hire. Danh earns money through her general store. She sells food, beverages and household items to people in her community. She started this business five years ago. 

Danh would like to get a loan to buy a larger stock of products such as shampoo, detergent, bags, food, rice, coffee, milk and sugar to meet her customers' needs. 

She will also use a part of the loan to pay school fees for her children. 

She hopes her business will ensure that her family members will have a better future.

loans.use: To buy a larger stock of products for selling at her store, and to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.name: Nguyet

texts.en:
Nguyet, 59, lives in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City with her family, including a daughter and her husband. Nguyet and her husband earn money through their business selling food and household items from their general store. She started this business four years ago. 

Nguyet would like to get a loan to buy a larger stock of food such as eggs, fast food, noodles, sugar, soft drinks, and milk to meet her customers' needs.

She also hopes her business will ensure that her family members will have a better future.

loans.use: to buy a larger stock of food such as eggs, fast food, noodles, sugar, soft drinks, and milk

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy house building materials like cement, corrugated iron, etc. for the construction of a dwelling house

loans.name: Hang

texts.en: Hang would like to get a loan to buy a larger stock of products such as shampoo, detergent, bags, food, rice, coffee, milk, and sugar to better meet her customers' needs. She also would like to use a part of her loan to pay school fees for her children. She hopes her business will ensure that her family members will have a better future.

loans.use: to buy a larger stock of products to sell from her general store and to pay school fees for her children

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is a repeat client who appreciates the Kiva lenders for contributing to his family's development. He previously bought a cow with the previous loan which has added to his assets and his future source of income. He wants this loan to buy another cow since he is already realizing the benefits of the previous one. His  dream is to build a modest house to accommodate his children. 

Richard makes bricks to meet the needs of the local residents, its from this business that he gets his income to meet his family's needs because of the demand for the bricks by the residents.

He is hard working and resilient.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Yedi Nkonim Group

texts.en:
These four women are part of the group called Yedi Nkonim. They have an average age of 40 and an average of three children. They all live in traditional extended families in Dansoman, one of the neighborhoods in Accra, Ghana. The women are relatives and neighbors who work together buying and selling fish, second hand clothing and groceries. After successfully repaying all previous loans, this is the fifth group loan for the women of the Yedi Nkonim Group. 

Florence intends to use this loan to buy second hand clothing. She purchases her second hand clothing from the market and supplies a diverse clientele of women and men for cash.  Florence hopes to make a good monthly profit, which she will use for expenses related to health, food, clothing and school fees. She will reinvest the remainder in her business. 

They will need a total loan of GHS 3,600 to expand their businesses.

loans.use: to buy second hand clothing for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to pay school fees for his children and use the rest to buy house building materials like cement, corrugated iron, etc. for the construction of a dwelling house for his family

loans.name: Nga's Group

texts.en: Nga is 61 years old and lives with her two sons and her husband. For the past 6 years Nga has been working as a tutor for students to earn an income to support her family. She is the Group Leader of a 7-member loan group that live in Ho Chi Minh City. In the picture she is in the fourth from left wearing white trousers. Each of the other group members are requesting loans to fund income-generating activities. Nga is requesting a loan to repair the bathroom in her house. She hopes that through her loan her family members will have better living conditions.

loans.use: to repair the bathroom in her house.

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William is a male Ugandan aged 40 and a resident of Nyaruziba in Kagadi. He has four children aged 17, 12, 7 and 4, all of whom attend school. He is a single parent because he separated from his wife and he has the sole responsibility for educating and taking care of his children.
The main business /source of income for William is brick laying, but he also rides a motorcycle/boda boda to supplement his business.
He has approached Ugafode for a loan of UGX. 1,500,000 to hire laborers to make bricks for sale. He expects to buy new iron sheets after making profits from the sale of the bricks since he intends to build a modern house for his children.
His plans for the future is to acquire a brick laying machine so as to produce bricks on a large scale. He faces challenges of bad weather during rainy seasons which affects the quality of his bricks.

loans.use: To hire labour for making bricks

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy building materials like cement, iron corrugated zinc, etc.

loans.name: Asociacion De Cristo 1, 3, 4 & 8 Group

texts.en:
Maria is the coordinator of the group, Asociacion de Cristo (Association of Christ) 1, 3, 4 & 8. She is the mother of two children and they live together in a modest home with her long term partner who is also her kids' father. This group is located in the rural area surrounding San Pedro de Macoris. They all live in a big rural community, surrounded by sugarcane fields.

Maria has had her business for around seven years, starting with her first Esperanza loan. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business, and she will buy different products like cosmetics, accessories, hair and beauty products. Before she started doing this business she worked in a beauty salon, where she learned to become a beautician. She also works door-to-door. With her business profits, she plans to have her own beauty salon.

Maria is excited to be taking her thirteenth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loans and she has grown her business. In the short term future, she will be saving to open her beauty salon. She thanks all of you for your support!

loans.use: To buy cosmetic and hair products

loans.name: Assumptah

texts.en:
Assumptah is a married woman 53 years of age living in a rural area with her family of 6 children, that their parents have no money to support. She is a business lady who deals in trading beans, maize, coffee and other dry goods. She has an additional income from farming, which she started in 1990
She works 7 days in a week and 13 hours per day. She started this business in order to get tuition and to add to her income to help the family. She has acquired this loan in order to purchase more food products for her business. She has hopes of expanding into a larger business, which would allow her to deal in larger quantities of goods. This would permit her to educate her grand children to higher levels of learning. Her clients are traders from the surrounding area.
 The challenges she faces is limited capital and price fluctuations. She is trustworthy and hardworking.

loans.use: To buy beans, maize, coffee and other goods for resale

loans.name: Benard

texts.en:
Benard thanks the Kiva lenders for contributing to his previous loan, which boosted his agricultural output and his income in the long run.
He is acquiring another loan to buy more fertilizer and insecticide for his banana plantation, where he is currently challenged by the banana weevil. 
He has hopes of boosting his agriculture production further and being the leading supplier of matoke and expanding into a larger business, which can supply all the people around. He still has challenges of rural customers, who want the bananas at a cheap price, which is not cost effective, as well as limited capital to maintain these plantations in the dry seasons, for example, by switching to irrigation when necessary. He describes himself as a honest man and hardworking man who encourages lenders to keep up the good work of helping business people and developing the community.

loans.use: To buy organic fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to pay schoold fees and buy house building materials like cement, corrugated iron sheets, etc. for the construction of a dwelling house

loans.name: Las Talentosas Group

texts.es: El grupo “LAS TALENTOSAS” está conformado por 08 socios quienes se dedican a  prestan servicios y  al comercio minoristas. Olinda tiene 35 años de edad es soltera con un hijo de 07 años de edad educando. Ella hace 02 años implemento su bodega en su vivienda  con el apoyo de sus padres. Y a las presta servicios de domestica cada fin de semana. Su mayor deseo es implementar una pequeña librería. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de arroz azúcar huevos leche y bebidas. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA  por el préstamo brindado. Olinda es la primera persona parada del lado derecho.
texts.en: The “LAS TALENTOSAS” group is made up of 8 members who provide services and have small businesses.  Olinda is 35 years old, single, and has a seven year old son in school.  She has had a store in her parents’ home for two years and provides domestic services on the weekends.  Her greatest desire is to open a small bookstore.  She will use the money from this loan to buy rice, sugar, eggs, milk, and beverages. The group is grateful to the Kiva lenders for the loan.  Olinda is the first person on the right.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Asociacion De Productores Agropecuarios Roncohuasi Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “ASOCIACION DE PRODUCTORES AGROPECUARIOS RONCOHUASI”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Limatambo, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Marcelina ella es soltera y tiene 48 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de verduras y frutas, la socia vende manzanas,naranjas,uvas,platanos y papayas, la socia también vende zanahorias, tomates y pepinos, la socia tiene un puesto de mercado donde vende las frutas y verduras, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 7 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender las frutas y verduras. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar naranjas, plátanos, uvas, cebollas, zanahorias y pepinos.
 
 Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de ponches, negocio de carpintería, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de restaurant.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These are members of the “ASOCIACION DE PRODUCTORES AGROPECUARIOS RONCOHUASI” communal bank, located in the Limatambo district within the Anta province, in the Cusco department.

Marcelina is 48 years old, single and has two children.  She sells fruits and vegetables, including apples, oranges, bananas, and papayas.  She also sells carrots, tomatoes, and cucumbers.  She has a stall in the market, works from 8:00 am to 5:00 pm, has been selling for seven years and things are going very well for her.  Her dream is to have a shop where she can sell her fruits and vegetables.  She is asking for this loan to buy oranges, bananas, grapes, onions, carrots, and cucumbers.

The other members sell punch, are carpenters, run grocery stores and restaurants.  She is grateful to those who form part of this dream through this means and is committed to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Maria Eucebia

texts.es: Gracias a su primer financiamiento Maria Eucebia compro los insumos necesarios que ayudaron a dar una excelente protección y asistencia a sus cultivos de café, 11 sacos de abono, pago de mano de obra calificada para realizar la limpieza de maleza aplicación de abono entre otras actividades que dieron un excelente resultado al final de la cosecha. Ella se encuentra muy contenta y sobre todo agradecida con DIOS por haber cumplido con la meta propuesta que era la de poder mediante la compra de insumos agrícolas asistir sus cultivos de café ya que de esa manera evito que fueran contaminados por la roya u otra enfermedad que echara a perder su cosecha. Nuevamente Maria Eucebia solicita un segundo financiamiento con el cual asistirá nuevamente la plantación de café ya que después de la corta del grano ella relata que la planta y la tierra quedo deteriorada y dañada esperando nuevamente poder ser apoyada por los diferentes inversionistas en la plataforma de KIVA para seguir trabajando en la única esperanza de crecimiento y desarrollo para su familia e hijos.
texts.en: Thanks to her first loan, Maria Eucebia purchased the necessary supplies to help give her coffee plants excellent protection and assistance. The 11 bags of fertilizer and the money to pay skilled laborers to clean the weeds, apply the fertilizer and other duties gave the final harvest excellent results.  She is very happy and more than anything, she is grateful to God for completing her goal of buying farming supplies to help her coffee plants. This way, the plants can avoid contamination by rust or other diseases that would spoil the harvest. Currently, Maria Eucebia is requesting a second loan which will help again with the coffee plants. After cutting the grains, she says that the plants and the soil will be damaged and deteriorating. She is again hoping to be supported by different Kiva investors in order to continue working on the only hope for growth and development for her family and children.

loans.use: purchase farming supplies for maintaining her coffee plants.

loans.name: Jesus Esta Aqui 2 Group

texts.en:
Hilover is the coordinator of this group: Jesus está Aquí (Jesus is Here) 2. This group is located in the slums that surround the capital city (Santo Domingo). Hilover makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their three children.

Hilover is excited to be taking her tenth loan with Esperanza, after having successfully repaid her previous loans and expanded her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business of selling tennis shoes by purchasing pairs of tennis shoes to sell in her community. She will use the profits to finish building her home and to save toward the university education of her children. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: to buy tennis shoes

loans.name: Mujeres Y Hombres Avanzando 2, 3 & 4 Group

texts.en:
Santa is the coordinator of the group "Mujeres y Hombres Avanzando (women and men going forward) 2, 3 & 4". Her group is located in Samana, a lush, rugged peninsula with a nascent tourism industry. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her two children. She says that her most difficult challenge has been to have an established and successful business. This is the reason why she is accessing loans in this group and in Esperanza.

This is Santa's third loan with Esperanza after having successfully grown her business and repaid her previous loan. She has been running her business for around three years. From the beginning, she started with the savings she had. She will use this loan to increase her inventory, by buying more clothes and other products, such as underwear and cosmetics. She will use the profits to reinvest in her business and to provide her children all they need. She is very thankful for your support.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Mujeres Y Hombres Avanzando 1 Group

texts.en:
Diomeris is the coordinator of her group "Mujeres y Hombres Avanzando (Women and Men Going Forward) 1". Her group is located in Samana, a lush, rugged peninsula with a nascent tourism industry. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her two children. She says that her most difficult challenge has been to raise her children alone, since she is a single mother. She enjoys spending time in her house with her children.

This is Diomeris's 4th loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loans and growing her business.Four years ago, she decided to run a small business from her house and she has been running her business since. She started selling underwear and still does this for a living. This loan will be used to buy underwear to resell to vendors; she is like a wholesaler. She will use the profit to reinvest in her business. She is very thankful for your support.

loans.use: to buy underwear to sell

loans.name: Marylin Esther

texts.es: La señora Marylin, es una mujer emprendedora de éxito  casada y tiene  dos hijos, se dedica a la elaboración de productos elaborados con harina, como es el pan, este negocio fue adquirido por herencia de su mamá, cuenta con el apoyo de sus familiares para la elaboración y comercialización del productos en las comunidades cercanas de su hogar y mercado local, es generadora de empleo en su comunidad, el crédito lo requiere para invertir en materia prima como es la harina, huevos, margarina, levadura, azúcar, manteca, leñas etc.
texts.en: Marylin is a successful enterprising woman.  She is married, has two children, and makes bread.  She inherited this business from her mother and gets help from her family making and selling her products in the nearby communities and at the local market.  She creates jobs in her community and is asking for this loan to buy ingredients such as flour, eggs, margarine, yeast, sugar, lard, and firewood.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Beverly

texts.en:
Beverly works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy a new fishing net. Beverly has been in this business for 5 years now.

In the future, Beverly would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy a new fishing net.

loans.name: Marven

texts.en:
Marven earns a living offering internet cafe services. He is 28 years old, married, and lives in Pangi, Siquijor, Siquijor. He is now well known for the nice quality of services he offers. He has already purchased computer sets and has been able to save from it. His services are self-sustainable and profitable, with a net profit of about PHP 10,000 per month.

Marven is seeking a PHP 30,000 loan. He would like to use the loan to purchase additional computer sets and equipment. This is a regular loan, and would be repaid within a few months. This is his availment. Marven is very diligent and accurate, which only adds to the effective management of his venture.

loans.use: to buy additional computer sets and equipment.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy alfalfa seeds

loans.name: Maria Reina Elizabeth

texts.es: María tiene 37 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida y sus tres hijos de 17 años, 13 años y 2 años de edad. María se dedica a la venta de comales artesanales desde hace más de 15 años. María desea mejorar sus condiciones habitacionales por lo que solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la construcción del techo de la vivienda para lo cual necesita materiales como: lámina galvanizada y polines. Espera poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia.
texts.en: Maria is 37 years old and lives in a home of her own with her life’s partner and three children, ages 17, 13, and 2.  Maria has been selling artesian griddles for 15 years.  Maria wants to improve her living conditions and is asking for a loan through FUSAI to build the roof on her house.  She needs building materials such as galvanized metal and girders.  She hopes to be able to improve living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to build a roof.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 61 years old and married with 4 children. She lives in Señor, Sinacaban, Philippines. Evangeline is a farmer who raises pigs to earn a living. She has been doing this for 10 years. She has requested a loan to buy additional feed.

Evangeline has been a member of PMPC for 7 years. In the future, Evangeline hopes to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional feed.

loans.name: Melania

texts.en:
Melania is 46 years old and married with six children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell (chips, soft drinks, eggs, noodles, coffee, etc.).

Melania has borrowed and repaid 11 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 3 years while earning additional income from selling charcoal. She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock, such as chips, soft drinks, eggs, noodles, and coffee.

loans.name: Denis

texts.en:
Denis is a 40-year-old married man living in an urban area with his family of 6 children, with 4 attending schools in different areas.  He deals in matoke(banana trading), and has an additional income from cultivating coffee.  He started this business in 1990 and works 6 days a week, 14 hours per day.  Denis started this business because of his experience.  He has acquired this loan to boost his matoke(banana) business by allowing him to purchase the bananas at the plantation at a lower cost compared to buying bananas already on the market.

He has hopes of expanding into a larger business which would supply more people around his area.  His clients are traders from Kyotera Town and the surrounding areas.  His main business challenges are lack of enough capital and price fluctuation.  Denis describes himself as a hardworking man and encourages lenders to continue lending to the rural people so that they may expand their businesses.

loans.use: to pay for bananas to sell

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is 43 years old and married with four children. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Wilma has been farming rice for four years and also earns additional income from selling vegetables.

Wilma is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to pay for laborers' salaries for land preparation, and to buy a new variety of rice seeds. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to pay laborers' salaries for land preparation and to buy a new variety of rice seeds.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for medical treatment

loans.name: Maryjane

texts.en:
Maryjane is 38 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy-and-sell Nipa roofing business in the Philippines. She has been running the buy-and-sell Nipa roofing business for three years and also earns an income from buying and selling charcoal. She has requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock of Nipa roofing to sell.

Maryjane has borrowed and paid 12 loans from NWTF before this loan. She aspires to save enough money so that she can have her own service.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of Nipa roofing to sell.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 56 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy-and-sell charcoal business in the Philippines. She has been running the buy-and-sell charcoal business for 10 years and also earns an income from pig fattening. She has requested a 30,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Gloria has borrowed and paid 19 loans from NWTF before this loan. She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Irene works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling pre-paid mobile loads. Irene is borrowing 12,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase stock to sell such as soap, coffee, spices, canned goods, etc. for her general store business. 

Irene has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase stock to sell such as soap, coffee, spices, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Manuela Del Socorro

texts.es:
La Sra. Manuela de 63 años de edad, casada con ocho hijos bajo su responsabilidad, todos mayores de edad, y trabajan son independiente. Es originaria de Carazo, lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte de la región. Se caracteriza por ser trabajador, responsable, con ganas de superación personal. Lamentablemente en su juventud no pudo estudiar, por falta de recursos económicos, en la actualidad ya ha cumplido con formar a sus hijos. Pero sigue en la lucha para mantener su negocio y su independencia económica.
Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica una pulpería es una pequeña tienda que vende productos comestibles como: arroz, frijoles, azúcar, leche, pan, detergente, jabón, aceite, frutas, jugos, gaseosas. Ella dedica a su negocio unas diez horas diarias ofreciendo su producto. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de productos comestibles para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos.  Manuela agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan  a persona de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Sra. Manuela is 63 years old, married, and has eight children who were under her responsibility. All of them are now grown and work independently. Manuela is originally from Carazo, a place that is located in the northern region. She is known for being hardworking, responsible, and having the drive to succeed on a personal level. Unfortunately, she was not able to study in her youth because of the lack of financial resources. However, her children were able to complete their education. Manuela continues to maintain her business and her financial independence.

Thanks to her efforts and her desire to move forward, Manuela manages a small grocery store where she sells products such as rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, detergents, soap, oil, fruit, juices, and sodas. She works approximately 10 hours a day by offering her products. The purpose of this loan is to invest it as operating capital so that she can restock her business of buying and selling grocery products. In the near future, she would like to generate better earnings.

Manuela is grateful for the assistance that Kiva lenders provide to people who have limited resources and come from poor countries, such as Nicaragua, so that they have a means of earning a decent living.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, detergents, soap, oil, fruit, juices, and sodas.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn works hard to support her family. Evelyn is married and has a buy and sell veterinary supplies business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 14000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of veterinary products.

Evelyn has been in this business for 4 years now.

In the future Evelyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of veterinary products

loans.name: Bebita

texts.en:
Bebita is 37 years old and is married with seven children.

She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. Bebita is borrowing PHP 5000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Bebita has been pig fattening for 10 years and also earns additional income from a buy and sell livestock business.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Sasithon

texts.en:
Thai artisan Sasithon creates jewelry and accessories from silver, gemstones and natural materials. She hopes to stock up on supplies for her designs. Sasithon has been selling through NOVICA since 2003. This is her story:

"Silver work is a regional tradition. I design silver jewelry to suit both local and contemporary clothing styles. Recently, I began experimenting with new materials, and especially enjoyed working with coconuts. First I used them in jewelry, but then I started crafting belts, handbags, etc. I feel very proud of my work, I love it."

"I have to pay cash for the materials, which will be a lot. The microcredit will keep my cash flow going smoothly and will allow me to increase my inventory more quickly. Thank you!"

Use this link to view Sasithon's handcrafted jewelry and fashion accessories on the NOVICA site: http://www.novica.com/kiva/3915

loans.use: to stock up on raw materials for her handcrafted jewelry and fashion accessories.

loans.name: Fatima De Jesus

texts.es: Fatima tiene 25 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su hija de 8 años de edad. Fatima trabaja en un comedor cercano a su localidad y de esta forma mantiene a su hija y trata de dar mejores condiciones de vida. Fatima desea construir un pequeño cuarto dormitorio para lo cual solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada y madera y así proceder a la construcción lo antes posible.
texts.en:
Fatima is 25 years old and resides in her own home with her eight-year-old daughter. She works at a diner that is located near her town. This enables her to support her daughter and provide her with better living conditions.

Fatima wants to build a small bedroom, so she is requesting this loan from FUSAI. She will invest in the purchase of galvanized sheets and wood so that she can proceed with the construction work as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy galvanized sheets and wood for building a bedroom.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
La socia Rosa se sigue dedicando al negocio de agricultura,la socia tiene un terreno donde cultiva cafe y platanos,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 hasta las 5:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender el cafe.La socia solicita el credito para comprar semillas y fertilizantes.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Rosa continues to manage an agricultural business. She has a plot of land on which she grows coffee and bananas. Rosa works from 8:00 A.M. to 5:00 P.M. She has been in this business for several years and is doing very well. Her dream is to have a shop where she can sell her coffee.

Rosa is requesting a loan in order to buy seeds and fertilizers. She is pleased with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Matta

texts.en:
Thailand's Matta specializes in designing handcrafted jewelry. She would like to invest in a purchase of silver beads, pearls and gemstones for her jewelry business.

Matta has been selling through NOVICA since 2000. This is her story:

"Chiang Rai, where I am from originally, is home to many ancient ethnic tribes. I began to learn and developed a passion for gemstones and I derive great joy from sharing my creations."

"This micro credit loan will make it possible for me to lower my costs so that I can sell my products at competitive prices. I have to travel to Bangkok to buy all the materials, but if I can buy more at once I can save on the cost of traveling. Also if I can buy materials at a certain quantity, which always requires a large investment, I can save further. I have to pay everything in cash, especially the wages for my team, who I pay daily. This micro credit loan will really help me to add new designs as well. Thank you!"

Use the link below to view Matta's handcrafted jewelry on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/2312

loans.use: to invest in a bulk purchase of materials for her handcrafted jewelry

loans.name: Joeliza

texts.en:
Joeliza, age 25, is from Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte, Mindanao: Philippines. She is married with 2 children. In October 29, 2008, Joeliza became a member with PMPC.  The Coop supported her by providing the capital to start her Sari- Sari store (General Store) business. The business is doing well. It helped her to support their family's basic needs in addition to her husband's income. Joeliza keeps on running the store well even though there is increased competition from other stores. She believes that with PMPC's support, as one family they will sustain and beat the competition.  

Joeliza is now trying to venture into fishing activities. Recently she requested a loan from PMPC in the amount of Php 10,000 to restock inventory for her Sari-Sari store business and to buy fishing accessories to start their fishing business. She is thankful to Paglaum MPC for financing her capital needs. In addition, she wants her business to be well known and to build a good business management for her loyal customers.  With her extra income Joeliza wishes to send all her children to school so they may have stable careers.

loans.use: to restock inventory for her Sari-Sari store business and to buy fishing accessories

location.town: Sindangan - Doña Josefa, Sindangan, Zamboanga del

loans.name: José Roberto

texts.es:
José tiene 65 años de edad, solo estudió hasta tercer grado en la escuela, actualmente él está casado y su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos, tienen dos hijos que ya están casados y han formado sus propios hogares. 

José se dedica al trabajo de carpintero, ya tiene 30 años de realizar esta actividad, este trabajo lo aprendió con un arquitecto que también tenía conocimientos de carpintería.

El préstamo que él está solicitando a CrediCampo, lo necesita para comprar materiales de carpintería como madera, brillo, tornillos y otras herramientas necesarias.

Él planea enseñarles a sus hijos y si es posible a sus nietos, el trabajo de carpintería por si en un futuro no encuentran otro trabajo tengan algo con lo cual defenderse.
texts.en:
Jose is 65 years old and has a third grade education.  He is married and his wife cares for the home.  They have two children and they are married and have formed their own families.

Jose has been doing carpentry for 30 years.  He learned this from an architect who also knew about carpentry.

He is asking for this loan through CrediCampo to buy carpentry supplies such as lumber, varnish, screws and other necessary tools.

He plans to teach his children and if possible his grandchildren how to do carpentry work in case they can’t find other employment in the future.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Maria Lucia

texts.es: María tiene 49 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a sus padres y su hijo. María trabaja como auxiliar de bodega en una empresa cercana a su localidad. María desea construir un muro de retención para proteger su terreno. solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de arena, ladrillo y cemento para proceder a la construcción del muro lo antes posible. Espera poder contar con este financiamiento dado que no cuenta con el capital para hacerlo por su cuenta pero si tiene la capacidad de pago que el crédito implica.
texts.en: Maria is 49 years old and lives in a home of her own with her parents and son.  Maria works as a helper in a local ceramic company store.  Maria wants to build a retention wall to protect her land.  She is asking for this loan through FUSAI to buy sand, brick, and cement to build the wall as soon as possible.  She hopes to get this financing because she doesn’t have the money to do it on her own, but she has the means to make payments to pay back the loan.

loans.use: to build a retention wall.

loans.name: Debora Elizabeth

texts.es: La señora Débora tiene  37 años de edad, es una mujer emprendedora, casada y con un hijo de 12 años se dedica a comercializar ropa y zapatos en los alrededores del domicilio y tiene  10 años de dedicarse a este negocio. Con el préstamo lo  invertirá en estos productos como es sandalias de cuero, sandalias de hules,  zapatos de mujer, zapatos de niños, camisas de mujer, pantalón de  hombres y ropa de  niños.
texts.en: Debora is 37 years old and is an enterprising woman.  She is married, has a 12 year old son and sells clothing and shoes around her home.  She’s been doing this for 10 years and will use the money from this loan to buy things such as leather sandals, rubber sandals, ladies’ and children’s shoes, ladies’ shirts, men’s pants, and children’s clothing.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Chona

texts.en:
Chona is married with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Chona is 43 years old and has four children who are in school.

She has a tailoring  business in the Philippines. Chona requested a PHP 11000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional fabric, thread, needles, etc..

Chona has been in this business for 8 years.  In the future Chona would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional fabric, thread, needles, etc.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “BUENA VISTA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Huayopata, perteneciente a la provincia de La Convención y departamento de Cusco.

La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende leche, azúcar, aceite, galletas y arroz, la socia trabaja desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 10:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar arroz, azúcar, leche y galletas al por mayor.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This borrower is a member of the Communal Bank “Buena Vista”, which is located in the District of Huayopata in La Convención Province, Department of Cusco. She divides her time between her daily activities and managing her grocery business. She sells milk, sugar, oil, cookies, and rice. The borrower works from 6:00 A.M. to 10:00 P.M. Through this business, she has been able to help her children get ahead. Her dream is to expand her grocery store.

The borrower is requesting a loan in order to buy rice, sugar, milk, and cookies in bulk. She is pleased with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, milk, and cookies in bulk.

loans.name: Rene Ernesto

texts.es:
Rene tiene 43 años de edad, estudió hasta bachillerato, él está acompañado y su pareja trabaja entregando recibos de energía eléctrica y también revisa los contadores de energía, tiene 2 hijos que se encuentran estudiando en la escuela y son los únicos que dependen de él.

Rene trabaja como tonificador de lectura y energía, este trabajo lo realiza desde hace 5 años, cuando él terminó de estudiar bachillerato comenzó a buscar templeo, y fue un amigo suyo quien lo recomendó para que trabajara en una empresa de entregar recibos de energía, fue de esta manera que él consiguió este trabajo, el cual le queda a una distancia de 30 minutos desde su casa, él viaja en el bus, y este trabajo también lo hace su esposa,  en un horario de 8:00 AM a 4:00 PM.

Él está  solicitando este préstamo, para comprarles a sus hijos unos libros que les están pidiendo en la escuela y para comprar una computadora, al brindarle el crédito se le estará ayudando a Rene para que pueda darles a sus hijos las herramientas necesarias para que puedan estudiar, y que no tengan que ir a cybers a hacer las tareas, pues no se siente seguro de que sus hijos anden en la calle.


Sus sueños son que sus hijos se preparen, ya que la única herencia que él puede dejarles es que se preparen en una carrera y sean grandes profesionales y personas de bien.
texts.en:
Rene is 43 years old and has a high school education. He is in a relationship and his partner works by delivering electricity invoices and also reading the electric meters. Rene has two children who are studying in school. They are the ones who are dependent on him.

Rene works at his job of maintaining electric meters and has been in this position for the past five years. When he finished high school, he began looking for a job. A friend recommended that he work for a company that delivers electricity invoices. This eventually led to the job he has now. In order to get to work, he must make a 30 minute trip by bus from his house. He and his wife work together. His work schedule is from 8:00 A.M. to 4:00 P.M.

Rene is requesting this loan so that he can buy for his children some books that are required at school, as well as a computer. Receiving this loan will help Rene provide the necessary tools that his children need for their studies. As a result, they won’t have to go to a cybercafé in order to do their homework since it is not safe for his children to be walking through the streets.

Rene dreams of seeing his children prepared since it is the only legacy that he can leave them. Preparing them for a degree will allow them to become successful professionals and good people.

loans.use: to buy books and a computer for his children's studies.

loans.name: Maria Alba

texts.es: María tiene 31 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a sus dos hijas de 17 años y 13 años de edad. María trabaja  como auxiliar en una maquila cercana a su localidad y así lograr ajustar para cubrir los gastos de su hogar. María solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la mejora del piso de la vivienda dado que actualmente es de tierra y desea encementarlo. Por loa anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de cemento, arena, grava y pago de la mano de obra requerida par ala mejora.
texts.en:
María is 31 years old and resides in her own home with her two daughters, ages 17 and 13. She works at as an assistant at a factory near her town. This enables her to cover the household expenses.

María is requesting this loan from FUSAI so that she can improve the floor in her home. There is currently a dirt floor and she wants to pour concrete. For this reason, the loan she has requested from FUSAI will be invested in the purchase of cement, sand, and gravel, as well as the payment for labor that is needed for this improvement.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, and gravel, as well as pay for labor in order to lay down a cement floor.

loans.name: Ven

texts.en:
Ven (pictured here), aged 25, is single, and lives about 10 kilometers from Phnom Penh City with his parents, brother and sister. 

Ven has full-time employment with a hotel in Phnom Penh. He wants to buy a motorcycle to get to work, but he does not have money. Hence, he decided to apply for a loan to make the purchase.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle to get to work.

loans.name: Ariel

texts.en:
Ariel is from Napo, San Juan, Siquijor. He is 32 years old and is married with four children who are in school. 

In 2013, Ariel applied for his membership with PMPC. Hearing all the benefits, he never hesitated to become a member. He maintains the status of being a member in good standing and repays his obligations in a timely manner.

Recently, Ariel has asked for financial assistance of 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to purchase additional variety of goods such as canned goods, beverages and soft drinks. Through this, he hopes to increase his income and be of help in the expansion of his business. He has found assistance for his financial needs through Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative, and he is very thankful with all his heart.

loans.use: To purchase additional canned goods, beverages and soft drinks.

loans.name: Lea

texts.en:
Lea lives in Napo, San Juan, Siquijor, Philippines. She is married and has two children who are in school. In 2013, she applied for her membership to Paglaum MPC. Hearing all the benefits of being a member, she didn't hesitate to become one. She maintains herself as a credible member in good standing, and she always pays her loans in a timely manner. 

Recently, she has asked for a loan of 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) for additional capital for hog raising. She will make use of additional feeds and piglets, and hopes to expand the concrete pig cage. Through this project, she believes she will raise more income and be of help for the expansion of her business. Lea has found comfort in getting her financial needs through Paglaum MPC, of which she is very thankful with all her heart.

loans.use: To purchase additional feeds and piglets.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen is a 61-year-old member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative from Cangmohao, Siquijor, Siquijor. She is industriously caring for her fishing activities. She is married and has eight children. She personally takes charge of her business, and her children work for them as support. The business is doing well. Carmen has humbly taught her children the techniques of how to enjoy business, and at the same time, make earnings from it. The ups and downs of the business are nothing but a normal situation for her. Sometimes they have business losses; sometimes a good return. She is a savvy businesswoman. 

Now Carmen sees a good opportunity to expand her business. She is requesting 8,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) from Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for capital to buy additional nets and fishing accessories. She deeply wishes for a good education for her children and for them to have businesses on their own.

loans.use: To purchase additional fishing equipment.

loans.name: Teodita

texts.en:
Teodita is married with five children. Teodita is 66 years old and lives in Libertad Bajo, Sinacaban, Philippines.

Teodita sells a variety of goods to earn a living, and has had this business for 10 years. Each month, she earns 1,800 PHP (Philippines pesos) doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 10,000 Philippines pesos to restock her store with basic commodities.

Teodita has been a member of PMPC for seven years. In the future, Teodita hopes to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is widowed with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Helen is 59 years old and has one child who is in school.

Helen has a buying and selling of fish business in the Philippines. Helen requested a 20,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan amount through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell.

Helen has been in this business for five years. In the future, Helen would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell

loans.name: Purita

texts.en:
Purita is 66 years old and lives in Libertad Bajo, Sinacaban, Philippines. She is married with four children. 

To earn a living, Purita has a business selling snacks in the community. She earns about 2,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) each month doing this type of work. Purita has requested a loan to purchase raw ingredients for her snack-vending business.

Purita has been a member of PMPC for eight years. In the future, Purita would like to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for her snack-vending business

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline, 55 years old, is from Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental, Mindanao, Philippines. She is a widow and has two children of adult age. She earns a living through a sari-sari store (general store) business.

She has been a member of PMPC for three years and enjoys the privileges of being a member of the Cooperative. Now, she is applying for a loan of 30,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to buy additional stock for her sari-sari store.

Evangeline deeply wishes to maintain herself as a member in good standing with PMPC.

loans.use: to buy additional stock for her sari-sari store (general store) business

loans.name: Barsilisa

texts.en:
Barsilisa is 40 years old and a resident of Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental, Mindanao, Philippines. She is married and has two children, of which the eldest is in college. Barsilisa owns a small Avon outlet, with women's cosmetics and lingerie. She also is engaged in a rice-trading business, from which she gets her means of livelihood. 

Last year, Barsilisa joined PMPC. Hearing all the benefits, she didn't hesitate to become a member, and at present, she enjoys the privileges being a member of the Cooperative. Now, she is applying for a loan of 50,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to pay for school tuition fees of her daughter in college. And the income of her rice trading business and Avon outlet shall be the pay-off for the loan she requested from the Co-op. Barsilisa deeply wishes to maintain herself as a member in good standing with PMPC.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's college tuition fee and buy additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Jenalyn

texts.en:
This is Jenalyn, 28, a resident of GMA, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Nicson, and they have children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. She and her husband are working hard to provide income for their everyday needs.

Jenalyn maintains a direct-selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through the popular direct-selling brands like Avon, Fuller Life, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and other direct-selling brands. A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. A dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalogue, and these are the profits that dealers are investing as their income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 2,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy additional supplies and merchandise products like shampoo, cologne, deodorant, perfume, soap, fabric softener, undergarments and other products needed in her business. 
Jenalyn dreams that her business will get bigger and hopes to improve the living conditions of her family. 

She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional supplies and merchandise products like clothing, footwear, undergarments and cosmetics needed in her business.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
As a married parent of nine children, Letecia works hard to support her family.

She has a buying and selling of vegetables business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Letecia is borrowing 30,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to buy additional vegetables to sell for her vegetable business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now requests a new loan to further build her business.

Letecia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional vegetables to sell

loans.name: Juan David

texts.es:
Esta es la historia de Juan David, nacido en un pueblo donde el nivel socio económico no es muy alto, hijo menor de una familia de cinco personas cuya situación social es humilde padres criados literalmente en el campo con ingresos menores al salario mínimo. Desde que estaba muy pequeño, a el niño Juan David le apasiono todo lo que tuvo que ver con el tema de desarmar objetos electrónicos, para lo cual lo hacía con los juguetes buscando armar otras cosas con las partes de estos, en ocasiones  intentaba armar de nuevo pero era imposible porque ya no encajaban las partes y no tenia las herramientas necesarias para hacerlo.     
Cuando  entró a estudiar a la secundaria unas de las mejores calificaciones fue en las áreas de tecnología e informática, en los trabajos grupales él  tomaba las iniciativas de los proyectos tecnológicos y posteriormente los desarrollaba con los compañeros de clase. Perteneció al club de ciencias de biología y uno de los proyectos que desarrollaron fue hacer Gel fijador de cabello y Shampoo para Piojos. Al entrar a once se destaco en la clase de informática por las buenas  calificaciones, en esos años de colegio Juan perteneció a grupos juveniles tales como la Banda Musical Municipal, también tuvo el lugar en la iglesia como monaguillo y años más tarde  fue sacristán de la parroquia y con el dinero que recibía por el servicio ayudaba a los padres en algunas necesidades para la casa.   
 Al haber terminado los estudios de bachiller académico estuvo en busca de estudio superior gratuito pero en los intentos no pudo entrar a una entidad que prestaba este servicio por lo que tuvo que migrar a la ciudad en busca de las metas. Para ello los hermanos mayores se han establecido ya hace unos años, y tienen una vida digna como cualquier persona y con muchos sacrificios se les ha dado la oportunidad de ayudarlo, dándole estadía y brindándole quizás la única oportunidad para estudiar una carrera profesional, ahora el está establecido en la casa de uno de los hermanos. 
Las metas para cuando termine de estudiar es poder conseguir trabajo para ayudarle a los padres, ya que por la edad ellos no están en condiciones para ejercer ningún trabajo. También  tiene en  mente regresar al pueblo natal y crear el propio negocio para que este pueblo no sufra por la falta de personal técnico para la reparación de equipos de computo.
El se entero del convenio de kiva y le pareció un modo mas fácil para hacer el pago de las cuotas ya el que valor de las mensualidades le disminuyen y para el pagarlo es  mas fácil por los aspectos que menciona anteriormente, el estaría mas entusiasmado en terminar el programa sabiendo que kiva le puede dar una ayuda para poder terminar el semestre.
texts.en:
This is the story of Juan David, who was born in a town where the socioeconomic level isn't very high. He is the youngest son of a family of five with humble social circumstances. His parents were literally raised in the fields, with an income lower than the minimum wage.

Since he was very young, Juan David has been passionate about everything that has to do with taking apart electronic objects. He used to do this with his toys, looking to put their parts onto other objects. At times he tried to put them together again, but it was impossible because the parts didn't fit and he didn't have the necessary tools to do it.

When he started high school, one of his best grades was in the area of technology and IT (Information Technology). In group tasks, he took the initiative for the technological projects and later developed them with his classmates. He belonged to the Biological Sciences club, and one of the projects that they undertook was to make hair gel and louse shampoo. When he started eleventh grade, he stood out in his IT class because of his good grades.

During those high school years, Juan belonged to youth groups such as the Town Music Band. He also had a position in church as an altar boy. Some years later, he was the parish sacristan; with the money he received for his services, he helped his parents with some household necessities.

After having finished his high school studies, he was looking for free higher education, but he couldn't find an institution that offered this service. Because of this, he had to move to the city to pursue his goals. His older siblings have been settled down for several years now, and they have decent lives like anyone else. With many sacrifices, they have an opportunity to help him, giving him a place to stay and offering him perhaps his only opportunity to study for a professional career. He is now living in one of his brother's houses.

His goal for when he finishes school is to be able to obtain work to help out his parents, as due to their age, they are no longer in condition to do any work. He is also thinking of returning to the town where he was born and starting his own business so that the town will not suffer due to a lack of computer repair personnel.

He found out about the Kiva program, and it seemed to him to be the easiest way of paying for his loans, because the amount of the monthly payments will be less and because making the payments is easier for the aforementioned reasons. He would be more enthusiastic about finishing the program, knowing that Kiva can give him some assistance to be able to complete the semester.

loans.use: to pay for a semester of enrollment.

loans.name: Teothelma

texts.en:
Teothelma is 53 years old, married and a resident of Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte, Mindanao, Philippines. Her husband is a tricycle driver. They have eight children, two of whom are in college. Starting with capitalization of 5,000 PHP, Teothelma opened a sari-sari (general store) and was able to expand it with the help of Paglaum Co-operative. Aside from financial assistance, she was able to generate savings and enjoys the benefits provided by the co-op. She became a member in January 2013 and took out her first loan from the co-op. 

Now for her second loan, Teothelma is applying for 50,000 PHP to purchase additional stocks for her sari-sari store (general store) business, particularly basic commodities. Expanding her inventory will mean additional income. She has confidence that she can maintain the label of a member in good standing. Teothelma is a hard-working mother and wishes to sustain the store and from there afford a good education for her children. In the future, she wants to own a mini-mart someday, and will be fully satisfied if she sees her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks, such as basic commodities, for her sari-sari store (general store) business

location.town: Sindangan-R.J. Macias, Sindangan, Zamboanga del No

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma, aged 57, is married with three adult children. She is from Casul, Sapang Dalaga. Norma has been engaged in fishing for five years and joined Paglaum in 2010. She earns PHP 600 per week from her fishing business.  

Norma has applied for a loan to purchase fishing accessories and fishing net. The profit that she earns in her fishing business will be used for their daily expenses and to save for their retirement.

loans.use: to purchase fishing accessories and fishing net

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines.She has been in this business for 20 years and earns additional income from fish vending.

Evelyn is borrowing PHP 6,000  through NWTF to purchase additional fishing net for her fishing business. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing net

loans.name: Felomina

texts.en:
Felomina, aged 54, is widowed and has eight children, one of whom is in school. She is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables and corn in the Philippines. Felomina has been farming vegetables and corn for three years now, and has borrowed 20 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

Felomina has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to pay for labourers' salaries for clearing the farmland and to purchase vegetable seeds. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure her family's financial stability.

loans.use: to pay for labourers' salaries for clearing the farmland and to purchase vegetable seeds

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 32 years old and is married with three children, who are in school, Gina works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has been in this business for five years.

Gina has requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell, such as canned goods, eggs, soap, milk, etc. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell, such as canned goods, eggs, soap, milk, etc.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is a resident of GMA, Cavite, Philippines. She is 42 years old and is happily married to Melchor who works abroad as an engineer. God has blessed them with five loving children, all of whom are still studying. Life indeed is hard. But by the grace of God, they have been able to raise their children well and are helping each other in working for their family.

Lorna owns a variety store. This is a small store that can be owned by anyone in the community: the store is connected to or just inside their houses. This is where you can buy a sachet of shampoo or conditioner, a bar of soap,  five PHP-worth of cooking oil, or an egg, etc. She buys her products from a wholesaler at a lower price; then she sells it per piece for a higher price to earn profit. She also sells frozen foods. For additional income, Lorna has a rental apartment. Her regular customers are her neighbours, passersby and people in the community. She has a daily minimum income of 900 PHP.

To expand her inventory, Lorna is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP. She will use the loan to buy grocery items, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. This loan will be a great help for her in adding more products to her store.

Lorna hopes to expand her business and dreams that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and there she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God that she studies.

All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Julia Yamileth

texts.es: Doña Julia tiene la edad de 38 años, es casada y tiene 2 hijos los cuales estan en la secundaria, Nos cuenta que desde niña le gusta trabajar por que es hija de una madre trabajadora y luchadora y esto le fue de gran ayuda porque le permitio iniciar por cuenta propia el negocio de venta de granos basicos en el mercado municipal de chichigalpa desde hace 13 años.Ademas de que ya contaba con suficiente experiencia en el negocio. Siempre con el deseo de superacion y lograr obtener mas ingresos para mejorar la calidad de vida de sus hijos, descidio desarrollarse en otro negocio que es la venta de comida(almuerzos) el cual tiene establecido en el mismo local de donde tiene su negocio de venta de granos. Ella considera que hasta la fecha ha tenido exito con sus negocios, ya que cuenta con una clientela fiel. Ella se considera una persona algre, emprendedora,luchadora y con espiritu de superacion.
texts.en: Julia is 38 years old. She is married and has two children, who are at secondary school. She tells us that since she was a little girl she has liked working because she is the daughter of a hard-working and determined mother, and this helped her a lot because it enabled her to start her own business selling staple grains at the market in Chichigalpa. She has been doing this for 13 years now and she already had experience in the business when she started. With the goal of bettering herself and obtaining more income to improve her children’s quality of life, she decided to start another business selling food (lunches).
