She has set this business up in the same location as her grain-selling business. She thinks that she has had success with her businesses up to this date, since she has regular customers. She thinks she is a happy, enterprising, and determined person with a desire for self-improvement.

loans.use: to buy staple grains (rice, beans, oil, sugar, canned food)

loans.name: Djiguene Bakhna 71 Group

texts.fr: Djiguène Bakhna 71 est un groupement féminin qui fait partie du réseau Djiguène Bakhna, il est composé de 5 personnes qui sont toutes des femmes. Elles habitent dans le même quartier et pratiquent la même activité c'est-à-dire vendre des fruits et légumes. Leur présidente s’appelle Ndack, on la reconnait sur la photo par la main levée. Elle demande ce crédit pour renforcer son fond de roulement et diversifier ses produits. Elle appuie son mari dans la gestion des dépenses quotidiennes et les frais de scolarité de ses enfants. Elle commence sa journée à 8h pour revenir à la maison vers les couts de 20h. Elle pense aussi agrandir son commerce et  augmenter ses revenus.
texts.en:
The Djiguène Bakhna 71 Group is part of the Djiguène Bakhna organisation.  It is made up of five women who all live in the same neighbourhood.  The women all sell fruit and vegetables.

The group president is Ndack, she is seen in the photo with her hand raised.  She will use her loan to increase her working capital and expand the range of produce that she offers.  

Ndack helps her husband to provide for the day-to-day expenses of their family and the school fees of their children.  She starts working at 8am and returns home at 8pm.

Ndack hopes to be able to expand her business and improve her income.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Djiguene Bakhna 89 Group

texts.fr: Le groupement  Djiguène Bakhna 89 est groupement de promotion féminin composé de 5 personnes qui habitent dans la même commune et qui font parti du même réseau et qui se réunissent à chaque fois de besoin. Il a comme présidente Ndieynaba qui se reconnait par la main levée sur la photo. Elle s’investit dans la commercialisation des des fruits et légumes. Elle sollicite ce montant pour acheter et vendre des fruits et légumes. Elle appuie son mari dans la gestion des dépenses quotidiennes et les frais de scolarité de ses enfants. Elle commence sa journée à 7h pour la terminer à 20h du soir. A l’avenir, elle souhaite agrandir son activité et améliorer les conditions alimentaires de sa famille.
texts.en: The group Djiguène Bakhna 89 consists of 5 people who live in the same commune and who are part of the same network grouping women who get together each time out of need. The president is Ndieynaba who has her hand raised in the photo. She is involved in the commercialisation of fruits and vegetables. She is requesting this amount to buy and sell fruits and vegetables. She supports her husband in the management of daily expenses and the school fees of her children. She starts her day at 7am to finish at 8pm at night. In the future, she hopes to expand her business and improve the nutritional conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy and sell fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Djiguene Bakhna 45 Group

texts.fr: Le groupement Djiguène Bakhna 45 est une groupement féminin composé de 5 personnes qui sont toutes des femmes. Elles habitent dans le même quartier et pratique une même activité qui est le commerce. Elles ont comme présidente la dame Aissatou qui est elle aussi dans le commerce des fruits et légumes. On le voit sur la photo par la main levée. Elle a une expérience de 10 ans et sollicite ce montant pour renforcer son stock de marchandises et satisfaire ses clients. Mariée et mère de famille, elle aide son mari dans la gestion des dépenses quotidiennes et les frais scolaires des enfants. Elle quitte la maison à 8h pour n’y revenir que le soir vers 20h. Elle voudrait aussi comme toutes les femmes du réseau agrandir  son activité grâce à l’aide des crédits de l’institution.
texts.en:
The Djiguène Bakhna 45 Group is made up of five women who all live in the same neighbourhood.  They are all traders.  

Aissatou is the group's president, she is seen in the photo with her hand raised.  She sells fruit and vegetables and has ten years' experience in her business.  She will use her loan to increase her stock levels in order to meet the demands of her customers.  

Aissatou is married and has children, she helps her husband to provide for the day-to-day expenses of their household, and the school fees of their children.  She leaves the house to begin work at 8am and returns at 8pm.

Like all the other women in the group, Aissatou would like to expand her business through the use of loans offered by the field partner.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Djiguene Bakhna 47 Group

texts.fr: Djiguène Bakhna 47  est un groupement de promotion féminine qui est constitué de cinq femmes qui vivent dans la même localité. Leur activité consiste à faire du commerce. La présidente elle, a fait 9 ans dans ce domaine. Elle s’appelle Fatou, et elle  est à son tout 1èr crédit à l’IMCEC ; avec lequel elle va pouvoir acheter  de la matière première pour coudre des habits et les vendre. Dont des tissus, du fil et de la garniture. Avec le crédit, elle pourra diversifier ses produit et  services.  Et avec les bénéfices de son activité, avoir un minimum de confort familial. Elle pense aussi acheter une autre machine à coudre. Elle aide son mari dans la gestion des charges familiales.
texts.en:
Djiguène Bakhna 47 is a group of five people who all live in the same neighbourhood.  They all work as traders.

Fatou is the group's president, she has nine years' experience in her business.  This will be her first loan with the field partner, UIMCEC.  She will use her loan to buy raw materials for her sewing business.  She will buy fabric, thread and trimmings.  This loan will enable her to diversify the range of goods and services that she offers.

Fatou will use her earnings to achieve a basic standard of comfort for her family.  She would also like to buy another sewing machine.  Fatou helps her husband to provide for the expenses of their family.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as thread, fabric and trimmings for her clothes sewing business.

loans.name: Ricardo Abel

texts.es:
El es ricardo abel, le  gusta la  enfermería ya  que  con esta se  identifica y  quiere  ponerla  en  practica. Referente a  esto es  un  muy  buen  medio por  el  cual  el  ser humano  y  algunos seres  vivos se  sienten  a  gusto  ya  que   por  medio  de  este y  muchos  mas podría llegar  a detectar muchos síntomas  o  patologías, inclusive podría  llegar  a  salvar  una  vida.
También podría ser servicial, útil a  la  hora   de  que  se  presente algún  accidente  en  cualquier  parte del mundo.
También  el  proyecto  hacia un  futuro mejor  en  el  cual puede llegar  a ejercer una  carrera  como  profesional, ya  que  con  esta  puede  llegar  a  darle  una gran  estabilidad al  hogar y  a muchas  mas  personas que  realmente  lo necesitan y  no  tienen  posibilidades de  acceder como  tal a  una  entidad de  salud. 
Hoy  en  día acceder  a  una  entidad  de  salud  esta  muy  complicado, por  tal  razón  es  muy  importante  saber  y  tener en  cuenta  de  que  alguien  de  la  familia estudie para saber  los procedimientos básicos  de  la  salud. 
Por  tal  motivo  pido la  colaboración de kiva para  seguir  los  estudios y así  mismo poder  ser  una persona  mas  en  esta  sociedad que  les  brinde de  los  servicios en un futuro como un gran profesional de la salud.
texts.en:
This is Ricardo Abel.  He likes nursing, identifying himself with this profession and he wants to put his knowledge into practice.  He gets a lot of pleasure out of it because he believes that he and others like him are able to detect illnesses and symptoms and can sometimes even save lives.  He can also be on hand if there is ever an accident in any part of the world.

He also wants to work towards a better future, working as a professional, offering support to families and a lot of other people who really need care and do not have the possibility to go to a health centre.  Nowadays, getting to a health centre is sometimes difficult, so it is important to have someone in the family who you can count on to know the basic health procedures.

That is why he is asking for Kiva’s help to be able to continue his studies so he can be another person who can help society and offer his services as a good health professional.

loans.use: to pay for a semester on his course.

loans.name: Djiguene Bakhna 31 Group

texts.fr: L e groupe de crédit Djiguène Bakhna 31  est un groupement de promotion féminine qui regroupe 5 personnes, membres d’une même famille qui sont toutes des femmes. Elles  font du commerce, de l’élevage. La présidente, Awa, mariée est âgée de 39 ans fait du commerce de tissus, sacs… Elle a une expérience de 2 ans dans ce domaine. Elle n’a pas de charges et travaille pour diversifier les produits et services et avoir un confort social. Elle commence sa journée à 7h pour la terminer à 20h. Elle sollicite ce montant pour renforcer son fond de roulement et diversifier son stock
texts.en:
Djiguène Bakhna 31 Group comprises five women who are part of the same family. They are retailers and breeders.

The group's president, Awa, is 39 years old and married. She sells fabrics, handbags, etc.

She has two years of experience in this field. She doesn't have any expenses and works to diversify her products and services, and gain social comfort.

She starts her day at 7 in the morning, and finishes it at 8 in the evening. She's seeking a loan to bolster her working capital and diversify her stock.

loans.use: to buy and resell various items and sea products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies for growing coffee and corn.

loans.name: Suyapa

texts.es: Doña Suyapa manifestando su gratitud en el seguimiento mediante el tiempo que ha tenido al participar con el apoyo brindado por la cooperativa COMIXMUL en alianza con los inversionistas de KIVA con su primer financiamiento ella  pago puntualmente sus intereses como lo había acordado y el capital al tiempo que ella tenía planeado. Ella pudo comprar con su primer financiamiento los diferentes insumos agrícolas que ayudaron a  vender el producto de café cosechado a muy buen precio en el mercado en su totalidad gracias a la gestión anticipada de compra que había hecho antes de solicitar su financiamiento con una institución local para su compra al final y poder asegurar los ingresos para el bienestar de su familia entre otros. Gracias a su excelente comportamiento de pago doña Suyapa solicito un segundo financiamiento mediante el oficial de promoción y crédito que la visita para dar asistencia y mantenimiento a sus cultivos de café, ya que los excedentes generados no son los suficientes para dar la asistencia técnica posible a sus cultivos. Por lo que ella hoy en día espera nuevamente ser apoyada con dichos fondos para poder llevar a cabo la parte de tecnificación y limpieza con este segundo financiamiento a su plantación ya que la misma quedo deteriorada después de la corta y recolección del grano.
texts.en:
Suyapa is grateful for the loan that she received through COMIXMUL in collaboration with Kiva.  She paid the first loan off on time, according to the conditions and the time she had planned for.  Thanks to her forward planning, she was able to buy the different agricultural supplies she needed to help her sell all her coffee harvest at a good price on the market.  This allowed her to take care of her family and other things.  

Thanks to her good record, Suyapa is now in a position to ask for a second loan through the agent who visits her.  She needs it to look after and maintain the coffee plantation, as the profits were not enough to cover all the technical assistance she needs.  Therefore, she hopes to count on the support again so that she can carry out the technical maintenance and cleaning of her crops, which were left in a state of deterioration after the harvest.

loans.use: to buy supplies to carry out physical and technical maintenance of her coffee plantations.

loans.name: Sreynin

texts.en: Sreynin is 20 years old. She has one child and lives in Oudong, Kampong Speu Province. She is a factory laborer and she earns around $4.33 per day. Now she would like to apply for a loan of $600 to buy a motorbike for commuting. This loan helps her reduce her transportation expenses. In the future, she hopes she can renovate her house.

loans.use: buy a motorbike for commuting

loans.name: Yhanir

texts.en: Yhanir dreams of becoming an accountant but without a degree, knows it may never be possible. Yhanir is currently attending Isec Montero, working towards her degree. She plans to graduate in December 2014 but without a loan from Vittana she thinks that she may need to take time off to work and save until she can return to school. With this loan, Yhanir plans to pay her tuition fees while she saves her salary from her part-time job. With a degree in accounting, she expects to earn $20 a day. Yhanir's parents were never able to complete their primary education. As the youngest, with one older sibling attending college already, Yhanir is unsure how she will be able to finance her education on her own without the assistance of a Vittana Loan. Yhanir's father's salary from his job as a mechanic is the family's primary source of income. To help afford her school and living expenses, Yhanir currently works as a maid.

loans.use: To pay for tuition fees

loans.name: Irene

texts.es: La Señora  Irene  tiene 48 años, es casada,  ella se dedica a la venta  de comida y almuerzo en su puesto de venta en la zona de Senkata, este préstamo es su primera secuencia con la institución. La Señora  Irene  va a usar este préstamo para la compra de mesas y sillas para  su negocio, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es que  la Señora  Irene  necesita esto para brindar mayor comodidad a sus clientes que en ocasiones comen parados, la Señora  Irene  enfrenta retos en su negocio que son que  tiene que levantarse muy temprano cuando hace  frio para preparar su comida,  es propensa a agarrar reumatismo el cual es muy frecuente en personas con esa actividad,  va a utilizar los beneficios en comprar insumos y ofrecer a sus clientes un buen servicio su deseo  para su negocio es el de tener una pensión de comida variada más grande donde pueda vender más y mejor y poder superarse en la vida.
texts.en:
Irene, 48, is married and sells food and prepared lunches from her stall in Senkata.  This loan is her first with the organization.  She is going to use the loan to buy tables and chairs for her business, to be able to offer a better service to her clients on occasions when they sit down to eat.  Irene overcomes many challenges in her work, getting up very early in the cold to make the food.  She often suffers rheumatism, which can be quite common in people who work in such conditions.  

She is going to use the profits she makes to buy supplies and offer her clients a good service.  She hopes to start a home-based restaurant with a good variety of food which she can sell more of with an even better quality.  This will help her to get along in life.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs.

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.en:
Eduardo has always dreamed of working in agricultural engineering. Eduardo is currently attending the UNIBOL, working towards his degree. He plans to graduate in December 2014 but without a loan from Vittana, he fears that he will need to defer his graduation. With this loan, Eduardo plans to buy his schoolbooks. Up until now, he has been managing to get by without them but it has become a challenge. With books and school supplies, he feels he will be able to get better grades. With a career in food science, he expects to earn $13 a day during his first year. 

Unfortunately, Eduardo's parents never had the opportunity to complete their high school education. Without the opportunity for a higher degree, his parents never had the chance to move up. As the youngest of five, with two older siblings attending college already, Eduardo is unsure how he will be able to finance his education on his own without the assistance of a Vittana Loan. Eduardo's father works as a farmer and his salary is the family's primary source of income. Eduardo currently works in a barber shop to help afford his school and living expenses.

loans.use: to pay for textbooks

loans.name: Lie

texts.en:
Lie is 32 years old and married with three children who are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Lie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like rice, soap, sugar, shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell.

Lie has been in this business for six years.

In the future, Lie would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like rice, soap, sugar, shampoo, and groceries to sell

loans.name: Mamilita

texts.en:
Mamilita is 56 years old, married and a resident of Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental, Mindanao, Philippines. She has eight adult-aged children. She earns a living through her buy and sell business. At the same time, she operates a sari-sari store in her house. Both businesses are doing well.

She has been a member of PMPC for three years and enjoys the privileges of being a member of the Cooperative. Now, she is applying for a loan of PHP 40,000 to buy raw materials and equipment to start a carinderia (mini-restaurant) business. Through this, Mamilita hopes to increase her income to support her family and to use for their future needs.

Mamilita deeply wishes to maintain her membership in good standing with PMPC.

loans.use: to buy raw materials and equipment to start a carinderia business

loans.name: Fatou's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe des 3 femmes a été crée depuis le 28 Décembre 2010. Elles sont issues du même village et unies par de bonnes relations sociales et professionnelles. Madame Fatou est la responsable. Elle âgée de 60 ans, elle est  mariée et mère de sept enfants tous scolarisés don quatre garçons.
Elle est assise à gauche de la photo la main levée. Elle s'active dans le commerce de graines d’arachides depuis longtemps et en dispose d'une bonne expérience. Sou nouveau crédit de 300000 francs cfa lui permettra de se payer  50 sacs d’arachides qu'elle va transformer et revendre au détails au niveau du grand marché de la ville. 
Les bénéfices tirés de son activité lui permettront de prendre en charge les besoins alimentaires sanitaires et de payer les fournitures scolaires de ses enfants mais également de renforcer ses épargnes au niveau du banc villageois.
texts.en:
This group of 3 women was created on December 28, 2010. They are from the same village and united by good social and professional relationships. Madam Fatou is the leader. She is 60 years old, she is married and mother to seven children all in school, of which four are boys. She is sitting on the left in the photo with her hand raised. She has been selling ground nuts for a long time and has good experience in this field. Her new loan of 300,000 FCFA will allow her to buy herself 50 bags of ground nuts which she is going to process and resell retail at the large market in the city.

The profits drawn from her business will allow her to take care of the nutritional and sanitary needs and to pay for the school supplies of her children but equally to strengthen her savings at the "banc villageois."

loans.use: to buy bags of ground nuts that she is going to resell retail in her neighborhood.

loans.name: Sokhna's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe a été crée depuis le  début des activité du banc villageois .Il est composé de 5 femmes issues d'un même 

quartier et unies par de bonnes relations sociales et professionnelles.

Madame Mame Coumba la responsable est une femme mariée âgée de 43 ans et mère de 9 enfants dont quatre filles 

et cinq garçons tous scolarisés.Elle debout à droite de la photo la main levée. Elle s'active dans le petit 

commerce de produits de beautés , son nouveau crédit de 410000 lui permettra de se payer des paquets de 

parfums de lait de toilettes et des savons.

Les bénéfices réalisés lui permettent de prendre en charge les besoins alimentaires et les fournitures 

scolaires de ses enfants.
texts.en:
This group was created during the beginning of the activities of the "banc villageois." It consists of 5 women who are from the same neighborhood and united by good social and professional relationships.

Madam Mame Coumba, the leader, is a married woman who is 43 years old and mother to 9 children of whom four are girls and five boys, all in school. She is standing to the right in the photo with her hand raised. She sells beauty products. Her new loan of 410,000 will allow her to buy herself packages of perfumes, beauty lotions and soaps.

The profits made will allow her to take care of the nutritional needs and the school supplies of her children.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, soaps, and lotions for a small shop.

loans.name: Maria Rina

texts.en:
Maria Rina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing through NWTF to purchase additional materials like wood, bamboo, nails, etc for the maintenance of her fishing boat. 

Maria Rina has been in this business for nine years. Maria Rina earns more income from food vending and fish vending.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like wood, bamboo, and nails to maintain her fishing boat

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies to tend her crops of coffee and sugarcane

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy new and used clothing wholesale

loans.name: Koladiya Group

texts.fr:
KOLADIYA est un groupe de l’association KOSSALA de DANGASSA. Il regroupe des femmes qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 36 ans. Mariées avec en moyenne quatre enfants, elles mènent différentes activités  telles la vente de restaurant à l’image de MASSARAN qui est la première personne  debout de la gauche vers la droite de la photo. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à DANGASSA (Région de Koulikoro, République du Mali). 
Elles sont dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années et sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités, vente de restaurant : viande, haricot, etc.
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leurs clientèles, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso il y a trois ans. Elles sont à leur quatrième  prêt solidaire. 
MASSARAN, qui est la présidente du groupe et très connue à DANGASSA, excelle dans la vente de restaurant. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter une quantité importante des viandes, poissons, et condiments.  Elle s’approvisionne à DANGASSA et sur place auprès des grossistes  et vend ses produits alimentaires à DANGASSA, en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.   
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 45.000FCFA somme qui lui  permettra de rembourser le prêt et être réinvestir dans son activité vente de restauration.
texts.en:
Koladiya is a group from the Kossala association from Dangassa. It brings together women who met through family and neighborhood ties. They are on average 36 years old. Married with an average of four children, they manage different businesses such as the sale of catering just like Massaran who is the first person standing from left to right in the photo. They live in large traditional families in Dangassa (Koulikoro region, republic of Mali).

They have been shopkeepers for several years and are very much in demand in their businesses and sales of catering: meat, beans, etc.

Due to the concern of meeting the growing need of their clientele, the members of the group decided to join Soro Yiriwaso's loan program three years ago. They are on their fourth group loan.

Massaran, who is the president of the group and very well-known in Dangassa, excels in selling catering. She plans to use her loan to buy a large quantity of meats, fishes and condiments. She gets her supplies in Dangassa and locally from the wholesalers and sells her food products in Dangassa, retail, for cash and credit, to a clientele consisting of men and women. She hopes for a monthly profit of 45,000 FCFA an amount which will allow her to repay the loan and reinvest in the catering business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for catering.

loans.name: Hernando De Jesús

texts.es:
Hernando es un campesino humilde y trabajador que, desde pequeño comenzó a involucrarse en las tareas del campo, en compañía de sus padres, pues era la única alternativa que tenían para ganarse la vida.
Actualmente es propietario de una finca en la que tiene cultivos de café, plátano y árboles frutales, la cosecha que recolecta es vendida en la plaza de mercado de la región y así genera los recursos suficientes para solventar los gastos familiares y dar sustento a su esposa y sus dos hijos.
El crédito que solicita es un apoyo para fortalecer su negocio, pues con el dinero comprará insumos agrícolas como pesticidas, abonos y larvicidas, que requiere para reabonar sus cultivos y así obtener una cosecha mucho más productiva para aumentar las utilidades al momento de venderla en el mercado.
Hernando como todo ser humano, tiene sueños y lucha para lograrlos, especialmente el de ampliar sus cultivos de café, aumentar la producción para así poder garantizar una estabilidad económica a su familia y brindar una mejor educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Hernando is a humble and hard working country person who, since he was little, began to involve himself in farm work, in the company of his parents since it was the only option they had to earn a living.

Currently, he is owner of an estate that has coffee and banana crops and fruit trees. The harvest he collects is sold in the region's market plaza and so he earns sufficient resources to pay the family expenses and feed his wife and two children. 

The loan he is requesting is support to strengthen his business since, with the money, he will buy agricultural inputs like pesticides, fertilizers and larvicides that he needs to refertilize his crops and thus obtain a much more productive harvest to increase profits when selling at the market. Hernando, like all human beings, has dreams and works hard to achieve them, especially to expand his coffee crops and expand production to be able to guarantee economic stability for his family and to provide a better education to his children.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs like pesticides, fertilizer and larvicides.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is 35 years old and married with one child.

She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. Marivic is borrowing PHP 19,500 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Marivic has been pig fattening for six years and also earns additional income from meat vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
BENKADI est un groupe de l’association FABOLONA de DANGASSA. Il regroupe des femmes qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans. Mariées avec en moyenne deux enfants, elles mènent différentes activités  telles la vente de restaurant à l’image de FATOUMATA qui est la troisième personne  debout  de la droite vers la gauche de la photo. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à DANGASSA dans l’Arrondissement de KOUROUBA (Région de Koulikoro, République du Mali). 
Elles sont dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années et sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités de la vente de restaurant : viande, haricot, etc. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leurs clientèles, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso, il y a quatre ans. Elles sont à leur sixième prêt solidaire. 
FATOUMATA, compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter une quantité importante de condiments alimentaires et des poissons  pour son restaurant.  Elle s’approvisionne à DANGASSA et sur place auprès des grossistes  et vend ses aliments à DANGASSA, en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.   
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 60.000FCFA somme qui lui  permettra de rembourser le prêt et être réinvestir dans son activité vente de  restauration.
texts.en:
Benkadi is a group from the association Fabolona from Dangassa. It brings together women who met through family and neighborhood ties. They are 35 years old on average. Married with an average of two children, they manage different businesses such as the sale of catering just like Fatoumata who is the third person standing from right to left in the photo. They live in large traditional families in Dangassa in the Kourouba Arrondissement (Koulikoro region, republic of Mali).

Due to the concern of meeting the growing needs of their clientele, the members of the group decided to join Soro Yiriwaso's loan program four years ago. They are on their sixth group loan.

Fatoumata plans to use her loan to buy a large quantity of food condiments and fish for her restaurant. She gets her supplies in Dangassa and locally from the wholesalers and sells her food in Dangassa, retail, for cash and credit, to a clientele consisting of men and women. She hopes for a monthly profit of 60,000 FCFA, an amount which will allow her to repay the loan and reinvest in her catering business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for catering.

loans.name: Alfie

texts.en:
This is Alfie, age 31, who is a resident of GMA, Cavite, Philippines. She is single and she lives with her parents. She helps them financially and she is working hard to provide for their everyday needs.
 
Alfie operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns money by purchasing supplies at wholesale prices and selling them by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community members. She earns a minimum of PHP500 in sales every day.

She is requesting a PHP19,000 loan to help her to continue operating her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Alfie dreams that her business will grow bigger and hopes for good health for her family. She meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida previously accessed a 25,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in her personal, household and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another 19,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profits. Her profits from the business will definitely help sustain her family's daily needs and her children's educational expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Zenaida hopes that her business will continue to flourish and dreams of giving her children a good life and education. She meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Miscana

texts.en:
Miscana works hard to support her family. Miscana is married and has a business buying and selling vegetables and spices in the Philippines.

She has requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional vegetables and spices to sell.

Miscana has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, Miscana would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional vegetables and spices to sell.

loans.name: Amgalanbaatar

texts.en: Mr. Amgalanbaatar, 43 years old, lives with his wife and three children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. He has been making roofs on the orders from entities and individuals since 2002. His wife has been running grocery store until now, but due to its inefficient operation, she has decided to sell a single product, sausage. For this purpose, he is requesting a loan of 2,000 USD to buy sausage in large amounts at wholesale prices. His wife believes selling sausages is more profitable than that of wide variety of foodstuffs. If this new business of his wife succeeds, it will contribute to the family income, and improve their living standard.

loans.use: to buy sausage in large amounts.

loans.name: Berawan Salak Permai Group

texts.en:
Ni Kadek runs a business in pigs. Her husband works as a farmer on his own land. During this loan period Ni Kadek has raised five pigs and sold them all. She spent 3,500,000 IDR on feed and bought piglets for 1,500,000 IDR. Ni Kadek earns a gross profit of 7,000,000 IDR and after deducting costs, she earns 2,000,000 IDR. She’s very grateful for the profit. She says thank you to MUK, Kiva and all the lenders. 

After having paid back her last loan, Ni Kadek will continue to borrow. This loan period, she is borrowing again to buy two piglets to fatten and then sell. The current price for one good-quality piglet is 500,000 IDR. She hopes that the business will keep growing and that in future she will become a successful pig breeder.

The Berawan Salak Permai group continues to borrow from MUK. The members feel comfortable taking loans because they have been trained by MUK staff members.

loans.use: to purchase two piglets

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is 45 years old and married with eight children, seven of whom are in school. Nida works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a buy and sell nipa roofing business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional nipa to sell. Nida has been in this business for three years.

In the future, Nida would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional nipa to sell.

loans.name: Lenie

texts.en: Lenie is married with one child. She operates a retail store while her husband works as a private driver to make a living. After five years in the business, Lenie did not manage to grow the business because the revenue generated was all spent on daily needs when her husband stopped working for a month. Despite this, she never lost the will to continue and with GDMPC, she knows it can be possible for things to improve. She took a loan to buy additional grocery goods to sell. She hopes to generate a larger income so that she can improve the business.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Norlita

texts.en:
Norlita is fifty-two years old and married with ten children. With three children in school, Norlita works very hard to provide for them.

Norlita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a loan of PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase additional items like rice, charcoal, eggs, soap, shampoo and groceries to sell. Norlita has been in this business for four years.

In the future Norlita hopes to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like rice, charcoal, eggs, soap, shampoo and groceries to sell

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
Pacita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business buying and selling rice grain in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice grain to sell.

Pacita has been in this business for eight years now. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice grain to sell

loans.name: Rechel

texts.en:
Rechel works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a loan of PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell. Rechel has been in this business for nine years now.

In the future, Rechel would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell

loans.name: Baragnouma Group

texts.fr:
BARAGNOUMA est un groupe de l’association KOSSALA de DANGASSA. Il regroupe des femmes qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 39 ans. Mariées avec en moyenne cinq enfants, elles mènent différentes activités  telles l’achat vente d’ustensiles à l’image de NENE qui est la première personne debout de la droite vers la gauche de la photo. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à DANGASSA (Région de Koulikoro, République du Mali). 
Elles sont dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années et sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités d’achat vente d’ustensiles : cuillère, fourchette, assiette, etc. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leurs clientèles, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt solidaire. 
NENE, qui est la présidente du groupe et très connue à DANGASSA, excelle dans la vente d’ustensiles. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 20 douzaines de cuillères et 10 douzaines de fourchettes. Elle s’approvisionne à BAMAKO et sur place  auprès des grossistes  et vend ses objets  à DANGASSA, en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle mixte.   
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 25.000FCFA somme qui lui  permettra de rembourser le prêt et être réinvestir dans son activité ci-dessous.
texts.en:
Baragnouma Group is part of the Kossala association in Dangassa. It regroups married women who got to know each other through bonds of kinship and community. They average 39 years of age and five children, and live in large traditional families in Dangassa (Koulikoro Region, Republic of Mali).

They run various businesses, such as buying and selling utensils (spoons, forks, plates, etc), just like Nene, the woman on the right in the photograph. They've been in this field for several years and are very much in demand in their businesses.

Eager to meet the growing needs of their clientele, the members of the group decided to join the loan program of Kiva's partner, Soro Yiriwaso. They are seeking their fifth solidarity loan (group loan).

Nene is the group's president, and is very well-known in Dangassa. She excels in selling utensils. She intends to use her loan to buy 20 dozen spoons and 10 dozen forks.

She gets her supplies in Bamako and locally from wholesalers, and retails her products in Dangassa, for cash and on credit, to a mixed-gender clientele. She hopes to turn an average monthly profit of XOF 25'000 (ca US$ 53), which will enable her to repay the loan and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to buy 20 dozen spoons and 10 dozen forks

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
BENKADI est un groupe de l’association BARADA de DANGASSA. Il regroupe des femmes qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 32 ans. Mariées avec en moyenne cinq enfants, elles mènent différentes activités  telles l’achat vente de condiments à l’image de DAMAFING qui est la deuxième personne debout de la droite vers la gauche de la photo. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à DANGASSA dans l’Arrondissement de KOUROUBA (Région de Koulikoro, République du Mali). 
Elles sont dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années et sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités d’achat vente de condiments : poivre, tomate, oignon, etc. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leurs clientèles, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt solidaire. 
DAMAFING compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter une quantité importante des condiments de différentes sortes. Elle s’approvisionne à BAMAKO et sur place  auprès des grossistes  et vend ses condiments à DANGASSA, en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.   
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 60.000FCFA somme qui lui  permettra de rembourser le prêt et être réinvestir dans son activité d’achat vente de condiments.
texts.en:
Benkadi Group is part of the Barada association in Dangassa. It regroups married women who got to know each other through bonds of kinship and community. They average 32 years of age and five children, and live in large traditional families in Dangassa, in the village of Kourouba (Koulikoro Region, Republic of Mali).

They run various businesses, such as buying and selling condiments (pepper, tomatoes, onions, etc), just like Damafing, the second woman from the right in the photograph. They've been in this field for several years and are very much in demand in their businesses.

Eager to meet the growing needs of their clientele, the members of the group decided to join the loan program of Kiva's partner, Soro Yiriwaso. They are seeking their fourth solidarity loan (group loan).

Damafing intends to use her loan to buy a large quantity of condiments of different kinds. She gets her supplies in Bamako and locally from wholesalers, and retails her condiments in Dangassa, for cash and on credit, to a clientele comprising both men and women.

She hopes to turn an average monthly profit of XOF 60'000 (ca US$ 127), which will enable her to repay the loan and reinvest in her condiments business.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of condiments of different kinds

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy ingredients such as rice, oil and sugar.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
Doña Teresa tiene una edad de 54 años, ella es casada, ama de casa y agricultora dedicándose al cultivo de café por muchos años ya que fueron sus padres quienes le inculcaran el trabajo de campo a muy temprana edad siendo ellos agricultores por vocación familiar. Su grado de educación es de primaria completa la cual con gran esfuerzo y sacrificio por sus padres termino con éxito. Ella es madre de 2 hijos quienes son personas adultas y trabajan en el campo en compañía de su padre ayudando a dar el mantenimiento necesario para que sus cultivos de café estén bien asistidos y limpios. La tierra que en familia trabajan es propia la cual está ubicada a un kilómetro de distancia desde su casa de habitación a la cual en ocasiones se trasladan en carro y otras veces caminando. En la comunidad donde ellos habitan la mayoría de pobladores se dedica al cultivo de café pareciendo que la competencia fuera un problema lo cual no lo es; sino la compra de insumos que ayudan a mantener sus cultivos limpios y sanos los cuales el precio de estos es inestable. 
Doña Teresa solicita apoyo financiero para poder asistir sus cultivos de café para esta temporada lo cual es necesario y vital para poder obtener una excelente cosecha la final de la temporada de café. Sus metas poder mantener limpia su plantación de café, la tierra que es vital mantenerla limpia de maleza entre otras esperando ser apoyada por los diferentes inversionistas para poder cumplir su meta.
texts.en:
Teresa is 54 years old and married. She works as a housewife and in agriculture. She has been growing coffee for many years, taught by her parents, who showed her how to work the land when she was a little girl. It is a family tradition. She finished primary school, thanks to her parents’ effort.

Teresa has two children who are adults now and work with their father taking care of the coffee plantations by cleaning them and maintaining them. They work their own land, which is located one kilometer from their house. Sometimes they go by car, sometimes they walk. Most locals grow coffee also, and although competition might seem like a problem for them, it is not. Their challenge is actually to get hold of the supplies they need to keep their plantations clean and healthy, since the prices are unstable.

Teresa is requesting financial help to be able to give maintenance to her coffee plantations, which is necessary for her to be able to have an excellent harvest at the end of the season. Her goal is to keep the plantations clean and weeded. She hopes to receive support from the different lenders in order to achieve her goal.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies for the maintenance of her coffee plantations.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Rowena works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from food vending and fish vending.  Rowena is borrowing PHP 2,7000 through NWTF to buy an additional fishing boat for her fishing business.

Rowena has been sustaining her business activities through her past 8 loans from NWTF.  She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy an additional fishing boat

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda works hard to support her family.  Yolanda is married and has a buy and sell fish business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 26,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.  Yolanda has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Yolanda would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Bawi Lestari 1 Group

texts.en:
With the current loan, Ni Nengah purchased superior piglets.  When the loan came due, she sold all of her pigs and earned a satisfactory profit.  She is really happy for that because during that period, her pigs grew well, without diseases and she could sell them for a high price.  The profits can support the daily life, education for her children and for the most part can provide the capital for her business. 

Now she can renovate her kitchen.  She’s very grateful to MUK, KIVA and Lenders for supporting her business.  She said she will always need assistance from the Loan Officer of MUK to give advice and solutiona for the business.  The Bawi Lestari 1 group borrows a new loan to purchase superior quality piglets, feed and to repair cages.  This pig business has been shown to supplement the family income.

Ni Nengah uses the loan to buy two superior piglets for fattening and super quality of feed for pigs to grow fast.  She plans to save money to develop their business.  Their daily needs are being met by her husband.  Her husband was very supportive of the efforts made by his wife.  Ni Nengah must set aside her money to take care of her parent who stay with her and now they are sick.  She hopes all of the plans will run smoothly and she can become a successful pig breeder.

loans.use: To buy two superior piglets for fattening and super quality feed

loans.name: Sarong

texts.en:
SaRong is a 27-year-old married man with one child.  He lives with his family in a remote area of Svay Chek district, Banteay Meanchey province.  SaRong, together with his wife, operates their farm, planting and harvesting rice both for sustenance and sale.  He has been engaged in his business for almost 10 years and earns a good income from this activity. 

SaRong wants to gain access to financial services and ways to help improve his living situations.  SaRong is requesting a new loan, which he will use to build a hygienic latrine and septic tank for the sake of his family members and so as to improve his household sanitation practices.  Thanks to the water loan program with a special rate offered by Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL), SaRong is encouraged to focus on ensuring healthy living conditions, to safeguard the health of his family and to protect the environment.

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine and septic tank for the sake of his family members.

loans.name: Sorina

texts.en:
Sorina works hard to support her family.  Sorina is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fish to sell.  Sorina has been in this business for 4 years now.

In the future, Sorina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
DANAYA est un groupe de l’association FABOLONA de DANGASSA. Il regroupe des femmes qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 30 ans. Mariées avec en moyenne quatre enfants, elles mènent différentes activités  telles l’achat vente de céréale à l’image de NIAGAMBA qui est la première  personne debout de la gauche vers la droite de la photo. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à DANGASSA dans l’Arrondissement de KOUROUBA (Région de Koulikoro, République du Mali). 
Elles sont dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années et sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités d’achat vente de céréale : mils, riz, haricots, etc. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leurs clientèles, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur troisième prêt solidaire. 
NIAGAMBA, qui est la présidente du groupe et très connue à DANGASSA, excelle dans la vente de céréales. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 3 sacs de riz, 3 sacs de mil, etc.  Elle  s’approvisionne à  DANGASSA et sur place et vend ses produits à DANGASSA,  au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle mixte.   
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 20.000FCFA somme qui lui  
permettra de rembourser le prêt et être réinvestir dans son activité d’achat vente de céréales.
texts.en:
Danaya is a group from the association Fabolona from Dangassa. It groups together women who met through family and neighborhood ties. They are on average 30 years old. Married with on average of four children, they manage different businesses such as buying and selling cereals just like Niagamba who is the first person standing from left to right in the photo. They live in large traditional families in Dangassa in Kourouba Arrondissement (Koulikoro region, republic of Mali).

They have been shopkeepers for several years and are very much in demand for their businesses buying and selling cereals: mils [African cereal], rice, beans, etc.

Due to the concern of meeting the growing needs of their clientele, the members of the group decided to join Soro Yiriwaso's loan program. They are on their third group loan.

Niagamba, who is the president of the group and very well-known in Dangassa, excels in the sale of cereals. She plans to use her loan to buy 3 bags of rice, 3 bags of mil, etc. She gets her supplies in Dangassa and locally and sells her products in Dangassa, for cash and credit to a mixed clientele. She hopes to make a monthly profit of 20,000 FCFA, an amount which will allow her to repay the loan and reinvest in her business buying and selling cereals.

loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: Carlos Gilberto

texts.es: Carlos es originario de Rio San Juan, San Carlos, casado. Tiene 26 años de edad. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la Elaboración de queques y tortas. Inicio su negocio como ayudante de su mama, pero luego la mama le dejo el negocio a él y ahora cuenta con un número considerable de clientes en diferentes barrios de su ciudad. Su meta próxima es construir una casa propia y culminar sus estudios. Solicita el crédito para comprar: Azúcar, Harina, Mantequilla, Empaques, Colorantes, Huevos, Levadura, Chocolate, Leche, Polvo para hornear entre otros. Estima que el crédito le será de mucha ayuda ya que podrá incrementar sus ventas y obtener mejores ganancias. Su plan futuro es culminar su carrera y aumentar el local de su negocio.
texts.en: Carlos is a native of Rio San Juan. He is 26 years old and married. He is bakes and sells cakes and pastries for a living. He began his business as as assistant to his mother, but later his mother left the business to him with a considerable number of customers in different neighborhoods of the city. His next goal is to construct his own house and complete his studies. He is requesting a loan to purchase: sugar, flour, butter, packaging, coloring, eggs, yeast, chocolate, milk, baking powder, etc. He says that the loan will be much help as he will be able to increase his sales and obtain more income. He future plan is to finish his career and expand the shop of his business.

loans.use: to buy sugar, flour, butter, packaging, coloring, yeast, chocolate, milk and baking powder, etc.

loans.name: Kototala Group

texts.fr:
KOTOTALA  est un groupe de l’association BARADA de DANGASSA. Il regroupe des femmes qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 34 ans. Mariées avec en  moyenne quatre enfants, elles mènent différentes activités  telles l’achat vente de condiments à l’image de FATOUMATA qui est la première  personne debout de la droite vers la gauche  de la photo. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à DANGASSA dans l’Arrondissement de KOUROUBA (Région de Koulikoro, République du Mali). 
Elles sont dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années et sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités d’achat vente de condiments : tomate,  oignon, choux, pomme de terre, etc.
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leurs clientèles, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur premier  prêt solidaire. 
FATOUMATA, compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 5 paniers de tomates et piments.  Elle s’approvisionne à DANGASSA et sur place  auprès des grossistes  et vend ses condiments à DANGASSA, en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle mixte.   
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 35.000FCFA somme qui lui  permettra de rembourser le prêt et être réinvestir dans son activité d’achat vente de condiments.
texts.en:
Kototala is a group from the association Barada from Dangassa. It groups together women who met through family and neighborhood ties. They are on average 34 years old. Married with on average four children, they manage different businesses such as buying and selling condiments just like Fatoumata who is the first person standing to the left in the photo. They live in large traditional families in Dangassa in Kourouba Arrondissement (Koulikoro region, republic of Mali).

They have been shopkeepers for several years and are very much in demand for their businesses buying and selling condiments: tomatoes, onion, cabbage, potatoes, etc.

Due to the concern of meeting the growing needs of their clientele, the members of the group decided to join Soro Yiriwaso's loan program. They are on their first group loan.

Fatoumata plans to use her loan to buy 5 baskets of tomatoes and peppers. She gets her supplies in Dangassa and locally from the wholesalers and sells her condiments in Dangassa, retail, for cash and credit, to a mixed clientele. She hopes to make a monthly profits of 35,000 FCFA, an amount which will allow her to repay the loan and reinvest in her business buying and selling condiments.

loans.use: to buy condiments.

loans.name: Tomasa

texts.en:
As a married parent of nine children, Tomasa works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling rice.  Tomasa is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Tomasa has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Mamadou

texts.fr:
Né vers 1976 à DANGASSA, MAMADOU  vit avec ses 10 enfants et ses épouses à KOUROUBA, Préfecture de KATI (Région de Koulikoro, République du MALI).
MAMADOU n’a pas eu la chance  d’aller à l’école. Très tôt  il s’intéressa aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment à l’achat stockage et vente de céréales : maïs, haricots, mils etc. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire sa clientèle en nette croissance, elle décida de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso. Après avoir correctement           remboursé le huitième prêt, il est à son neuvième  prêt individuel  qui sera utilisé pour  acheter, 20 sacs de maïs, 10 sacs de riz auprès des paysans producteurs de GOUALA, KOUROUBA et FIGUIRA qu’il gardera pendant au moins 3 mois. Il vend  essentiellement en gros à une clientèle constituée de revendeurs venant des grandes villes telles BAMAKO, OUELESSEBOUGOU.
MAMADOU  espère réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 200 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour rembourser le prêt et  être réinvestir le reste dans les activités l’achat stockage et vente de céréales.
texts.en:
Born around 1976 in Dangassa, Mamadou lives with his 10 children and his spouses in Kourouba, Kati prefecture (Koulikoro region, republic of Mali).

Mamadou did not have the chance to go to school. From a young age he became interested in income generating businesses notably in buying, stocking and selling cereals: corn, beans, mils [African cereal], etc.

Due to the concern of satisfying his clearly growing clientele, he decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso. After having correctly repaid his eighth loan, he is on his ninth individual loan which will be used to buy 20 bags of corn and 10 bags of rice from the farmers in Gouala, Kourouba and Figuira which he will keep for at least 3 months. He mostly sells wholesale to a clientele consisting of resellers from large cities such as Bamako and Ouelessebougou.

Mamadou hopes to make an average monthly profit of 200,000 FCFA which will be used to repay the loan and the rest will be reinvested in his businesses buying, stocking and selling cereals.

loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en: Marilyn is separated from her husband and she lives together with her children. She makes a living by selling snacks in their village and at the same time raising pigs for sale. With her generated revenue, she was able to successfully repay her previous loan used for the business. She always hopes to earn more income and to be able to save for her family’s future needs. To raise more pigs, she took a new loan to buy piglets and feed. Marilyn is hopeful that in the near future, her business will expand and their living situation improve.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feed

loans.name: Mariana

texts.es: La Sra. Mariana  es cliente antigua de la institución, sigue la misma actividad de la Venta de comida, cuenta que le fue bien con el anterior crédito ya que lo utilizo en la compra de mesas y sillas, en esta ocasión solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos para la elaboración de sus riquísimas comidas como abarrotes y aceite por mayor,  ya que creció en su actividad,   se siente feliz y agradecida con los prestamistas de Kiva por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Mariana  is a long time client of this institution. She continues her business of selling meals. She says that things went well with the last loan which she used to buy tables and chairs. This time she will use the loan to buy supplies like groceries and oil wholesale to make her delicious meals. Her business has grown and she is happy and grateful to the lenders at Kiva for the support they provide.

loans.use: to buy supplies to make her meals.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
BENKADI  est un groupe de l’association DEME de N’TENTOU. Il regroupe des femmes qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans. Mariées avec en  moyenne trois enfants, elles mènent différentes activités  telles l’achat vente de condiments à l’image de FATOUMATA qui est la première  personne debout de la gauche vers la droite  de la photo. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à N’TENTOU dans la  Sous Préfecture de OUELESSEBOUGOU (Région de Koulikoro, République du Mali). 
Elles sont dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années et sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités d’achat vente de condiments : poivre, tomate,  oignon, choux, etc.
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leurs clientèles, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso, il y a cinq ans. Elles sont à leur septième  prêt solidaire. 
FATOUMATA compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 15 paniers de tomate.  Elle s’approvisionne à OUELESSEBOUGOU et sur place  auprès des grossistes  et vend ses condiments à OUELESSEBOUGOU, en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.   
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 60.000FCFA somme qui lui  permettra de rembourser le prêt et être réinvestir dans son activité d’achat vente de condiments.
texts.en:
BENKADI is a group from the association DEME de N’TENTOU. It is composed of women who know one another through ties of kinship and community. The women are 35 years old on average and are married with an average of three children. And they have different businesses, such as the buying and selling of condiments, as does FATOUMATA, who is standing first from the left in the photo. The women live in large traditional families in N’TENTOU, in Sous Préfecture de OUELESSEBOUGOU (Région de Koulikoro, Republic of Mali). They have been working in small-scale commerce for several years and are much in demand for their trade in condiments: black pepper, tomatoes, onions, cabbages, etc. 

Concerned about satisfying the growing needs of their customers, the group members decided five years ago to join the loan program of the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. They are now on their seventh solidarity loan. 


FATOUMATA intends to use her loan to purchase 15 baskets of tomatoes. She gets her supplies  in OUELESSEBOUGOU and locally from wholesalers, and she sells the condiments retail in OUELESSEBOUGOU to men and women customers paying with cash or credit. 

She hopes to make a monthly profit of 60,000 francs CFA that will enable her to pay back the loan and reinvest in her business buying and selling condiments.

loans.use: to purchase condiments, such as black pepper, tomatoes, and onions

loans.name: Maria  Carmen

texts.es:
María Carmen es una señora de 20 años, madre de un niño de 2 añitos, ha sido figura paterna y materna a la vez ya que por esas eventualidades de la vida hoy decidió salir adelante sola, dejando en claro que no necesita la compañía  de un hombre para progresar, y que hoy en día las mujeres poseen gran fuerza de voluntad y determinación, lo que se proponen lo pueden lograr con empeño, amor y siempre inspiradas en sacar adelante a su familia.
María Carmen vive en Santo Domingo, este sector se caracteriza por la presencia de varios negocios y por ser una zona comercial; ella se dedica a la venta de cosméticos pero ahora  María Carmen quiere acceder a un crédito para comprar ropa como blusas, shores y pantalones ya que  también quiere dedicarse a este negocio porque cuenta con clientela que le solicita esta mercadería; además para comprarse una vitrina y exponer sus productos desde casa, ahora se presentó la oportunidad de hacer esta inversión, ya que en ocasiones pasadas ha tenido ideas para emprender en este negocio pero por falta de capital no lo ha podido realizar, María agradece a Fundación Alternativa y en especial al Proyecto Kiva, quienes han hecho posible este sueño, ya que con esto obtendrá ingresos que le permitirán darle a su hijo la calidad de vida que merece.
texts.en:
María Carmen is 29 years old, the mother of a 2 year old child. She has had to be both mother and father at the same time. As things happen in this world she decided to get ahead alone making it clear that she didn't need the company of a man to progress. Today's woman possesses a great amount of will and determination. What they desire they get through determination love and the ever present desire to get ahead with the family. 

María Carmen lives in Santo Domingo an area with a variety of businesses and is a commercial zone. She sells cosmetics but now she wants to access a loan to buy blouses, shorts and pants. She wants to do this business as she has clients that ask her for this merchandise. She also wants to buy a display case to show off her products at home. She now has the opportunity to make this investment. In the past she had thoughts about doing this but never did it because she didn't have the capital. María is thankful to Fundación Alternativa and especially to Kiva who have made this dream possible as by doing this she will make the income that will allow her to provide her son with the quality of life he deserves.

loans.use: to buy merchandise and a display window for her products.

loans.name: Martiniano

texts.en:
Martiniano is 48 years old. He did not have the financial resources to finish school. He is married and his wife works selling rice, which helps him with the household expenses. 

Martiniano raises pigs to sell. He has done this type of work since he was very young. His father taught him this work since it was the only way they had to move the family forward. In addition to this, he also helps his wife with her  business. He  had a farm and he gets up early to go to the fields where he has his crops.When he finishes his work, he comes home to help his wife with the daily chores.

Martiniano requests this loan from GDMPC to buy feed.  In the future, he wants to have a better house than he has now and to be able to give his family a better future. He is sure that he can achieve his goals with the help of these loans.

loans.use: to buy feed.

loans.name: Bawi Lestari 2 Group

texts.en:
After six months of the loan period, Ni Nyoman succesfully  sold her 3 pigs with a satisfactory profit. The profit is less then before because the price of raising pigs fell over the last 6 months. But, Ni Nyoman still can manage her profit to support her family needs.


Most of the members of the Bawi Lestari 2 group earn a satisfactory profit and they decided to continue their loan until they can have their own capital. 
From the loan of 3.500.000 IDR, Ni Nyoman will use it to purchase 3 piglets and the rest of the loan to buy feed. She keeps the piglets for 5 months and then sells them. Because it’s nearly holiday season, the price for pigs is increasing. But, she hope the price for feed does not increase.

Ni Nyoman and the members of the Bawi Lestari 2 feel the benefits of  having this loan. They can purchase piglets and feed and receive training.

 They hope they can have capital of their own and they don’t need to borrow a loan again.

loans.use: to purchase 3 piglets and feed.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
BENKADI est un groupe de l’association BALIMAYA de HEREMAKONO. Il regroupe des femmes qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 32 ans. Mariées avec en moyenne trois enfant, elles mènent différentes activités  telles l’achat vente des produits cosmétique  à l’image de KOROTOUMOU  qui est la première  personne assise sur la chaise de la gauche vers la droite de la photo. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à HEREMAKONO dans la Préfecture de KATI (Région de Koulikoro, République du Mali). 
Elles sont dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années et sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités d’achat  vente des produits cosmétique : parfums, boule d’oreille, crème à lèvre, savon,  etc.
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leurs clientèles, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso, il y a six ans. Elles sont à leur huitième  prêt solidaire. 
KOROTOUMOU, qui est la présidente du groupe et très connue à  HEREMAKONO, excelle dans la vente des produits de cosmétique. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter,  10 cartons de parfum et des lotions.  Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako et sur place auprès des grossistes  et vend ses produits à  HEREMAKONO en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composés d’hommes et de femmes.   
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 10.000FCFA  somme qui lui  
permettra de rembourser le prêt et être réinvestir dans son activité d’achat vente des produits cosmétique.
texts.en:
BENKADI is a group from the association BALIMAYA de HEREMAKONO. It is composed of women who know one another through ties of kinship and community. The women are 32 years old on average and are married having an average of three children. And they have different businesses, such as the buying and selling of cosmetic products, as does KOROTOUMOU, who is sitting in a chair first from the left in the photo. The women live in large traditional families in HEREMAKONO, in Préfecture de KATI (Région de Koulikoro, Republic of Mali). They have been working in small-scale commerce for several years and are much in demand for their trade in cosmetics: perfumes, earrings, lip cream, soap, etc. 


Concerned about satisfying the growing needs of their customers, the group members decided six years ago to join the loan program of the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. They are now on their eighth solidarity loan. 


KOROTOUMOU, who is the group's president and well-known in HEREMAKONO, excels at selling cosmetics. She intends to use her loan to purchase 10 boxes of perfumes and lotions. She gets her supplies in Bamako and locally from wholesalers, and she sells the condiments retail in HEREMAKONO to men and women customers paying with cash or credit. 

She hopes to make a monthly profit of 10,000 francs CFA that will enable her to pay back the loan and reinvest in her business buying and selling cosmetics.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetic products to sell

loans.name: Ma. Luz

texts.en:
Ma. Luz is 25 years old and married with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requests 11,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase noodles, soft drinks, and rice to sell.

Ma. Luz has borrowed and successfully repaid 3 loans from NWTF. She has run the general store for 2 years and earns additional income from loading pre-paid mobile devices.

She aspires to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase noodles, softdrinks, and rice to sell.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en: Mary Ann is a hardworking woman of 37 and the mother of three children. Mary Ann's commercial activity is a small neighborhood store. She runs the store together with her husband, who also works in agriculture. The loan she is requesting will be invested in products that fill her customers' everyday needs. Thus, she is sure she will have good sales, which will help her pay the various expenses of her household.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, spices, snack food and beverages

loans.name: Badenya Group

texts.fr:
BADENYA est un groupe de l’association DIANTOYERELA de N’TENTOU. Il regroupe des femmes qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 38 ans. Mariées avec en moyenne sept enfants, elles mènent différentes activités  telles l’achat vente de condiments à l’image de MARIAM qui est la première personne debout de la droite vers la gauche  de la photo. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à N’TENTOU dans la  Préfecture de Kati (Région de Koulikoro, République du Mali). 
Elles sont dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années et sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités d’achat vente de condiments : poivres, tomates,  oignons, etc.
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leurs clientèles, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso, il y a cinq ans. Elles sont à leur septième prêt solidaire. 
MARIAM compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 10 paniers de tomate, aubergines et des choux.  Elle s’approvisionne à OUELESSEBOUGOU et sur place auprès des grossistes  et vend ses aliments à OUELESSEBOUGOU, en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle mixte.   
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 55.000FCFA somme qui lui  permettra de rembourser le prêt et être réinvestir dans son activité d’achat vente de condiments.
texts.en:
BADENYA is a group from the association DIANTOYERELA de N’TENTOU. It is composed of women who know one another through ties of kinship and community. The women are 38 years old on average and are married having an average of seven children. And they have different businesses, such as the buying and selling of condiments, as does MARIAM, who is standing first from the right in the photo. The women live in large traditional families in N’TENTOU, in Préfecture de KATI (Région de Koulikoro, Republic of Mali). They have been working in small-scale commerce for several years and are much in demand for their trade in condiments: black pepper, tomatoes, onions, etc. 


Concerned about satisfying the growing needs of their customers, the group members decided five years ago to join the loan program of the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. They are now on their seventh solidarity loan. 


MARIAM intends to use her loan to purchase 10 baskets of tomatoes, eggplants, and cabbages. She gets her supplies in OUELESSEBOUGOU and locally from wholesalers, and she sells the food retail in OUELESSEBOUGOU to a mixed customer base paying with cash or credit. 

She hopes to make a monthly profit of 55,000 francs CFA that will enable her to pay back the loan and reinvest in her business buying and selling condiments.

loans.use: to purchase condiments (black pepper, tomatoes, onions, etc.)

loans.name: Airyn

texts.en:
Airyn is 31 years old and married with two children. With one child in school, Airyn works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock like sugar, rice, noodles, etc., to sell.

Airyn has been in this business for five years.

In the future, Airyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like sugar, rice, noodles, etc., to sell

loans.name: Maicol Alixon

texts.es:
El es Maicol Alixon, esta  estudiando administración hotelera y otra carrera por que le interesa  y desea volverse un profesional y conseguir las propias expectativas de trabajo cómodos para el  beneficio a nivel  personal,  las expectativas son cada día superarse  y ser el mejor en lo que hace a nivel profesional 
A nivel familiar, ayudar y sacar la cara por los de la familia y ayudarlos, pero sobretodo llenarlos de orgullo, a nivel laboral, superar etapas para conseguir un trabajo mas cómodo a las expectativas 
Al finalizar mi carrera  desea conseguir un empleo estable y cómodo en cuanto a las expectativas que siempre ha tenido. 
Los planes a futuro que desea es  tener como ya lo había dicho un trabajo estable y cómodo, ser un buen profesional y liderar personal como tal. 
El convenio kiva lle serviría ya que como menciono antes esta estudiando dos carreras y los gastos se incrementan un poco, le seria de gran ayuda poder tener le convenio ya que puede pagar un poco menos de lo que vale la cuota normal.
texts.en:
He is Maicol Alixon.  He is studying hotel administration and another degree because it interests him.  He wishes to become a professional and to find comfortable work prospects for his personal benefit.  His expectations are to improve himself every day and to be the best at what he does on a professional level. 

In regards to his family, his expectation is to help them and to stand up for them.  Above all, he wants to make them proud.  In regards to work, he wants to be successful in finding work that better meets his expectations.

Upon completing his degree he wishes to find stable employment.  He wants it to meet the expectations that he has always had.

His plans for the future, as he has already stated, are to have stable and comfortable work.  He wishes to be a good professional and to lead personnel as such.

As he stated before, he is studying for two degrees, and the Kiva agreement will be useful to him.  The expenses have increased a little.  It will be a big help to be able to have the loan because he will be able to pay a little less than the normal tuition.

loans.use: to pay tuition for a semester.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy ingredients like rice, oil, sugar, noodles, root vegetables, spices, etc.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita solely provides for the family, for she has been separated from her husband. She has a farm of rice that provides her family a way to earn a living. For five years of operating the farm, she has successfully sustained it, and she earns well from this.  

Recently, she borrowed a loan from GDMPC Micro Credit to cover weeding maintenance costs. In the future, she wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family.

loans.use: to pay weeding maintenance costs

loans.name: Anabelle

texts.en:
Anabelle is 36 years old and married with one child in school. Anabelle works very hard to provide for the family.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested an 11,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock like canned goods, biscuits, sugar, etc., to sell.

Anabelle has been in this business for 10 years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like canned goods, biscuits, sugar, etc., to sell

loans.name: Loi

texts.en:
Loi is 56 years old and married with three children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. She and her husband run a business, producing vehicle spare parts. They started this business four years ago.
