Now she is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying some tools and equipment to increase her production of spare parts to better meet her customers' needs. She hopes that this will enable her to attract more customers, and that she will be able to increase the turnover of her business.

loans.use: To buy tools and equipment to produce vehicle spare parts.

loans.name: Florencio

texts.es: Don Florencio es originario de la comarca Las Quebradas. Es de oficio Agricultor, se dedica a la siembra de maíz y frijoles. Esta agradecido con Kiva y MiCrédito ya que logro comprar los insumos agrícolas que necesitaba para realizar la siembra de la cosecha anterior. Solicita un nuevo crédito para comprar: Abono foliar y semillas para la siembra de frijol. Estima que el crédito le será de mucha ayuda ya que podrá obtener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Florencio is from the community of Las Quebradas.  He is a farmer, and he grows corn and beans.

He is grateful to Kiva and MiCrédito because he managed to buy the agricultural supplies that he needed to grow the previous harvest.

He is requesting a new loan to buy leaf fertilizer and seeds to grow beans.  He believes that the loan will be a great help because he will be able to get better earnings.

loans.use: to buy leaf fertilizer and seeds to grow beans.

loans.name: Annabel

texts.en:
Annabel is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase additional spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle for her motorcycle transport business.

Annabel has been in this business for two years. She earns additional income from direct selling personal collection products.

Annabel has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

loans.name: Mai

texts.en:
Mai, 51 and single, lives in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City. She earns money through her business of selling soft drinks. 

She would like to get a loan to buy a larger quantity of beverages to meet her customers' needs. She also hopes her business will ensure that she will have a better future.

loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of beverages to stock her shop.

loans.name: Phương

texts.en:
Mrs. Phương operates a food stall/restaurant selling meat. Phương has been involved in this business for seven years.

Phương is 26 years old, and she is married with two children. She lives and works in Hoang Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with two dependents.

This is Phương's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.

The main hardship that Phương faces in her life is not having a latrine, so her family shares a neighbor's latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

With her business profit, Phương hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

loans.name: Eng

texts.en:
Eng, aged 39, is a widowed woman of four children, one of whom is employed to financially help the family. Eng is the main breadwinner of her family after the death of her husband. She has been busy with growing rice and cassava in each season respectively, as this allows her to bring in money during the time of the year.

Eng will use this loan amount to fix her plowing machine, which is broken and is unable to be used. Through the loan help, she hopes that she will be able to improve the productivity of her farm, thus augmenting her harvest and yield. 

She is very thankful to all lenders in advance.

loans.use: to fix her plowing machine.

loans.name: Edilberto

texts.en:
Edilberto is 50 years old. He is married and blessed with three children. His wife works as businesswoman, which helps him with the household expenses. 

Edilberto provides transportation services in his community, and he earns well from this, their main source of income. He has been running this business for more than nine years. He also has a farm, and he delegates his tenants to oversee the fields where he has his crops. When he finishes his work, he comes to help them on the farm.

Edilberto is requesting this loan from GDMPC to buy new tires for the vehicle and pay for maintenance costs. In the future, he wants to give his family a better future.

loans.use: to buy new tires for the vehicle and pay for maintenance costs

loans.name: Sau

texts.en:
Sau is 60 years old and lives in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City with her family of three children and her husband. She and her husband earn money by making cakes. She stared this business 15 years ago. 

Sau would  like to get a loan to buy a refrigerator to store her cakes to stop them from spoiling and to be able to sell to her customers a better quality product. She also hopes her business will ensure that her family members, and especially her children, will have a better education and a better future.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator to store the cakes that she sells.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Lien

texts.en:
Lien, 34, lives in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City with her family, including a son and her husband. Her husband is a driver for hire. Lien earns money through her business selling soft drinks. 

She would like to get a loan to buy a larger stock of soft drinks to meet her customers' needs. She also hopes her business will ensure that her family members, and especially her child, will have a better education and a better future.

loans.use: to buy a larger stock of beverages for selling at her shop.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Josephine works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming sugarcane. Josephine is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy additional stock, such as soft drinks, sugar, sardines, etc., to sell in her general store business.

Josephine has been sustaining her business activities through her past 23 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock, such as soft drinks, sugar, sardines, etc., to sell.

loans.name: Tutiniso

texts.en:
Tutiniso is 50 years old. She lives with her family in the north part of Tajikistan. She is a careful mother of four children. Her husband is a builder. His income is small, and it is not enough to improve their living conditions. That’s why she is going to organize her own business. She wants to organize a business with growing vegetables such as carrots, onions, potatoes, cabbage, etc. Her children will help her with managing the business. Tutiniso took part in a women's organization course called “To get Ahead” and got a lot of useful information for herself. 

She is asking for a loan of 5,000 Somoni to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers, and to pay for rental land. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy seeds and mineral fertilizers, and to pay for rental land

loans.name: José Gilberto

texts.es:
José tiene 46 años de edad, estudió hasta tercer grado de eduacion básica, está acompañado y su pareja se dedica a los oficios domesticos, tienen tres hijos, de los cuales uno ya es bachiller el otro estudia básica, hay una mayor de edad que está acompañada y tiene su propio hogar, de él dependen solo sus dos menores y su compañera de vida. 

Él trabaja con ganado de repasto y tambien se dedica a la agricultura, este tipo de trabajo lo ha hecho por mucho tiempo, lo aprendió de su padre y decidió hacerlo para tener una fuente de ingresos que le permitiera subsistir, cuenta con una vaca lechera. 

Con el préstamo soloçicitado, comprará una ternera, esto le permitirá criar a sus animales, para que posteriormente le genren buenos ingresos para mantener a su familia.

Sus sueños son poder tener más vacas lecheras y que sus hijos pequeños estudien y se preparen.
texts.en:
José is 46 years old.  He studied through the third grade in elementary school.  He is married, and his partner is a homemaker.  They have three children, one of whom is in high school and another who is in elementary school.  There is also an adult daughter who is married and lives in her own home.  José’s only dependents are his two younger children and his partner.

He works with grazing cattle and also works in farming.  He has done this type of work for a long time now.  He learned it from his father and decided to do it.  In order to have a source of income that would allow him to get by, he also keeps a dairy cow.

With the loan he is asking for, he will buy a calf.  This will allow him to raise his animals, so that later he can generate a good income to take care of his family.

His dreams are to be able to have more dairy cattle and for his younger children to be able to study and prepare themselves.

loans.use: to buy a calf.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a lumber-yard business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 29,500 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to purchase additional wood to sell for her lumber-yard business.

Margarita has been in this business for 10 years. Margarita earns more income from farming sugarcane.

Margarita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional wood to sell

loans.name: Marife

texts.en:
Marife is 39 years old and married with four children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock like soft drinks, coffee, milk, etc., to sell.

Marife has borrowed and paid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years, and also earns an income from farming sugarcane.

She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like soft drinks, coffee, milk, etc., to sell

loans.name: Souleymane

texts.fr:
Né  1980 à OUELESSEBOUGOU, Souleymane  vit avec ses 2 enfants et son épouse dans une famille traditionnelle à N’TENTOU, dans la Sous Préfecture  OUELESSEBOUGOU, (Région de Koulikoro, République du Mali).
Souleymane n’a pas eu la chance de progresser à l’école, très tôt  il s’intéressa aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment à l’achat vente des petits ruminants : poulets, chèvres, mouton, etc. Il a appris cette activité auprès de son oncle maternel, qui  fut jadis un grand commerçant de petits ruminants. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire sa clientèle en nette croissance, il décida de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso. Il est à son deuxième prêt individuel  qui sera utilisé pour  acheter, 10 moutons et  10 poulets auprès des vendeurs des villages de DIGAN, BANANKORO et environs les jours de foire. Il  revend aux commerçants venants de OUELESSEBOUGOU, BAMAKO au comptant a une clientèle composés d’hommes. 
SOULEYMANE espère réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 120.000 FCFA  qui sera utilisé pour rembourser le prêt et  être réinvestir le reste dans les activités d’achat vente des petits ruminants.
texts.en:
Born in 1980 in Ouelessebougou, Souleymane lives with his 2 children and his wife in a traditional family in N'Tentou, in the sub-district of Ouelessebougou (in the Koulikoro region of Mali.) Souleymane did not have the opportunity to attend school; instead he became interested early on in small business, particularly in raising small livestock such as chickens, goats, sheep, etc.

Souleymane learned his business from his maternal uncle, who was already a successful livestock merchant. In order to meet the needs of his growing customer base, Souleymane decided to partner with Soro Yiriwaso. He is on his second individual loan, which he will use to purchase 10 sheep and 10 chickens from sellers in the villages of Digan and Banankoro and the surrounding area on market days.

Souleymane resells to merchants coming from Ouelessebougou and Bamako for cash, to a customer base made up of men. He hopes to earn an average monthly profit of 120,000 francs CFA which he will use to repay the loan and the remainder to reinvest in his business of purchase and sale of small livestock.

loans.use: to purchase sheep and chickens

loans.name: Dulce Maria

texts.es:
Dulce de 38 años de edad, casada con dos hijos menores de edad, de 9,7 años ambos estudian en primaria. Es originaria de Jinotepe, lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte de la región. Se caracterizan por ser trabajadoras, responsables, con ganas de superación personal. En sus ratos libre le gusta disfrutar de la compañía de su familia. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudo terminar sus estudios básicos. En la actualidad lucha día a día para brindarles todas las mejores oportunidades de vida a sus pequeños hijos. 
Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica  la elaboración y venta de repostería como empanadas, pudines, tortas de pina, rin. Ella dedica a su negocio unas diez horas diarias, ofreciendo su producto. La rutina de trabajo es de unas 10 horas diarias, ofreciendo su producto en los colegio de la localidad, y de en su casa de habitación. El  objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra de materia prima como mantequilla, leche, pina, harina, huevos, azúcar, dulce, queso. Para las diferentes reposterías, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Dulce agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Dulce, age 38, is married with two children, ages 7 and 9.  Both are in elementary school.  She comes from Jinotepe, a place located in the northern part of the region.  The people there are known to be hardworking and responsible, with a desire for self-improvement.  In her free time, she likes to enjoy her family’s company.  Unfortunately, due to a lack of financial resources, she didn’t manage to finish elementary school.  These days she struggles day by day to give all the best opportunities in life to her small children.

Thanks to her efforts and her desire to get ahead, she works creating and selling pastries such as empanadas, puddings, pineapple cakes, and other pastries.  She works some ten hours a day, offering her goods.  Her working routine is about ten hours a day, offering her pastries at the local schools and in her home.  The purpose of the loan is to invest in working capital and to stock her business by buying supplies such as butter, milk, pineapple, flour, eggs, sugar, sweets, and cheese for the different pastries.  This is so that in the not-so-distant future she can get a better income.  

Dulce is thankful for the help that Kiva investors give to people with limited resources and in poor countries such as Nicaragua, so that they have a worthwhile means of work.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and stock her business by purchasing supplies such as butter, milk, pineapple, flour, eggs, sugar, sweets, and cheese for different pastries.

loans.name: Armand Brutin

texts.fr: Armand est un camerounais de 30 ans, célibataire sans enfant. il possède et gère une centre de télécommunication où il vend des crédits de communication et des accessoires de téléphones dans un quartier de la ville depuis 2 ans. il sollicite un crédit pour renforcer son stock de marchandises en achetant des crédit de communication afin de satisfaire sa clientèle et d'accroître son chiffre d'affaires les bénéfices générés vont être réinjectés dans son activité et subviendront à ses besoins personnels
texts.en:
Armand is a 30-year-old Cameroonian bachelor without children. He owns and runs a call center where he has sold calling credits and telephone accessories for the last 2 years. He is requesting a loan to build his stock of merchandise by purchasing calling credits in order to meet the needs of his customers and to grow his business.

The profits Armand earns will be reinvested in his business and will provide for his personal needs.

loans.use: to purchase calling credits

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
BENKADI  est un groupe de l’association BADENYA de BAMANANKING. Il regroupe des femmes qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 31 ans. Mariées avec en  moyenne trois enfants, elles mènent différentes activités  telles l’achat vente de condiments à l’image de SALI qui est la première  personne debout de la droite vers la gauche  de la photo. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles au quartier  BAMANANKING dans la  Sous-Préfecture de OUELESSEBOUGOU (Région de Koulikoro, République du Mali). 
Elles sont dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années et sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités d’achat vente de condiments : tomate,  oignon, choux, etc.
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leurs clientèles, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur cinquième  prêt solidaire. 
SALI, qui est la présidente du groupe et très connue à BAMANANKING, excelle dans la vente de condiments. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 10 paniers de tomate.  Elle s’approvisionne à OUELESSEBOUGOU et sur place  auprès des grossistes  et vend ses condiments à OUELESSEBOUGOU, en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle mixte.   
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 60.000FCFA somme qui lui  permettra de rembourser le prêt et être réinvestir dans son activité d’achat vente de condiments.
texts.en:
Benkadi is a subgroup of the borrowing group Badenya from Bamananking. It is made up of women who came to know each other as relatives and neighbors. The women are on average 31 years old; they are all married and have an average of 3 children each. They each run different businesses, such as Sali's business of purchase and sale of spices. Sali is pictured as the first person standing from right to left in the photo.

The women live in large traditional families in the Bamananking neighborhood of the sub-district of Ouelessebougou in the Koulikoro region of Mali. They have all been in business for many years and are very sought after in their respective business of the purchase and sale of spices, such as tomatoes, onions, cabbage, etc .

In order to better meet the growing needs of their customers, the women decided to work with the loan program of Soro Yiriwaso. They are on their fifth group loan. Sali, the president of the group, is very well known in Bamananking and is quite successful in her sale of spices. She plans on using her loan to purchase 10 baskets of tomatoes.

Sali stocks up in Ouelessebougou and in the area from wholesalers; she sells her spices in Ouelessebougou at retail for cash and for credit, to a customer base made up of both men and women. She hopes to earn a monthly profit of 60,000 francs CFA which will allow her to repay the loan and to reinvest the rest in her spice business.

loans.use: to purchase spices

loans.name: Domitila Del Pilar

texts.es: Domitila tiene 32 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida y sus tres hijos. Ella es una mujer emprendedora quien se dedica a la venta de antojitos típicos como: pasteles de carne y tamales. Cuenta con el negocio desde hace más de 6 años y es así como lleva el sustento a su hogar y junto a su compañero de vida mantienen la economía del hogar. Domitila desea encementar el piso de su vivienda con el fin de dar mejores condiciones a sus hijos. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de cemento, arena y grava y así hacer la mejora del piso lo antes posible.
texts.en:
Domitila is 32 years old.  She lives in her own home, together with her partner and three children.  She is an enterprising woman who works selling traditional snack foods such as meat pies and tamales.  She has had this business for more than six years and in this way she has taken care of her home and, together with her partner, has kept up with the household finances.  

With the goal of giving her children better conditions, Domitila wants to pour cement for the floor of her home.  Because of this, she is asking for a loan from FUSAI to invest in the purchase of cement, sand, and gravel.  In this way she can make these floor improvements as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, and gravel to pour cement for the floor of her home.

loans.name: Martha Lorena

texts.es:
Martha es una señora preocupada por el Desarrollo académico de sus Hijos, es casada, maestra de educación primaria del cual tiene 26 años de laborar, actualmente esta señora,  está presentando una necesidad de obtener un financiamiento para apoyarse en los gastos educativos.
Por tal razón esta señora visito ceprodel para solicitar crédito el que utilizaría en gastos de Estudios Universitarios, matricula, útiles escolares, vestuario, zapatos, transporte y alimentación, del cual este sería el crédito recibido numero 23 y este con mayor relevancia  por la importancia del mismo en el desarrollo familiar
texts.en:
Martha is worried about the educational future of her children. She is married and has been a primary teacher for 26 years. 

Martha now sees the need to obtain a loan to help her with education expenses so she has approached Ceprodel for assistance. She plans to use the loan to pay for university courses, enrollment, supplies, clothing, shoes, transport and food. This would be her 23rd loan and very important for the development of her family.

loans.use: pay for university courses, enrollment, supplies, clothing, shoes, transport and food

loans.name: Barkhasmaa

texts.en: Mrs. Barkhasmaa, 31 years old, lives with her brother in a Mongolian traditional ger (portable felt dwelling) on a plot of land in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. She and her brother have been working at a cafe as cooks since 2010. She is requesting a loan of 1700 USD to buy insulation materials such as fiberglass and foam. After insulating her ger, she and her brother will live in a comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned and then less pollutants are released into air. The borrower is very hardworking individual who strives for  abetter future.

loans.use: to buy fiberglass and foam

loans.name: Ma. Margarita

texts.en: Ma. Margarita sold all of her piglets and earned a satisfactory profit. She only needed to maintain them for two months. The profit was used to purchase a sow. She and her husband plan to become piglet sellers. Ma. Margarita will use her loan to purchase superior feed and to renovate the pen. She plans to sell the piglets outside her village in order to earn more income. She hopes her plan goes well. She will use her profit to support her children's education and to support her family's daily needs.

loans.use: to purchase superior feed and to renovate the pen.

loans.name: Claudina

texts.es: La señora Claudina tiene 63 años, ella es viuda hace ya bastante tiempo tiene un hijo de la edad de 19  años, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa, ella vende mantas y polleras en distintas ferias de la ciudad de La Paz, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la señora Claudina,  va a usar este préstamo para compra de ropa al por mayor  y así surtir su negocio, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es incrementar su mercadería, la señora Claudina enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia y va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir comprando  mercadería y así de esta manera genera más ingresos económicos, se siente feliz ya agradecida por la oportunidad que le brindan para crecer en su actividad, mejorara sus ingresos y por ende su calidad de vida de ella y de su familia.
texts.en:
Claudina is 63 years old and has been a widow for some time. She has a son aged 19. Claudina sells clothing, including skirts, and blankets in the local fairs around the city of La Paz.

This loan is her first with this institution. She will use the loan to purchase clothing at wholesale and, thus, restock her business. Her rationale for requesting the loan is to expand her merchandise.

Claudina confronts challenges to her business, especially competition, and she will utilize these funds to continue purchasing merchandise and, in this manner, to generate additional income.

Claudina feels content and very grateful for the offer of an opportunity to grow in her activity and increase her income and, ultimately, the quality of life for her and her family.

loans.use: to buy skirts and blankets at wholesale to sell.

loans.name: Ken

texts.en:
Ken is 35 years old and a married woman with four children, two of whom live with her. She currently lives in the village of Baray district, Kampong Thom which is north of Phnom Penh. Ken is a farmer who generates her income from growing and selling rice and cassavas in the local markets. This enables her to sustain her family and pay for all of household expenses.

Ken is currently requesting a loan so that she can buy a piece of land to expand her farming area. This investment will allow her to develop her business, thus increase her yields and income for her family. As a result, she can live more comfortably and provide a better future for her children. She expresses her thanks to all Kiva lenders in advance.

loans.use: to buy a piece of land to expand her farming area.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia grows and harvest vegetables, work that she has done since she was married. Her husband works as a farmer since it was the only way they had to earn for the family. She gets up early and has to visit the farm where she has to oversee her crops. She sells her harvested farm products in the market in town and some of this sold in their village. 

Letecia is requesting this loan to buy new seedlings and organic fertilizer, since she needs to improve the farm. In the future she wants to improve the general living situation of the entire family.

loans.use: to buy new seedlings and organic fertilizer

loans.name: Carmel

texts.en:
Carmel is 40 years old, married and has one child, who is in school.

Carmel is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Carmel requested a PHP 40000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Carmel has been raising pigs for 14 years now and has borrowed twenty-six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future Carmel would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
Loreta works hard to support her family. Loreta is married and has a bakery business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 30000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients like yeast, milk, butter, sugar, etc.

Loreta has been in this business for 3 years now. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredietns like yeast, milk, butter, sugar, etc

loans.name: Xuân

texts.en:
Mrs. Xuân works in agriculture growing vegetable crops.

Xuân is 38 years old and she is married with 3 children.
She lives and works in Nong Cong district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with 3 dependents

In 2013 Xuân joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Xuân has successfully repaid 1 loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.
Xuân has been involved in this business for 7 years.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having latrine so her family share the neighbor's latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick in order to build a latrine and bath-room.

With her business profit, Xuân hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick, etc. to build a latrine and bath-room.

loans.name: Madelyn

texts.en:
Madelyn is 46 years old and married with three children.

Madelyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy and sell charcoal in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Madelyn has borrowed and repaid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buy and sell charcoal business for 5 years and also earns an income from a general store and raising livestock.

Madelyn aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Madonna

texts.en:
Madonna is married and works hard to support her family.

She sells dried fish in the Philippines and also earns additional income from fishing and pig fattening. Madonna is borrowing PHP 29000 through NWTF in order to buy more fish and ingredients for her dried fish business.

Madonna has been sustaining her business activities through her past twenty loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish and ingredients for her dried fish business.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 40 years old, married and has nine children.  Five of her children are in school.

Gina is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Gina requested a PHP 18000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Gina has been raising pigs for 15 years now, and has borrowed 13 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future Gina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Mach

texts.en:
Mach, 52, is married and has a daughter. He lives with his family in Ho Chi Minh City. 

He and his wife earn an income by running a shop to sell beverages. He started this activity eight years ago. 

Mach is requesting a loan to expand his business by buying a greater variety of beverages, such as green tea and soft drinks, and phone cards to sell at his store and better satisfy his customers. He hopes his business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist him in improving his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy green tea, soft drinks, and phone cards to sell at his store.

loans.name: Naba Dite Ramata

texts.fr:
Née en 1989 à OUELESSEBOUGOU, NABA vit avec son époux dans une  famille nucléaire à N’TENTOU dans la Sous Préfecture de  OUELESSEBOUGOU (Région de Koulikoro, République du Mali). 
NABA n’a pas eu la chance de progresser à l’école, très vite elle s’intéressa aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment l’achat vente d’habillements : pagnes, tissus,  etc.    
Après avoir correctement remboursé le deuxième  prêt précédent, NABA est à son troisième  prêt avec Soro Yiriwaso qui sera utilisé pour acheter, 20 pièces de pagnes. Elle s’approvisionne en marchandise à BAMAKO   et effectue ses ventes au comptant, à crédit et en détail, à domicile, dans le marché et dans les foires  environnantes à une clientèle composés d’hommes et de femmes.  
NABA  espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 100.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour   aider son mari à subvenir aux besoins de la famille, rembourser le prêt et être réinvestir dans les activités d’achat vente d’habillements.
texts.en: Born in 1989 in Ouelessebougou, Naba lives with her husband in a nuclear family in N’tentou, Ouelessebougou subprefecture (Koulikoro region, the Republic of Mali). Naba did not have an opportunity to advance in her schooling. Early on, she got involved in earning a living, in particular buying and reselling clothing: traditional “pagnes” and other fabric, etc. After having duly repaid her preceding second loan, Naba is now on her third loan with Soro Yiriwaso. She plans to sue it to buy 20 sets of traditional colorful “pagnes” fabric. She stocks up in Bamako and retails for cash and on credit, out of her home, at the local marketplace and at the nearby markets, to a mixed clientele. Naba plans to earn an average monthly revenue of 100,000 West African francs, which will be used to help her husband provide for family needs, repay her loan and reinvest in her clothing business.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Carlota

texts.es:
Carlota vive en la ciudad de Huayopata que está ubicado en la provincia de La Convención del departamento del Cusco, ella  es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora que desde muy joven se dedico a la agricultura y le va muy bien pues tiene varios terrenos de cultivos como por ejemplo frutales, café, té, cacao y coca, ella es una persona responsable y amable que pertenece al banco comunal "Buena Vista" de la Asociación Arariwa desde hace varios años. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar comprar semillas y fertilizantes. Carlota agrace a los inversionistas por el préstamo y se compromete a pagar las cuotas con mucha responsabilidad.     

Huayopata es un Distrito Tealero, tiene un Centro Poblado San Pablo, su población aproximada es de 12 mil habitantes.
texts.en:
Carlota lives in the city of Huayopata, which is located the province of La Convención and the department of Cusco. Carlota is an entrepreneurial, hardworking woman who began working in farming and agriculture at a very young age. With lots of experience and a great work ethic, her farming operations are going well. Carlota tends crops of coffee, tea, cacao, coca and various fruits, and she has been a member of the Arariwa Association's community bank "Buena Vista" for several years. 

With the support from this loan, Carlota plans to purchase seeds and fertilizers for her farming operation. She is grateful to lenders for this opportunity and promises to complete all scheduled loan repayments on time. Huayopata, is known to be a tea-producing region. Its capital is San Pablo, which has a population of about 12,000 residents.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers for tending her crops.

loans.name: Angela Samaria

texts.es: Ángela Samaria, mayor de edad casada con un hijo mayor de edad, originaria de uno de los municipios de Chinandega ubicado en el occidente del país, zona que se caracteriza por ser productiva y comercial y donde existe uno de los ingenio mas grande del país donde se produce la azúcar, Ángela se caracteriza por ser una mujer emprendedora, responsable, trabajadora y  con muchos deseos de superación personal, es una microempresaria propietaria y administradora de una pulpería ubicado en su casa de habitación donde ofrece productos de consumo del hogar diario como: arroz, azúcar, frijoles, aceite, golosinas, detergentes, productos congelados, pan, cosméticos, productos perecederos, pamperes, papel higiénicos, medicamentos entre otros, sus compras las realiza al contado en mercados y distribuidoras de otras localidad, tiene clientes fijos y eventuales, sus ventas son al contado y al crédito los cuales recupera semanal lo invertido, inicia su negocio con capital propio como un medio para ayudar con los gastos del hogar, uno de sus sueños es poder crecer mas en su negocio, mejorar su vivienda. El objetivo de este financiamiento es para invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su pulpería y para cubrir con  la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en: Angela Samaria is a married woman with a son of legal age. She is from one of the municipalities of Chinandega located in the western part of the country, which is known for its production and trade. One of the largest sugar mills in the country is located there as well. Angela is an entrepreneurial, responsible, hardworking woman who is eager to improve. She owns and operates a grocery store in her home where she offers everyday home products such as: rice, sugar, beans, oil, sweets, detergent, frozen products, bread, cosmetics, perishables, toilet paper, medication, etc. Her purchases are made in cash from markets or other distributors. She has regular and potential customers. Her sales are in cash and credit, which replenish her weekly investments. She started her business with her own capital as a means to help with household expenses. One of her dreams is to be able to grow her business and improve her home. The objective of this loan is to invest in working capital and stock her grocery store and meet the demand of her customers.

loans.use: for working capital to purchase everyday consumer products such as: basic grains, frozen products, sweets, etc.

loans.name: Erlinda Yaneth

texts.es: Erlinda tiene 20 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su hijo de 3 años y su hija de 4 meses. Erlinda tiene un negocio de pan desde hace cuatro años. La venta la realiza de manera ambulante en las principales zonas de su localidad y ya cuenta con muchos clientes que cada día la prefieren más. Erlinda desea reparar el techo de la vivienda y comprar puertas y ventanas dado que se encuentran en mal estado. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada, madera, puerta y ventanas para la vivienda.
texts.en: Erlinda is 20 years old and lives in her own house with her 3-year-old son and 4-month-old daughter. Erlinda has owned a bakery for four years. She sells her bread as a street vendor in the main areas of her village and already has many clients. Erlinda wishes to repair the roof of her home and purchase doors and windows because they are in poor condition. Therefore, she is requesting this loan from FUSAI to invest in the purchase of galvanized steel, wood, and a door and windows for her home.

loans.use: purchase galvanized steel, wood, and a door and windows for her home.

loans.name: Hường

texts.en:
Mrs. Hường works in agriculture farming food.

Hường is 34 years old and she is married with 2 children.
Hường lives with 2 dependents in Nong Cong district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Hường's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.
Hường has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.
One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having latrine so her family share a neighbor's latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet and bath-room.

In the future Hường hopes to make enough money to provide for her children, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet and bath-room.

loans.name: Loan

texts.en:
Loan. She works in agriculture farming food.

Loan is 29 years old and she is married with 3 children.
Loan supports 3 dependents with her business in Nong Cong district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Loan's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.
Loan has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.
The main hardship that Loan faces in her life is not having latrine so her family shares a neighbor's latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a latrine and bath-room.

In the future Loan hopes to make enough money to provide for her children, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a latrine and bath-room.

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Divina works hard to support her family.

She has a tricycle transportation business in the Philippines and she earns additional income from selling personal products. Divina is borrowing PHP 20,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to buy spare parts for her tricycle transportation.

Divina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her tricycle.

loans.name: Ana Lucia

texts.es:
Ana es una mujer de 30 años, soltera, tiene una pequeña hija, gracias al esfuerzo de sus padres logró terminar la secundaria y luego la falta de recursos económicos lo llevó a trabajar desde muy pequeña para poder sustentar sus necesidades. A pesar de tener un trabajo que le demanda mucho tiempo y esfuerzo, ella dedica mucho tiempo a la crianza y cuidados de su pequeña hija ya que es madre soltera, que en la actualidad tiene 4 años de edad y que por circunstancias adversas sufrió el abandono de su padre. Ahora Ana vive con su hija en Pujilí una parroquia del Cantón Pujilì ubicado en la Provincia de Cotopaxi en la República del Ecuador. Pujili está ubicado en el este de la ciudad de Latacunga, este sector es muy conocido por sus tradiciones y folklor y es conocida como Emporio Musical. Su gente vive al día a día de estas actividades, aunque es un lugar alejado de la ciudad, existen familias que han emprendido en todo tipo de actividades para cubrir sus necesidades y las de su comunidad. 
Ana se dedica a la compra y venta de arroz el mismo que lo trae directamente de la costa del país en donde es mas conveniente por su bajo precio y por ende puede tener mayor utilidad, además se dedica también a la crianza y venta de pollos, ella es una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora, trabaja en forma ambulante entregando el arroz, para esto cuenta con su transporte propio, lo cual le beneficia mucho más, hoy solicita un crédito que lo utilizará en la compra de mas arroz ya que tiene pedidos pendientes de entregar y sus ventas han incrementado mas y esto ayudará a mejorar sus estilo de vida y el de su hija, dándole la educación que se merece.
Ana agradece a Fundación Alternativa en Ecuador y a Kiva por hacer posible el crecimiento en su vida laboral y personal.
texts.en:
30-year old Ana is single and has a young daughter. Thanks to her parents’ efforts, she managed to finish secondary school but then lacked the financial means to continue her education. She has worked from a young age to pay for necessities.

Despite her job that requires a lot of time and hard work, Ana spends a lot of time raising and caring for her daughter as she is a single mother. Her daughter is now four years old and has suffered through the abandonment of her father. Now Ana and her daughter live in Pujili, a parish in the canton of Pujili which is located in Cotopaxi province in Ecuador. It’s an area well known for its traditions, folklore, and music. The people take part in these activities daily even though they live a long distance from the town. Many families have learned new skills to support themselves and their communities.

Ana earns her living buying and selling rice. She transports it directly from the coast where it is cheaper and more available. She also raises and sells chickens. Ana is a very hardworking, enterprising woman who goes from place to place delivering the rice. For this reason she has her own transport which is a great help. Today she is seeking a loan to buy more rice for which she has outstanding orders. Sales have increased, and the income will help improve her and her daughter’s standard of living as well pay for the education she deserves.

Ana is grateful to Fundacíon Alternativa in Ecuador and to Kiva for making possible the improvement in her working and personal life.

loans.use: buy rice

loans.name: Melliendres

texts.en:
Melliendres is 50 years old and married with two children. Melliendres works very hard to provide for them.

Melliendres runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Melliendres has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items such as rice, sugar, soft-drinks and other groceries. 

In the future Melliendres would like to save money to expand her business .

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Mom

texts.en:
Mom, a 44-year-old mother of three, helps her husband operate their farm in a rural area of Prsat Bakong district, Siem Reap province. For many years of growing and harvesting rice, she was able to provide for the family and she has gradually improved her farm. Through her hardships and determination, she aims to give a better education to her children and provide them with their basic needs.

At the moment, Mom has applied for a loan to drill a well in her own yard to ensure enough water for daily consumption. She is hoping that she won’t face a water shortage in the future or she doesn't need to spend much time to collect water from the far-distant areas, so that she can pay more attention to her business and earn more income for her family. She expresses her thanks to all lenders in advance.

loans.use: to drill a well in her own yard.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buy raw materials to make blouses

loans.name: Buvnar

texts.ru: Бувнар 42 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 3 детей. У Бувнар - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Бувнар занимается животноводством, стартовав 12 лет назад, с покупки скота на 15,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Бувнар, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 11 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 12,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Бувнар обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом - на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Бувнар планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на свадьбу сына.
texts.en: Buvnar is 42 years old and married. She and her husband have three children. Buvnar has received secondary education. As a main source of income for her family, Buvnar raises livestock, having launched this business 12 years ago by buying livestock for 15,000 KGS. Thanks to Buvnar’s hard work, her farm now has 11 sheep. Her monthly income is 12,000 KGS. In order to develop her farm further, Buvnar has applied to Bai Tushum microfinance institution for a loan to buy cows in order to increase her livestock. Bunvar plans to use the revenue from her loan for an additional increase of livestock. She also plans to save up for her son’s wedding.

loans.use: to buy cows.

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es:
Alejandro ha trabajado la agricultura orgánica desde hace 10 años. El esta casado y tiene 6 hijas, Alejandro es un productor de café certificado orgánico en FCC. Para fortalecer este proceso el necesita comprar maquinaria que le facilite las actividades en la finca, también quiere comprar una vaca para utilizar el estiércol como materia prima que le permite producir abonos orgánicos y así seguir produciendo un buen café de origen, aumentando la producción y calidad, esta inversión le costara 5.600.000 millones de pesos. 

Alejandro es un productor comprometido con la defensa del medio ambiente por que esta convencido de una agricultura limpia y saludable vale la pena por esta razón también quiere terminar de construir un sedero Agroecológico donde pueda capacitar y demostrar que la agricultura orgánica si es posible, a nivel familiar le gustaría mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y apoyar a sus hijas para que terminen sus estudios. 

La conversión y producción de café orgánico es un proceso integral al largo plazo independiente, saludable, balanceado y amigable con el medio ambiente lo que representa un desafío para los campesinos de Colombia y a Alejandro ha decidido no arriesgar mas su salud; la de su familia ni la de los consumidores, al seguir usando químicos. La FCC están convencida que vale la pena apoyar y fortalecer estas iniciativas alternas. Un préstamo con Kiva representa un futuro sostenible por su producción, su tierra, y su familia.
texts.en:
Alejandro has worked in organic agriculture for 10 years. He is married and has 6 daughters. Alejandro is an FCC certified organic coffee grower. 

To improve his organic process, he needs to buy machinery that will facilitate activities at the farm. He also wants to buy a cow to use the manure as raw material to produce organic compost and therefore yield good coffee, increasing both production and quality. This investment will cost him 5,600,000 million pesos. 

Alejandro is a grower who is committed to protecting the environment and he is convinced that clean and healthy agriculture is worth it. That is why he also wants to finish building  an agro-ecological demonstration garden where he can train and show that organic agriculture is possible. At the family level, he would like to improve his family's quality of life and support his daughters in finishing their schooling.  

The organic coffee conversion and production is a long term process that allows farmers to be  independent, healthy, balanced and environmentally friendly, which represents a challenge to Colombian farmers. Alejandro has decided not to risk his health, his family's or his consumers'  any more by continuing to use chemicals. Kiva's field partner Federación Campesina del Cauca (FCC) is convinced that it is worth supporting and fortifying these alternate initiatives. A Kiva loan represents a sustainable future for production, the land and his family.

loans.use: to produce organic coffee.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
DANAYA est un groupe de l’association  KOTOGNONGONTALA de BAMANANKING. Il regroupe des femmes qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 26 ans. Mariées avec en moyenne  trois enfants, elles mènent différentes activités  telles l’achat vente de condiments à l’image de MAIMOUNA qui est la deuxième personne debout de la gauche vers la droite de la photo. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles au quartier BAMANANKING dans la  Sous Préfecture de OUELESSEBOUGOU (Région de Koulikoro, République du Mali).  
Elles sont dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années et sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités d’achat vente de condiments : poivre, tomate, oignons, etc. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leurs clientèles, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur premier prêt solidaire. 
MAIMOUNA, qui est la présidente du groupe et très connue à BAMANANKING, excelle dans la vente de condiments. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter de condiments alimentaires de différentes sortes (poivre, tomate, oignon,).  Elle s’approvisionne à OUELESSEBOUGOU et sur place auprès des grossistes  et vend ses aliments à OUELESSEBOUGOU, en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle mixte.   
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 30.000FCFA somme qui lui  
permettra de rembourser le prêt et être réinvestir dans son activité ci-dessous.
texts.en:
Danaya Group is part of the association Kotognongontala in Bamananking. It regroups married women who got to know each other through bonds of kinship and community. They average 26 years of age and three children, and live in large traditional families in Bamananking, in Ouelessebougou Prefecture (Koulikoro Region, Republic of Mali).

They run various businesses, such as buying and selling condiments (pepper, tomatoes, onions, etc), just like Maimouna, the second woman from the left in the photograph. They've been in this field for several years and are very much in demand in their businesses.

In order to meet the growing needs of their clientele, the members of the group decided to join the loan program of Kiva's partner, Soro Yiriwaso. They are seeking their first solidarity loan (group loan).

Maimouna is the group's president. She's very well-known in Bamananking, and she excels in selling condiments. She intends to use her loan to buy food  condiments of different kinds.

She gets her supplies in Ouelessebougou and locally from wholesalers, and retails her condiments in Ouelessebougou, for cash and on credit, to a mixed-gender clientele.

She hopes to turn an average monthly profit of XOF 30'000 (ca US$ 64), which will enable her to repay the loan and reinvest in her condiments business.

loans.use: to buy food condiments

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is 31 years old and has two children. She works very hard to provide for them. For the past year, Arlene has run a general store in the Philippines.

Arlene is requesting a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase beverages, rice, canned goods, groceries, and other items to sell. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase beverages, rice, canned goods, groceries, and other items

loans.name: Gay

texts.en:
Gay is single and works hard to support her family. For the past seven years, she has run a tailoring business in the Philippines.

Gay is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase linen, needles, thread, zippers, buttons, and other items. In the future, she would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase linen, needles, thread, zippers, buttons, and other items

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es: La Señora Verónica tiene 21 años, ella se dedica  al venta de carne y menudencias tiene su puesto de venta que se encuentran en la zona Santa Rosa,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la señora Verónica va a usar este préstamo para la compra  de un frízer para mantener su carne en buen estado  y una cortadora de carne, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es que le hace falta estas herramientas de trabajo esenciales para su negocio, la señora Veronica enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia ya que esta época todos se dedican a vender este producto,  va a utilizar los beneficios ampliar el negocio, su deseo para su negocio es ser vendedora mayorista de este producto.
texts.en:
Verónica is 21 years old and makes a living selling meat and other products from her shop in Santa Rosa. This is her first loan with this institution. Verónica plans to use the support from this loan to purchase a freezer for preserving her meat, as well as a meat cutter. When she realized she was lacking some important tools and machines that could make her business more effective, Verónica decided to apply for this loan. 

The main challenge Verónica faces in running her business is competition, since many other people also sell similar products. She hopes this investment will help her to strengthen and expand her business. Verónica's goal is to be the best saleswoman in her community for her genre of products.

loans.use: to purchase a freezer and a meat cutter for her business.

loans.name: Ma. Loreto

texts.en:
Ma. Loreto is 38 years old and married with one child who is in school. For the past 18 years, she has operated a fish-selling business in the Philippines.  Ma. Loreto is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Ma. Loreto is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fish, ice, and plastic bags. In the future, she would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fish, ice, and plastic bags

loans.name: Nanet

texts.en:
Nanet is 32 years old and married with two children who are in school. For the past two years, she has been raising pigs in the Philippines. Nanet has borrowed four previous loans from NWTF to sustain her business.

Nanet is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional feed and piglets to raise. In the future she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional feed and piglet to raise

loans.name: Gloria Del Carmen

texts.es: Gloria del Carmen, mayor de edad acompañada con un hijo independiente, originaria del municipio de Chinandega ubicado en el  occidente del país, Gloria se caracteriza por ser una mujer trabajadora responsable y con muchos deseos de superación personal, es una microempresaria que se dedica a la compra venta de cerdos en pie y sus derivados, venta de hielo, refrescos naturales, popsicles y venta de leche, el cual los tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación, sus compras son al contado en comarcas aledañas a su localidad y en mercados y distribuidoras de este municipio, sus ventas son al contado a destazadores comerciantes de la zona y del mercado central, uno de sus sueños es poder en un futuro no muy lejano realizar algunas mejoras en su casa de habitación. El objetivo de este financiamiento es para un lote de cerdos en pie que se lo vende a buen precio, ya que su demanda ha crecido mas. Gloria agradece mucho el apoyo que los inversionistas kivas les ofrece a personas de bajos recursos económicos.-
texts.en: Gloria del Carmen is married and has a son. She is from Chinandega, which is located in the western part of the country. Gloria is a responsible, hard-working woman with a desire to get ahead. She is a businesswoman who makes a living selling pigs and their products, ice, soft drinks, popsicles, and milk. She runs her business in her house. Her purchases are made in cash in the markets surrounding her village. Her sales are in cash to butchers and traders in her area and in the central market. One of her dreams is to be able to make some improvements to her home in the future. The purpose of this loan is so that she may buy many pigs that she can sell at a good price, because their demand has grown. Gloria greatly appreciates the support that Kiva investors are offering to people of limited economic resources.

loans.use: purchase many pigs to meet the demand that she currently has.

loans.name: Sidiya Group

texts.fr:
SIDIYA est un groupe de l’association BALIMAYA de HEREMAKONO. Il regroupe des femmes qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 31 ans. Mariées avec en moyenne quatre enfants, elles mènent différentes activités  telles l’achat vente de céréales à l’image de SALIMATA  qui est la deuxième personne assise de la  gauche vers la droite  de la photo. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à HEREMAKONO dans la Sous-Préfecture de OUELESSEBOUGOU (Région de Koulikoro, République du Mali). 
Elles sont dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années et sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités d’achat vente de céréales : maïs, mil, fonio, etc. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leur clientèle, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt solidaire. 
SALIMATA, qui est la présidente du groupe et très connue à HEREMAKONO, excelle dans la vente de céréales. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 3 sacs de mil et 3 sacs de maïs.  Elle s’approvisionne à HEREMAKONO et environnant,  et vend ses céréales à OUELESSEBOUGOU, en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.   
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 32.500FCFA somme qui lui  permettra de rembourser le prêt et être réinvestir dans son activité d’achat vente de céréales.
texts.en:
Sidiya Group is part of the association Balimaya in Heremakono. It regroups married women who got to know each other through bonds of kinship and community. They average 31 years of age and four children, and live in large traditional families in Heremakono, in Ouelessebougou subprefecture (Koulikoro Region, Republic of Mali).

They run various businesses, such as buying and selling cereals (corn, millet, fonio, etc), just like Salimata, the second woman from the left in the photograph. They've been in this field for several years and are very much in demand in their businesses.

Eager to meet the growing needs of their clientele, the members of the group decided to join the loan program of Kiva's partner, Soro Yiriwaso. They are seeking their second solidarity loan (group loan).

Salimata is the group's president. She's very well-known in Heremakono, and she excels in selling cereals. She intends to use her loan to buy 3 sacks of millet and 3 sacks of corn.

She gets her supplies in Heremakono and is surroundings, and retails her condiments in Ouelessebougou, for cash and on credit, to a clientele comprising both men and women.

She hopes to turn an average monthly profit of XOF 32'500 (ca US$ 69), which will enable her to repay the loan and reinvest in her cereals business.

loans.use: to buy 3 sacks of millet and 3 sacks of corn

loans.name: Minda

texts.en:
Minda is a farmer living in the rich highland area of San Jose, an area known for good-quality crop production. She is married and has children, all of whom are of school-going age. For the past five years, Minda’s primary income has come from raising hogs. She enjoys keeping her hogs but her biggest business challenge is the lack of funds.

Minda is requesting a loan to buy two piglets and pig feed for her business. She chose ASKI for her loan because they process client loans faster and their loans are at a low interest rate. During her training, Minda learned that microfinance institutions help improve the lives of small-scale farmers. She will use her increased income to help pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy two piglets and pig feed for her business

loans.name: Ryea Anname

texts.en:
Ryea Anname is 28 years old and has three children, two of whom are in school. For the past five years, she has been selling clothing in the Philippines. Ryea Anname has borrowed three previous loans from NWTF to sustain her business.

Ryea Anname is requesting a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of pants, shirts, shorts, and other items. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, shorts, and other items

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is 52 years old, married, and has seven children. She works hard to provide for her family. Marina runs a general store in the Philippines, which she has been doing for 14 years. She earns additional income from selling food.

Marina requested her twelfth loan from NWTF for 19,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase more items such as snack food, sardines, soap, and other groceries. Marina aspires to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase items such as snack food, sardines, soap, and other groceries.

loans.name: Sherlyn Ferry

texts.en:
Sherlyn Ferry works hard to support her family. She operates a general store in the Philippines.  Sherlyn Ferry has been in this business for 10 years.

She requests a 6,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy canned goods and groceries to sell .

In the future, Sherlyn Ferry would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy canned goods and groceries to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Luz

texts.en:
Ma. Luz is 46 years old and married with three children. For the past 17 years, she has run a general store in the Philippines and she also earns an income from selling fish. Ma. Luz works hard to provide for her family. She has borrowed and repaid 17 previous loans through NWTF.

Ma. Luz is requesting a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell. In the future, she aspires to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase groceries to sell

loans.name: Octavio

texts.es: Don Octavio apesar de las dificultades que ha tenido de sobre peso, ha sabio enfrentarlos trabajando a diario, apoyando a sus hijos quienes se han logrado independizar poco a  poco gracias a su actividad  comercial de compra y destace de cerdos, que practica junto a su esposa. El crédito lo solicita para invertir en 10 cerdos en pie, para destace y comercializar  la carne para mantener sus ingresos con lo que mantiene su hogar.
texts.en: In spite of the difficulties he has encountered as a result of his weight, Octavio has found daily work to support his children who have managed to become independent little by little thanks to his business of buying and butchering pigs that he shares with his wife. He is requesting a loan to purchase 10 pigs so that he may sell the meat to maintain his home income.

loans.use: to buy 10 pigs.

loans.name: Elsa Noemi

texts.es: Elsa tiene 69 años de edad y a pesar de su edad no se cansa de trabajar y luchar por mejores condiciones de vida. Elsa se dedica  a la venta de pupusas (preparación alimenticia a base de masa de maíz, frijoles y queso)desde hace más de 20 años. Elsa desea repellar las paredes de la vivienda ya que son a base de adobe lo cual permite que los animales aniden. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de cemento y arena y así proceder a la mejora de las paredes lo antes posible.
texts.en:
Elsa is 69 years old and, despite her age, does not tire of working and struggling for better living conditions. She has been selling pupusas (a food preparation based on corn dough, beans and cheese) for more than 20 years. 

She wants to plaster the walls of her house because they are made of adobe, which allows animals to nest in them. Consequently she is requesting this loan from FUSAI to invest in the purchase of cement and sand so that she can initiate the improvement of her walls as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase cement and sand to plaster the walls of her house.

loans.name: Celia

texts.es: La Señora Celia  tiene 31 años, casada y  tiene tres hijos de las edades de 4, 8 y 20 años, ella se dedica a la venta  de golosinas en su puesto de venta  que se encuentran en la zona de Rosasani, este préstamo es su primera secuencia con la institución,  La Señora Celia  va a usar este préstamo para la compra de un anaquel para  su negocio, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es que  la Señora  Celia necesita estar más cómoda en su quiosco como ya se avecinan las épocas de lluvia esto le perjudicara en la venta de sus productos , la Señora  Celia  es una persona trabajadora desde muy temprana edad empezó a trabajar vendiendo golosinas comprara su anaquel y ya con el tiempo desea tener un atienda donde pueda Ofrecer sus productos al por mayor.
texts.en:
Sra. Celia is 31 years old, married, and has three children 4, 8, and 20. She sells candy from her kiosk in the Rosasani area. This loan is her first with this institution.

Celia plans to use the loan to buy a shelf for her business as she needs to make her kiosk more comfortable. The rainy season is approaching and could harm sales. 

Celia is a hardworking person. She started selling candy at a very young age. In the future she would like to have a store where she can sell products wholesale.

loans.use: buy a shelf for her candy stall

loans.name: Jorenda

texts.en:
Jorenda has run a general store for more than seven years. She earns additional income by selling food. These businesses provide a good source of revenue. 

Jorenda was able to repay her previous loan which helped her  business to be successful. She hopes to improve her business, for it is the only way she could earn an income. She requests a new loan  to purchase additional groceries to sell. 

In the future, she wants to be successful in her business and to provide for her family's needs.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell.

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary is a married woman with four children. For the past two years, she has run a retail business where she sells tomatoes and collard greens. Rosemary describes herself as future-oriented. Her business is located in a semi-urban area and her biggest business challenge is low stock. 

Rosemary is requesting a 10,000 KES loan to buy a stock of cereals to sell. This will be her first loan with SMEP DTM and her loan will enable her to have a variety of items to sell. Rosemary’s business goal is to own a cereal shop within five years.

loans.use: to buy cereals to sell

loans.name: Noralyn

texts.en:
Noralyn is 39 years old and married with seven children.

She earns a living  farming rice in the Philippines. Noralyn requests 22,000 PHP through NWTF to pay the laborer's salary to harvest her rice .

Noralyn has grown rice for 15 years and earns additional income growing vegetables.

She works tirelessly to attain her dream which is to  save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to pay the laborer's salary to harvest her rice.

loans.name: Pedro Jesus

texts.es: Don Pedro es originario de la comarca Asedades. Es de oficio Agricultor, se dedica a la siembra d Maíz, Trigo y Frijoles. Esta agradecido con Kiva y MiCrédito ya que logro cubrir todos los gastos de la cosecha anterior. Solicita un nuevo crédito para comprar: Alambre y alimentos para el ganado. Estima que el crédito le será de mucha ayuda ya que lograra obtener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Pedro is a farmer from the town of Asedades who makes a living tending crops of corn, beans and wheat. He is very grateful to Kiva and MiCrédito for their past and present support, with which he has been able to cover the costs for his most recent harvest.

With the support from this new loan, Pedro plans to purchase wire for fencing and feed for his cattle. He hopes this investment will help him to strengthen his business and increase his profits.

loans.use: to purchase wire for fencing and feed for his cattle.

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Juana raises pigs. To increase the business, Juana’s loan will be used to buy feed and three piglets. In a period of six months, the pigs will be ready to sell. 

The profits gained from this effort will be used entirely to support the family economy.

loans.use: to buy feed and three piglets.

loans.name: Anne

texts.en:
Anne is a married woman with 8 children. She describes herself as future oriented.

She operates a retail business to sell cereal. She has been involved in this business for 2 years. Her business is located in a rural area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be low inventory. She will use 10,000 KES to re-stock cereal. 

Her business goal is to expand within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, her business will grow. 

This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to re-stock  cereal.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda requests 7,000 PHP to improve her business. She has a kiosk where many people come to buy her items. She will buy  rice, beverages, cooking oil, noodles, coffee, sugar, salt, soap and slippers. She has been involved in these business activities since 2002. She feels very comfortable running her business because she can earn money every day. 

Running a business has made Imelda independent because she can be responsible for herself and help her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase rice, drinks, sugar, coffee and salt for her business.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 33 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living raising pigs in the Philippines. Virginia requests 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Virginia has  raised pigs for 12 years and earns additional income from operating a refrigerator repair shop.

She works tirelessly to attain her dream which is to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Jhon Jairo

texts.es: Jhon tiene 22 años de edad, él es un joven soltero vive con sus padres y tiene un hijo de 5 meses al que le quiere mucho y le da la mantención, él se dedica a sembrar papas y también trabaja al jornal, comenta que su padre es agricultor y su madre trabaja en el campo y son ellos quien le enseñan a trabajar en la agricultura. El crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de semilla, fungicidas y abono para cultivar sus plantas. Lo que Jhon aspira que le vaya bien en esta siembra para aumentar sus sembríos y mejorar sus ingresos para darle a su hijo  todo lo que le haga falta.
texts.en:
Jhon is 22 years old, single and lives with his parents. He has a 5-month-old son whom he loves very much. Jhon makes a living farming potatoes and as a agricultural day worker. Both of Jhon's parents work in agriculture and have taught him many skills and farming techniques.

With the support from this loan, Jhon plans to purchase seeds, fungicides and manure for tending his crops. He hopes this investment will help him to strengthen his farming operation and increase his profits so he can provide a bright future for his son.

loans.use: to purchase fungicides and manure for tending his crops.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es: Francisca tiene 36 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposo, su hija de 20 años y su hijo de 12 años de edad quienes se encuentran estudiando en la universidad y en la escuela de la localidad respectivamente. Francisca se dedica a la venta de lociones y productos de belleza por catalogo desde hace más de 8 años. Es así como Francisca se gana el sustento y da a su familia lo necesario. Tanto Francisca comosu esposo trabajan muy duro para sacar adelante a la familia. Ella solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la construcción de un cuarto dormitorio y así dar mejores condiciones a su hijo e hija. Con el monto solicitado comprará cemento, arena, ladrillo y hierro.
texts.en: Francisca is 36 and lives in her own house with her husband, her 20-year-old daughter and her 12-year-old son, who study at the local university and school respectively. Francisca has worked for more than 8 years selling toiletries and beauty products from a catalogue, which is how she earns a living and gives her family what they need. Both Francisca and her husband work very hard to provide for their family. She is asking for a loan from FUSAI to build a fourth bedroom and give her children a better living space. With the amount requested she will buy cement, sand, bricks and iron.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, bricks and iron to build a fourth bedroom.

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
Janeth, a mother of one, helps her husband to work their own farm. For more than six years, the couple has planted and harvested rice.  They earn well for the family. With her revenue, she was able to repay her previous loan used to make the farm successful. She wants to improve the farm and harvest more. 

Education is her priority because she wants a better future for her child.  She requests a new loan to purchase organic pesticides and fertilizer. She plans to use the additional revenue generated with her loan to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase organic pesticides and fertilizer.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is a 25 year old married man with 2 children who are 4 and 7 years old. He describes himself as future oriented. 

He operates a retail business to sell sugar, rice, wheat flour and other items. His business is located in a semi-urban area. He describes his biggest business challenge as inflation. 

He will use 20,000 KES to  re-stock sugar, rice, wheat flour and other items. His business goal is to have a mini-market within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will be a great businessman. 

This is his second loan with SMEP DTM.  His previous loan of 20,000 KES was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to re-stock sugar, rice, wheat flour and other items.

loans.name: Justina Juanita

texts.es: La señora  Justina tiene 28, casada  años y 2  hijos de las edades de 5 y 2 años,  ella se dedica a la elaboración de tortas, masitas tiene su panadería que se encuentra ubicado en su mismo domicilio por la zona de Villa fatima,  el destino del crédito es para la compra de material de construcción para la construcción de su casita y así de esta manera brindar comodidad a su familia, la señora Justina es una persona muy trabajadora lleva años en esta actividad está muy agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado a ella ya que esta es la única actividad con la que mantiene a su familia.
texts.en:
Justina is 28 years old and is married with two children, ages 5 and 2. Justina runs a bakery out of her place of residence in Villa Fatima where she makes cakes, bread and other delicious items. Justina is a very hardworking woman who has many years of experience in the baking industry.

With the support from this loan, Justina plans to purchase construction materials to build a house to improve her family's living conditions. She is very grateful for this opportunity, as the bakery is her only source of income for providing for her family.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for building a house.

loans.name: Las Esmeraldas De Chujib Group

texts.es:
La señora Catarina es de estado civil casada. Cuenta con 41 años de edad. No asistio a la escuela. Tiene 5 hijos y de ellos 2 están estudiando. Tiene una cafeteria en el mercado del municipio. Inició este negocio con un pequeño capital y a la fecha lleva 2 años de experiencia.

Organiza un grupo y solicita un préstamo que lo utilizará para la compra de Insumos que le serviran en su cafetería. Desea en el futuro contar con más capital de trabajao y desea tener un Restaurante. 

Las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a actividades pecuarias y al comercio.
texts.en:
Catarina has a common law marriage. She is 41 and didn't go to school. She has 5 children, two of whom are in school. She has a cafe in the local market which she started two years ago with a small amount of capital.

She has organised a group and is asking for a loan which she will use to buy supplies for her cafe. She hopes in the future to earn more money from her work and to open a restaurant.

The other group members work in farming and commerce.

loans.use: to buy food supplies.

loans.name: Nelly Magdalena

texts.es: Nelly, de 38 años de edad, es casada, tiene dos hijos, vive en el municipio de San Pedro Sula, Cortes. Tiene su propio negocio desde hace año y medio donde vende novedades y achinería como útiles, juguetes, canastas plásticas, bandejas, tazas, platos, etc. El préstamo que solicita es por 10,000 Lempiras para surtir de productos de achinería y novedades como ser juguetes, peluches, papel y bolsas para regalos, plásticos, útiles escolares, platos, vasos etc. Para que las ventas aumenten. Su plan es que uno de sus hijos logre terminar los estudios universitarios.
texts.en:
Nelly is 38 years old, is married and has two children.  She lives in the city of San Perdro Sula, Cortes.  She has had her own business for about a year and a half, where she sells novelty and low-cost items such as tools, toys, plastic baskets, tray, cups, plates, etc.   

The loan that she is seeking is for 10,000 Lempiras in order to stock her business with low-cost consumer goods and novelty items such as toys, stuffed animals, wrapping paper, gift bags, plastics, school supplies, plates, cups, etc, so that she can increase her sales.  Her plan is for one of her children to finish their college education.

loans.use: buy low-cost consumer goods and novelty items such as toys, stuffed animals, wrapping paper, gift bags, plastics, school supplies, plates, cups, etc.

loans.name: José Fabián

texts.es: José tiene 38 años de edad, el vive con su mamá de 68 años. José es soltero y  es quien cuida a su madre ya que dice que así como su madre se ocupó de él ahora se ocupa de  ella.
