José es un joven trabajador que en los fines de semana se dedica a su negocio que es una heladería y  los otros días trabaja en el campo. José comenta que cuando el clima está cálido le va muy bien en su negocio y cuando esta frío le va regular pero su clientela está muy contenta con la variedad del producto que ofrece. El crédito lo va a invertir para pagar arriendo, comprar copas, frutas, esencias, conos y los demás implementos que se utilizan para elaborar los helados de paila. Lo que este joven aspira es atraer más clientela, ofrecer más variedad en sus productos, mejorar  en su negocio y en lo posible comprar un local propio para vender sus productos.
texts.en:
José is 38 years old and single, and he lives with and takes care of his mother, who is 68 years old. José makes a living during the week as a agricultural worker, and on the weekends he runs an ice cream business. When the weather is warm and nice, his ice cream business thrives. When the weather is cooler, business is average, but his clientele is always satisfied with the variety of products José sells. 

With the support from this loan, José plans to purchase cups, fruit, flavors, cones and other products to support his ice cream business. His goal is to strengthen his business, expand his customer base and offer a greater variety of delicious products to his clients. Eventually, José hopes to purchase a physical space and open an official ice cream shop.

loans.use: to purchase fruit, flavors and other items to support his ice cream business.

loans.name: Collins

texts.en:
Collins is a 28-year-old married man. He has three children, with ages ranging from 1 year to 10 years. He describes himself to be focused. 

Collins operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a densely populated area, and his primary customers are the general public. He describes his biggest business challenge to be a lack of capital. 

He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy spare parts for his motorcycle. 

His business goal is to be successful within five years. He hopes that in the future he will have an improved life.

loans.use: buy spare parts for his motorcycle

loans.name: Edwin Tomas

texts.es: Edwin es un señor responsable y protector de su familia, casado con un hijo al que le da todo el apoyo para su desarrollo, labora en un centro de salud de la zona donde habita con 5 años de experiencia, actualemente  se presento a ceprodel a plantear su necesidad de mejor su vivienda atraves de un financiamiento por dicha instituciòn, el cual utilizaria para la compra de materiales de construccion  tales como zinc, perlines, ladrillos y cemento. lo que vendria a mejor las condiciones y nivel de vida  de su familia
texts.en: Edwin is a responsible man and his family's protector.  He is married and has one son who he supports fully in his development.  He works in an area health center where he has five years of experience.  Recently, he approached Ceprodel to discuss his need to improve his home with financing from the institution.  He will use the loan to purchase construction materials such as zinc, purlins, bricks and cement.  This will improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: purchase zinc, purlins, bricks and pay for labor.

loans.name: Mariela Mercedes

texts.es: Mariela es una señora dedicada a la enseñanza de los demas principalmente a los niños, es maestra de educacion primaria con 10 años de laborar en un colegio de la localidad donde habita, es casada con 2 hijos a los que le brinda el apoyo necesario para su educacion, actualmente tiene la urgencia de comprar un lote de terreno para vivienda, debido a eso se presento a ceprodel para obtener el  apoyo y lograr su sueño de tener su vivienda propia, ya que dicho financiemiento lo utilizaria en completar compra de lote de terreno para vivienda y de esa manera mejorar las condiciones de vida, agradeciendole a ceprodel por la repuesta pronta y oportuna.
texts.en:
Mariela is married and has two children. She has 10 years of experience working as an elementary school teacher in her community, and she is dedicated to teaching and enriching the lives of others.

With the support from this loan, Mariela plans to purchase a lot of land to realize her dream of owning her own home. She hopes this investment will help her to construct her own house, and she is very grateful for this opportunity to improve her quality of life and living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase land for construction of a house.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a 33-year-old married man. He has four children with ages ranging from 3 to 12 years. He describes himself to be determined. 

Charles operates a retail business where he sells sugar, rice, wheat flour, maize flour and other items. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in a densely populated area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be a lack of funds. 

He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, rice, wheat flour and other items. 

His business goal is to expand within five years. 

He hopes that in the future, he will have an improved standard of living.

loans.use: buy more stock of sugar, rice, wheat flour and other items.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is a 27-year-old woman. She has 4 children with ages ranging from 3 years to 10 years. She describes herself to be a risk taker. She operates a retail business where she owns entertainment equipment where customers play snooker for a fee. She has been involved in this business for 2 years. Her primary customers are the youth. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more pool tables. Her business goal is to have more pool tables within 5 years. She hopes that in the future she will have a good lifestyle. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: buy more pool tables

loans.name: Salie

texts.en:
Salie is 47 years old, and married with two children who are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Salie's business and family home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her business, and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

She has taken a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using the this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Salie is committed to rebuilding her devastated life, and in future would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es: Luz Maria, mayor de edad, originaria de uno de los municipios de Chinandega, ubicado en el occidente del país, zona que se caracteriza por ser muy productiva y comercial, Luz es una microempresaria que se dedica a la comercialización de pastes que ella misma elabora,negocio el cual lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación, sus compras las realiza al contado en otros municipios del país, sus ventas son al contado y al crédito a clientes fijos y eventuales, Luz Marina se caracteriza por ser una mujer trabajadora, responsable y con muchos deseos de superación personal que día a día lucha por salir adelante, uno de sus sueños es incrementar su capital de trabajo y terminar de construir su vivienda. el objetivo de este financiamiento es para capital de trabajo en la compra de materia prima como: esponjas, telas, agujas, mecates, para la elaboración de estos pastes y de esa manera lograr cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes que tiene. Luz Maria esta muy agradecida con el apoyo que los inversionistas kivas les ofrece a personas de bajos recursos económicos.
texts.en: Luz Maria is from one of the towns of Chinandega in the west of the country, a region with a lot of industry and commerce. Luz is a small business owner who works selling sponges which she makes herself. She does this work from home. She buys her materials on credit in other towns and sells on credit to regular and occasional customers. Luz Maria describes herself as a hardworking and responsible woman with a strong desire to improve her situation. She fights hard every day to get ahead. One of her dreams is to increase her earnings and finish building her house. Her plan for this loan is to invest in her business by buying basic materials such as sponge, thread, needles and cords to make her sponges and fulfil her customers' orders. Luz Maria is very grateful for the support that Kiva lenders offer to people with few financial resources.

loans.use: to buy basic materials such as sponge, thread, needles and cords, among other items.

loans.name: Bernadette

texts.en: Bernadette, a mother of five, manages a poultry business for a living. For more than four years she earns a good income from this. With her revenue her previous loan used for breeding livestock and feed was successfully repaid. She wants to improve their farm for this is their main source of income. She took a new loan recently to purchase additional large cattle to raise. Her revenue from this will be saved for her children's future education.

loans.use: to purchase additional large cattle to raise

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
As a married mother of six children, Marites works hard to support her family.

She sells dried fish in the Philippines and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Marites is borrowing PHP 29000 through NWTF in order to buy more fish for her business.

Marites has been sustaining her business activities through her past twenty loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to buy a new engine for her fishing boat.

loans.use: to buy more fish for her dried fish business.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a 28-year-old single man. He describes himself as confident. He operates a retail business where he sells torches, toys, vests and clothes. He has been involved in this business for two years. His business is located in a favorable location and his primary customers are small-scale customers. He describes his biggest business challenge to be low returns. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more torches, toys, vests and other items. His business goal is to be successful within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will be prosperous. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy more stock of torches, toys, vests and other items

loans.name: Rom's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area located in Kampong Cham province’s Koh Sotin district, Rom, 47, has four children. Rom and her husband are rice farmers who have been farming for 27 years to make a living. The current business earns her about 47,000 KHR per day to meet the family's needs.  
Rom is a first cycle client with VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, Rom is going to use her portion to buy grocery items for resale in order to earn additional income for her family. She hopes this loan will enable her to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy grocery items for resale

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Nelita

texts.en:
Nelita is 53 years old and married with five children, two of whom are in school. Nelita works very hard to provide for them.

Nelita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Nelita has been in this business for thirty years and sells a variety of items such as rice, snack food, canned goods and other groceries. 

In the future Nelita would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies for maintenance and upkeep of her coffee plants.

loans.name: Macario

texts.en:
Macario is a humble, hard-working, and responsible individual. He does not have a lot of financial resources. Macario lives in Fugu, is married, and has three children. He provides his family with food and an education. 

Macario is a farmer, but his other business activity is working as a motorcycle driver. Unfortunately, he is going through a financial crisis at the moment, so he needs to increase his earnings to take care of his family and meet his obligations. What he earns is not enough to cover all of his expenses. For this reason, he is requesting a loan so that he can buy motorcycle accessories like tires and side mirrors. This will help him to provide more efficient service so that he can increase his earnings. In the end, he will be able to achieve a better quality of life for his entire family by providing them better conditions.

loans.use: to buy motorcycle accessories like tires and side mirrors.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
For the last two years John has been operating a business selling cereals in Nyahururu. He has been earning a monthly income of KES 25,000.

He has applied for his second loan of KES 30,000 from VisionFund Kenya which will be used for buying more cereals to sell to his ever-increasing number of customers. He will thereby increase his sales and profits.
John hopes to use his profits from the expanded business to educate his children, expand the current business and repay his loan to VisionFund Kenya.

He is married to Damaris and they are blessed with four children, ages 23, 18, 15 and 5 years old.
In the future, he hopes to educate his children to the highest grade possible and to be a successful businessman.

loans.use: To buy more cereals to sell to his customers

loans.name: Concepta

texts.en:
Concepta lives in Kitale with her husband and two children,  ages 4 and 1. She farmed for three years, with her primary income source being milk, eggs, crops, transportation, and a retail business. In farming, she loves horticultural farming. Her biggest challenges are the low prices of products and lack of a market.

Concepta chose Juhudi Kilimo because they have helped her improve her living standards. 

During the training, she learned that MFI's give out short term loans to low income earners.

She will use this loan to purchase more poultry, and hence, increase her income base. This will enable her to prepare a good foundation for her children.

loans.use: to purchase poultry.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is 48 years old and widowed with two children.

Rosalie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Rosalie has borrowed and repaid 18 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 24 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Rosalie aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac is a farmer living in the Chuka area of eastern Kenya. He is married with four children, and has been doing agribusiness for 20 years with his primary income being from the sale of milk, maize and bananas. In farming, he loves attending to his animals and his farm.‫ His main challenge comes from diseases, marketing and shortage of rain.

Isaac chose Juhudi Kilimo because they willingly help farmers with loans for enhancing their projects. During the training, he learnt that micro finance institution's (MFIs) do help the poor to access finances. His highest monthly expense is school fees and with the income from this loan, he will build a dairy unit which will give his dairy cows a good environment to produce more milk which will increase income.This income wilol cater for his children's school fees and also improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: to construct a dairy unit.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase agricultural supplies to adequately care for her coffee crops.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 63 years old and married with three children.

Rebecca works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 24,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Rebecca has borrowed and repaid 26 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from rice retailing.

Rebecca aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Faafetaifaamanu

texts.en:
Faafetaifaamanu is a 31-year-old married woman with two children. She has a small plantation and grows taro, taamu, bananas, yams, etc. to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than two years.

Faafetaifaamanu has requested a loan to buy weed sprayer, an ax, a file, spades, a wheelbarrow, etc. She has been a member of SBPD since 2012. With her profits, Faafetaifaamanu hopes to improve her business and save for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, a weed sprayer, an ax, a file, spades, a wheelbarrow, etc

loans.name: Cora

texts.en: Cora is a 59 year old widow with 2 adult aged children. She lives in Magcamiguing, Calamba. She has been engaged in operating a sari-sari store for 5 years.  She has a monthly income of Php 5,000 doing this type of work. She has applied for a loan to purchase various merchandise like sugar, rice, salt, laundry soap, etc. She joined Paglaum in 2000. The profit from her business will be used to buy 2 piglets to have an additional source of income.

loans.use: to purchase various merchandise like sugar, rice, salt, laundry soap, etc.

loans.name: Charity

texts.en:
For the last three years, Charity has been operating her business selling timber in Nyahururu, from which she has been getting a monthly income of 20,000 KES.

She has applied for her first loan of 20,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya which will be used to buy more timber to sell to her ever-increasing number of customers and, thereby, increase her sales and profits.

Charity hopes to use her profits from the expanded business to educate her children, start another business and to pay her loan back to VisionFund Kenya.

She is 48 years old and married to Zachary. They are blessed with three children aged 12, nine and five years old. In the future, Charity hopes to educate her children to the highest grade possible and to be the main timber supplier in her region.

loans.use: To buy more timber to sell to her customers

loans.name: Gerald

texts.en:
Gerald is earning a living through his motor transportation service. Aside from this, he also prepares some snacks and sell them in the market. He earns well from this. 
Gerald has successfully repaid his previous loan used in his transportation business buying tires for the vehicle. Currently, he is taking a new loan to buy raw ingredients to prepare snacks for sale. He uses his motorcycle for carrying his stocks. He hopes to gain more return to help him improve the general living standards of his family.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients to prepare snacks for sale

loans.name: Khorn Ros' Group

texts.en:
Khorn is 60 years old and the mother of two children. She resides in Battambang province, where rice is the popular crop. In addition to rice, Khorn also grows sesame to supplement her income. Her long-time business currently generates up to 36,000 KHR per day. 

Khorn and her joint borrower have been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for three cycles, with successful repayments and improved living conditions. In this cycle, she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, Khorn will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and seeds for her crops. She hopes that she can earn a good income.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds for her crops.

loans.name: Chhoeum Chhorm's Group

texts.en:
Chhoeum is 65 years old and a villager from Battambang province. She is a widowed mother of six children, one of whom is in school. 

To feed the family, she is planting vegetables as the main source of income. To supplement her income, she uses her spare time to work for others for a fee. She has been with this business for one year. She is a third-time borrower with VisionFund Cambodia (Kiva’s partner). With successful repayment of her past loans, she is able to earn a decent income to support her family, especially to keep her child in school. 

For this cycle, Chhoeum is seeking a loan of KHR 1,000,000 while her co-borrower is applying for a loan of KHR 1,300,000. 

As the leader, Chhoeum is going to spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer to support her cash crop. She hopes that her business will improve and she will be able to support her child until tertiary level.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to support her cash crop.

loans.name: Veun Thaing's Group

texts.en:
Veun is a resident from Battambang province and a widowed mother of two children. She does rice farming as the main source of income and supplements her income via a paid-working job during her free time. She has been with this business for 15 years and it earns her about 42,200 KHR per day. 

This is the sixth cycle of loans for Veun and the first cycle for her joint borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). With a successful repayment of her past loan, she was able to upgrade her lifestyle better than before. For this cycle, she and her co-borrower are seeking a loan. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and rice seed for her crop. She highly believes that she can gain an income that is better than before.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seed for her crop

loans.name: Sdoeurng Phal's Group

texts.en:
A young mother with one little child residing in the Kandal Stoeung district of Kandal Province, Sdoeurng is 26 years old and one of the breadwinners in her family. 

The main sources of her family income are from rice cropping and salary from her job as a factory worker. Nowadays, she is able to earn up to 14,500 KHR per day. After offset for necessary expenses, Sdoeurng can save up 1,800 KHR per day. 

This is the first loan for Sdoeurng and her joint borrowers, who are in the same group of four, with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). As the leader, she will spend her loan portion on building a decent latrine for her entire household. She hopes to promote good hygienic practice in her household.

loans.use: To build a decent latrine for her entire household

loans.name: Crisbell Elieth

texts.es: Crisbell es una joven dinamica trabaja en un organismo de desarrollo social, es licenciada en trabajo social, casada, no tiene hijos al momento, es el primer financiamiento recibido para mejorar su vivienda lo que es techo el que tiene en mal estado, por esa necesidad visito a ceprodel para ser beneficiada y lograr su sueño, ya que el mismo lo utilizaria en la compra de zinc, perlin, golos, pintura y puertas, logrando de esa manera mejorar las condiciones familiares.
texts.en: Crisbell is a dynamic young woman who works in a social development agency. She has a degree in social work. She is married and does not currently have any children. This is the first loan she has received to improve her home. Her roof is in poor condition. For this reason she is requesting financial assistance from Ciprodel to help her achieve her dream, as she would use it to purchase zinc, timber, "golos," paint, and doors, thus achieving better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: purchase zinc, timber, "golos", paint, and doors.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
For the last three years David has been operating his business of mixed farming in Olkalou from which he realizes a monthly income of KES. 8,000.

He has applied for his second loan of KES. 20,000 from VisionFund Kenya which will be used for buying animal feed and maize seeds to plant. David hopes to use his profits from the expanded business to educate his children, expand the current business, and to pay his loan back to VisionFund Kenya.

He is 32 years old, married to Lillian, and they are blessed with two children aged five and three years old. In the future, he hopes to educate his children to the highest grade possible and to be a successful farmer.

loans.use: To buy animal feed for his cows and maize seeds to plant

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
For the last nine years Alice has been operating her beauty salon in Nyahururu from which she realizes a monthly income of KES. 10,000.

She has applied for her first loan of KES. 10,000 from VisionFund Kenya to be used for buying more stock of hair weaves and chemicals to sell to customers at her salon.

Alice hopes to use her profits from the expanded business to educate her children, start another business, and to pay her loan back to VisionFund Kenya.

She is 32 years old and not married but she is blessed with three children aged 13, nine and two years old. In the future, she hopes to educate her children to the highest grade possible and to be the best hair expert in her region.

loans.use: To buy hair weaves and chemicals to sell to the customers who visit her salon

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is 36 years old, married, and supports four members of her family. She runs a retail business in Kapsabet town and is served by Vision Fund Kenya. 


This has been her income-generating business for the last six years and she gets an average monthly income of KES. 45,000.


She plans to use the amount borrowed, KES. 100,000, to purchase additional stock such as rice, sugar, cooking fat and milk for sale. Her dream is to educate her children to tertiary levels.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock such as rice, sugar, cooking fat and milk for sale

loans.name: Elorgina

texts.en:
Elorgina works hard to support her family. Elorgina is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 6000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients for her business.

Elorgina has been in this business for 1 years now.

In the future, Elorgina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients for her business

loans.name: Vert Touch's Group

texts.en:
Living in a wooden house with his family members in a rural village of the Thmor Koul district, Vert is age 48 and married, with three children. He and his wife earn a living through farming rice and fishing. Having been in this business for ten years, he manages to earn about KHR 50,000 per day and can save about KHR 20,000 each day for future needs. 

Vert has been with VisionFund Cambodia for five cycles and he completely paid back the past loans. Now, he is leading a group to ask for a loan. As the leader, Vert is going to use his portion to buy fertilizer for his farmland. He hopes to grow his rice in a timely manner, so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his farmland.

loans.name: Anabelle

texts.en: Anabelle is a widow entrepreneur with two children. She has been running a transport service business for more than two years. She earns well from this and she has successfully repaid her previous loan, which she used to buy accessories and tires. This year, she needs to renew the licenses and vehicle registrations as required by law. She is determined to work hard as she the sole provider for her family; she is especially concerned with paying for the education of her children. In the future, she wants to expand her business, and through it, she wants to improve the general living of the entire family.

loans.use: to renew the licenses and vehicle registration

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase chicks to raise and resell later

loans.name: Flor De Xeabaj Group

texts.es:
La señora Tomasa es de estado civil casada. De 31 años de edad. No tuvo la oportundad de estudiar. Tiene 8 hijos y de ellos 2 van a la escuela. Se dedica a la elaboración de Guipiles típicos de la región. Inició este negocio por la enseñanza de su madre y a la fecha lleva 3 años de experiencia.

Organiza un grupo y solicita un préstamo que lo utilizará para la compra de Hilos y Tela para poder elaborar los guipiles. Desea en el futuro ofrecer variedad de estilos de guipiles y vender por mayor.

Las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican al comercio y artesanias.

En la fotografía son 11 integrantespero, solo a 10 de ellas se les otorgó el préstamo.
texts.en:
Tomasa is married and is 31 years old. She did not have the opportunity to attend school. She has 8 children, 2 of which are in school. She makes a living making blouses that are typical of the region. She started this business by learning it from her mother, and now has 3 years of experience.

She organized this group and is requesting a loan that will be used to purchase thread and fabric to make blouses. In the future, she wishes to offer a variety of styles of blouses and sell them wholesale.

The other group members work in trade and crafts.

There are 11 members in the photograph but only 10 of them were awarded the loan.

loans.use: purchase thread and fabric to make blouses

loans.name: Rosanie

texts.en:
Rosanie works hard to support her family.  She has a food vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase ingredients like meat, fish, vegetables, etc.

Rosanie has been in this business for four years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like meat, fish, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Lorena works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell charcoal business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fish vending, she temporarily stopped her pillow-making business. Lorena is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell for her charcoal business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now request a new loan to further build her business.

Lorena has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Iluminada

texts.en: Iluminada is 75 years old, married with six children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She buys and sells bananas in the Philippines. Iluminada has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of bananas to sell. Iluminada has been in this business for 25 years. In the future, Iluminada would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of bananas to sell

loans.name: Twiyubake Group

texts.fr:
Twiyubake est un groupe dont les membres travaillent  à Cibitoke.Un mebre du groupe Jonathan est exclu du groupe après la prise de photo.Il estjuste à gauche du représentant sur la photo.Sylvain en est le représentant. Il  a 41 ans et est marié  à Sadantine, une commerçante. Ensemble ils ont 3  enfants  âgés de  5 à  7 ans, dont 2  étudient.

Il  fait le commerce de haricot, du charbon de bois  depuis 8 ans.

Il  est à son deuxième crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit Kiva qu’il  obtient, il va augmenter son capital et acheter une grande quantité de haricot et de charbon de bois  à revendre pour gagner plus.

Dans les années prochaines, il  voudrait avoir un grand capital et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Twiyubake is a group whose members work in Cibitoke. A group member, Jonathan, was excluded from the group after the photo was taken. He is just to the left of the representative in the photo. Sylvain is the representative of the group. He is 41 years old and married to Sadantine, a merchant. Together they have three children, from 5 to 7 years old, of whom two are children.

Sylvain has been doing commerce in beans and charcoal for eight years. He is on his second Turame loan. With the Kiva loan he is obtaining, he is going to increase his capital and purchase a large quantity of beans and charcoal to resell, so as to earn more. 

In the coming year, he would like to have a lot of capital and see his children educated.

loans.use: to purchase a large quantity of beans and charcoal to resell, so as to earn more

loans.name: Jorge Eliecer

texts.es:
Jorge es un campesino humilde, pujante y trabajador, que se gana la vida realizando labores del campo, especialmente la cría de ganado. El oficio lo aprendió gracias a las enseñanzas de su familia, ya que ha sido una tradición que pasa de generación en generación; adicionalmente y de manera alterna trabaja como empleado en una alfarería de la región y con el salario que recibe complementa los ingresos para solventar los gastos de su familia, conformada por su esposa y sus 4 hijos.
Con el ánimo de fortalecer su negocio, solicita el crédito para comprar una vaca de cría y un macho reproductor (toro), esto le permitirá aumentar su producción en un mediano plazo, logrando generar mejores ingresos con su labor.
Jorge, con 53 años de edad, manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es tener una producción mínimo con 12 vacas reproductoras de doble propósito, es decir, que puedan producir leche y carne, pues así logrará mayor rentabilidad y podrá brindar una buena educación a sus hijos y disfrutar junto a los suyos de mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Jorge is a humble, strong, and hardworking farmer. He earns his living doing farm work, especially in raising livestock. He learned to farm through the lessons his family gave him. It's a tradition that has been passed down from generation to generation. Furthermore, he has an additional job working in a pottery shop in the region. He does this work to supplement his income and pay household expenses for his family which consists of his wife and 4 children.

In an effort to strengthen his business, he is requesting a loan to buy a cow to raise and a male breeding cow (bull). This will allow him to increase production in the medium-term, achieving better income with his work. Jorge, 53, says that his greatest desire is to have a minimum of 12 breeding cows working a dual-purpose production, producing milk and meat and to also achieve greater profitability so he can provide a good education to his children and enjoy better quality living conditions with them.

loans.use: to purchase a cow and a bull.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: Ella es Elizabeth, tiene 40 años, es madre de dos hijos, combina la labor de ama de casa y de estudiante de farmacia, actualmente está en prácticas, el hijo mayor está en la universidad y la hija en el colegio, siempre se ah distinguido por el sentido de responsabilidad, colaboración y compromiso, ella y la familia hacen un gran esfuerzo por que ella estudie ya que piensa que cualquier límite es mental, si ella tiene la ayuda que ofrece kiva tiene por seguro que no parará de superar cada dificultad y de prepararse mejor  para que ella tenga una ayuda muy valiosa que agradecerá con las acciones.
texts.en: Elizabeth is 40 years old. She is the mother of two children. She is a homemaker but also a pharmacy student in school. Her older son is in college and her daughter is in high school. She has always distinguished herself by her sense of responsibility, collaboration, and compromise. She and her family make a huge effort so that she can go to school, as she believes that any limit is just mental. If she receives the help that Kiva is offering, she is certain that she will continue to overcome any difficulty and that it will better prepare her as she will have received great assistance for which she will be very thankful.

loans.use: pay for a semester of tuition.

loans.name: Yab's Group

texts.en:
Yab, 50, is married with two children, residing in a rural village of the Tbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham province. To support the family, she has been farming rice for 32 years while her husband works as a paid worker. Together, they can earn about KHR 36,000 per day and can save about KHR 20,000 each day for future needs. 

Yab’s Group consists of two members, both of whom are female. Yab has been with VisionFund Cambodia for two cycles and she completely paid back the loans with VisionFund Cambodia and successfully used the loans to better support her family. 

Now, she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, Yab is going to use her portion to pay for labor fees in order to plow the field. She hopes to make more rice, to increase her family’s income and make a better living.

loans.use: to pay for labor fees to plow her field.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Alba Luz

texts.es: Gracias al apoyo brindado por los inversionistas en la plataforma KIVA en alianza con la cooperativa COMIXMUL Doña Alba con su primer financiamiento compro los insumos agrícolas que sus cultivos de café necesitaban urea el cual ayudo a que el cultivo de café tenga mejor color y follaje, formula cafetalera esto es para que se desarrolle más y la producción sea mayor, también compro un producto que se llamado metalozato el cual sirvió a que el cultivo no le entre el hielo a la cosecha. Su vida antes de este financiamiento era muy dura porque tocaba sacar dinero prestado a personas particulares a altas tasas de interés había que comprometer la cosecha del cultivo de café la cual la pagaban a bajo precio y la ganancia era menos y todo eso cambio gracias al apoyo brindado con dichos fondos. Actualmente Doña Alba solicita un segundo financiamiento el cual invertirá siempre en el cultivo de café ya que con la cosecha que obtuvo cancelo el crédito anterior y las ganancias fueron invertidas en mejoras de sus cultivos y fueron pocas ya que una parte fue afectada por la roya por lo que necesita volver asistir sus cultivos de café.
texts.en: Thanks for the help from the Kiva lenders, in cooperation with COMIXMUL, Alba used her first loan to buy farming supplies that she needed for her coffee crops.  They needed urea which gave them a better color, foliage which allows them to better develop.  She also bought a product called metalozato which prevented the harvest from freezing.  Her life before this loan was very difficult because she had to borrow money from individuals at high interest rates and she had to put the harvest up as collateral and she received a low price for it.  Everything changed because of these funds.  Now Alba is asking for a second loan to buy coffee since she was able to repay the previous loan and she invested her profits to improve her crops that were affected by a blight and she needs to help them.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her coffee crop.

loans.name: Moun

texts.en:
A citizen from a rural village of Kampong Cham province’s Kampong Siem district, Moun is 53 and widowed. She has two children. To feed her family, she has worked hard as a construction worker. The current business earns her about US$10 per day. 

Moun is a third cycle client with VisionFund. The past loans have helped her gradually improve her living. 

Now she is going to apply for a loan. Moun will use this loan to renovate her old house. She hopes to have a proper house to live in.

loans.use: to renovate her old house.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Kampong Siem district

loans.name: Abdoulaye

texts.fr:
Né  en 1984 à BAMAKO, ABDOULAYE vit avec 1 enfants et son époux dans une famille nucléaire à N’TENTOU dans la Préfecture de KATI, (Région de Koulikoro, République du MALI).
ABDOULAYE  n’a pas eu la chance de progresser à l’école, très vite  s’intéressa aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment à l’achat vente de céréales: maïs, riz, mil, etc. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de ses clientèles, ABDOULAYE décida de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso. Après avoir correctement remboursé le premier prêt, il est à son deuxième prêt individuel  qui sera utilisé pour acheter, 3 sacs de riz, 5 sacs de maïs, auprès des paysans producteurs de KELEYA, SELINGUE et DIGAN. Il  vend essentiellement  au comptant, à crédit, en gros et en détail, à domicile, dans le marché et dans les foires  environnantes à une clientèle composés d’hommes et de femmes. 
ABDOULAYE espère réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 50 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour rembourser le prêt et  être réinvestir le reste dans les activités d’achat vente de céréales.
texts.en:
Born in 1984 in Bamako, Abdoulaye lives with one child and his spouse in a nuclear family in N'tentou in the Kati Prefecture (Koulikoro Region, Republic of Mali).

Abdoulaye didn't have the chance to advance in school, so he quickly became interested in income-generating activities, particularly buying and selling grains: corn, rice, millet, etc.

To satisfy the growing needs of his clients, Abdoulaye decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso. After having successfully paid his first loan, he is on his second individual loan that will be used to purchase three bags of rice and five bags of corn from small farmers Keleya, Selingue, and Digan. He makes his sales in cash and credit, wholesale and retail, from his home and at the market, and at nearby trade fairs to male and female clientele.

Abdoulaye hopes to earn an average monthly profit of 50,000 FCFA, which will be used to pay back the loan and reinvest in his business purchasing and selling grains.

loans.use: to buy grains.

loans.name: Sekouba

texts.fr:
Né en 1980 à BAMAKO, SEKOUBA vit avec ses 5 enfants et son époux dans une  famille nucléaire à FILABOUGOU dans la Sous-Préfecture de  OUELESSEBOUGOU (Région de Koulikoro, République du Mali). 
SEKOUBA n’a pas eu la chance de progresser à l’école, très vite, il s’est intéressée aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment l’achat vente d’habillements : pagnes, balle de friperie,  etc.    
Après avoir correctement remboursé le deuxième  prêt précédent, SEKOUBA est à son troisième  prêt avec Soro Yiriwaso qui sera utilisé pour acheter 1 balle de friperie, etc. Il s’approvisionne en marchandise à BAMAKO   et effectue ses ventes au comptant, à crédit et en détail, à domicile, à OUELESSEBOUGOU à une clientèle composés d’hommes et de femmes.  
SEKOUBA  espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 30.000FCFA qui sera utilisé rembourser le prêt et être réinvestir dans les activités d’achat vente d’habillements.
texts.en:
Born in 1980 in BAMAKO, SEKOUBA lives with his five children and wife in a nuclear family in FILABOUGOU, in Sous-Préfecture de OUELESSEBOUGOU (Région de Koulikoro, Republic of Mali). SEKOUBA did not have the chance to progress in school. Early on, he became interested in revenue-generating businesses, especially the buying and selling of clothing: 'pagnes' (the colorful cloth of western Africa), bales of secondhand clothing, etc. 

After having correctly repaid the two previous loans, SEKOUBA is now on his third loan with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. It will be used to purchase a bale of secondhand clothing, etc. He gets his supplies of merchandise in BAMAKO and makes his sales retail to men and women customers using cash or credit at his house. 

SEKOUBA hopes to make a monthly profit of 30,000 francs CFA that will be use to pay back the loan and to reinvest in his clothing trade.

loans.use: to purchase clothing

loans.name: Gerlie

texts.en:
Gerlie is 40 years old and lives in Gango, Ozamiz City. She is married and has four school-aged children.
 
Gerlie has a Pisonet business. She has been doing this for four years. She has requested a loan to buy a parcel lot. It will be used for farming. 

Gerlie has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Gerlie hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a parcel of land

loans.name: Dũng's Group

texts.en:
Dũng is 44 years old and is married with two children. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province. For the past four years, Dũng has operated a food stall where she sells soup. Her greatest business difficulty is her lack of capital. Dũng is the leader of the Dũng's group, which consists of five members. 

Dũng is requesting a loan to purchase eels to make soup to sell. This will be her first loan with the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. With the profit from her loan, Dũng hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to find good jobs.

loans.use: to purchase eels to make soup to sell

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes works hard to support her family. Lourdes is married and has a restaurant business in the Philippines.

Lourdes requested a 19,500 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients like can goods, meat, fish, eggs, etc.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now requests a new loan to further build her business.  She would also like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients like can goods, meat, fish, eggs, etc

loans.name: Rung's Group

texts.en:
Living in a wooden house located in the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Rung is 61 years old and widowed. She has six children. To make a living, she has been farming rice for 12 years and they supplement family’s income by working for others for a fee. The current business earns them about 43,000 KHR per day. They manage to save about 30,000 KHR each day for their future needs.
 
This is the seventh micro loan for Rung with VisionFund. She completely repaid the past loans, which have helped her make her living better. She is now leading her group to request a loan with VisionFund. As the leader, she wants to use her portion to buy fertilizers, pesticides and seeds for her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to grow her business and earn a larger income to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, pesticides and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida works hard to support her family. She is single and she has a general store business in the Philippines.

Nida requested a PHP 9,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase more items to sell, like coffee, cream, milk, noodles, and chips.

Nida has been in this business for four years now.

In the future, Nida would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell, like coffee, cream, milk, noodles, and chips.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is 64 years old and has five children. 

She is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. Yolanda requested a loan of 5,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, coffee, cream, etc.

Yolanda has been in her general store business for one year now.  Previously she ran a pig business, but now she focuses only on the general store.  She has borrowed 8 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Yolanda would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, coffee, cream, etc.

loans.name: Sanan

texts.en:
Sanan, 45, lives in a rural village of Kampong Cham province’s Memot district, Cambodia. She is married and has one child. For the last 22 years Sanan has been growing cassava and pineapple. She can earn about 35,000 KHR per day, but she can save about 24,000 KHR each day after daily expenses.  
Sanan has been a member of Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for one loan cycle already and she completely repaid the loan. She has used the past loan wisely and successfully to improve her family’s livelihood. Now requesting another loan with VisionFund, of KHR 2,000,000, she wants to use this loan to buy cows in order to help her in her farming business. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy cows in order to help her in her farming business

loans.name: Djenebou

texts.fr:
Née en 1988 à BAMAKO, DJENEBOU vit avec ses 3 enfants et son époux dans une  famille traditionnelle à BAMANANKING dans la Sous-Préfecture de  OUELESSEBOUGOU (Région de Koulikoro, République du Mali). 
DJENEBOU n’a pas eu la chance de progresser à l’école, très vite elle  s’intéressa aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment l’achat vente d’habillements : tissus, wax, ensence,  etc.    
Après avoir correctement remboursé le deuxième  prêt précédent, DJENEBOU est à son troisième  prêt avec Soro Yiriwaso qui sera utilisé pour acheter, 20 pièces de tissus. Elle s’approvisionne en marchandise à BAMAKO   et effectue ses ventes au comptant, à crédit et en détail, à domicile, à OUELESSEBOUGOU et dans les foires  environnantes à une clientèle composés d’hommes et de femmes.  
DJENEBOU  espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 60.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour   aider son mari à subvenir aux besoins de la famille, rembourser le prêt et être réinvestir dans les activités d’achat vente d’habillements.
texts.en:
Born in 1988 in BAMAKO, DJENEBOU lives with her three children and husband in a nuclear family in BAMANANKING, in Sous-Préfecture de OUELESSEBOUGOU (Région de Koulikoro, Republic of Mali). DJENEBOU did not have the chance to progress in school. Early on, she became interested in revenue-generating businesses, especially the buying and selling of cloth:  fabrics, Wax 'pagnes' (the colorful cloth of western Africa), 'ensence', etc.


After having correctly repaid the two previous loans, DJENEBOU is now on her third loan with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. It will be used to purchase 20 lengths of fabrics. She gets her supplies of merchandise in BAMAKO and makes her sales retail to men and women customers using cash or credit at her house, in OUELESSEBOUGOU, and at nearby fairs.

DJENEBOU hopes to make a monthly profit of 60,000 francs CFA that will be used in helping her husband to support the family, paying back the loan, and reinvesting in her clothing business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth to sell

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
For the last three years, Lucy has been operating her general store business in Nyahururu, from which she has been getting a monthly income of KES 20,000.

She has applied for her first loan from VisionFund Kenya, in the amount of KES 30,000, which will be used for buying stocks of sugar, wheat, and maize flour to sell to her ever-increasing number of customers, thereby increasing her sales and profits.

Lucy hopes to use her profits from the expanded business to educate her children, to expand the current business, and to pay her loan back to VisionFund Kenya.

She is 40 years old, married to Johnson, and they are blessed with four children, ages 18, 16, 14, and 12 years old. In the future, Lucy hopes to educate her children to the highest grade possible and to open the biggest wholesale shop in her region.

loans.use: to buy stocks of sugar, wheat, and maize flour, in bulk, to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Sovan

texts.en:
Sovan, 58, is married with two children residing in a rural village located in the Kandal province’s Kandal Stoeng district, Cambodia. For the last 33 years she has been farming rice. The current business earns her about 40,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s need, but she can save about 10,000 KHR per day after the daily expenses. 
Sovan has been with VisionFund for four cycles and successfully repaid the past loans. Now she is asking for a loan to buy a decent motorbike for her children to commute to work. She hopes this loan will enable her to reduce expenses on motor-taxis.

loans.use: to buy a decent motorbike for her children to commute to work

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
For the last three years Mary has been operating her clothing sales business in Nakuru from which she has been getting a monthly income of KES. 20,000.

She has applied for her first loan of KES. 105,600 from VisionFund Kenya, which will be used to buy a motorcycle to transport customers for a fee. Alice hopes to use her profits from the expanded business to educate her children, expand the current business and to pay her loan back to VisionFund Kenya.

She is married to Mwangi and they are blessed with two children aged eight and two years old. In the future she hopes to educate her children to the highest grade possible and to start clothing businesses in different towns so as to increase her profits and to create employment.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Aissa

texts.fr:
Née en 1983 à BAMAKO, AISSA vit avec ses 3 enfants et son époux dans une famille nucléaire à N’TENTOU dans la Sous-Préfecture de  OUELESSEBOUGOU (Région de Koulikoro, République du Mali). 
AISSA n’a pas eu la chance d’aller à l’école, très vite elle  intéressa aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment l’achat vente d’habillements : tissus, wax,  etc.    
Après avoir correctement remboursé le premier  prêt précédent, AISSA est à son deuxième  prêt avec Soro Yiriwaso qui sera utilisé pour acheter, une quantité  importante d’habillements. Elle s’approvisionne en marchandise à BAMAKO   et effectue ses ventes au comptant, à crédit et en détail, à domicile, dans le marché et dans les foires  environnantes à une clientèle composés d’hommes et de femmes.  
AISSA  espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 40.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour   aider son mari à subvenir aux besoins de la famille, rembourser le prêt et être réinvestir dans les activités d’achat vente d’habillements.
texts.en:
Born in 1983 in BAMAKO, AISSA lives with her three children and husband in a nuclear family in N’TENTOU, in Sous-Préfecture de OUELESSEBOUGOU (Région de Koulikoro, Republic of Mali). AISSA did not have the chance to progress in school. Early on, she became interested in revenue-generating businesses, especially the buying and selling of cloth:  fabrics, Wax 'pagnes' (the colorful cloth of western Africa), etc.


After having correctly repaid the first loan, AISSA is now on her second one with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. It will be used to purchase a significant quantity of cloth or clothing. She gets her supplies of merchandise in BAMAKO and makes her sales retail to men and women customers using cash or credit at her house, at the market, and at nearby fairs.

AISSA hopes to make a monthly profit of 40,000 francs CFA that will be used in helping her husband to support the family, paying back the loan, and reinvesting in her business.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
As a parent of one child, Gloria works hard to support her family.

She has a photo lamination business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a buy and sell beauty products business.  Gloria is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to  buy materials like plywood, lining, glue etc. for her photo lamination business.

Gloria has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials like plywood, lining, glue etc for her business

loans.name: Sokul's Group

texts.en:
Sokul is 35 years old living with five children in a rural village of the Kandal Stoeng district. Rice farming is the only main source for her family’s income and she has been farming rice for about four years. The current business earns her family the daily income of about 46,000 KHR, but she is able to save 10,000 KHR each day. 
This is the second loan for Sokul with VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader Sokul will use her portion to grow vegetables in order to earn additional income. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income from her business.

loans.use: to grow vegetables in order to earn additional income

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a new collection of clothes

loans.name: Shakhadat

texts.ru: Шахадат 43 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 3 детей. У Шахадат - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Шахадат занимается животноводством, стартовав 14 лет назад, с покупки скота на 3,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Шахадат, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы. Ежемесячный доход составляет 12,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Шахадат обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом - на покупку телят для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Шахадат планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en: Shakhadat is 43 years old, married, and together with her husband, is raising three children. Shakhadat has a secondary education. As the main source of income for her family, Shakhadat practices livestock breeding. She started this business 14 years ago, with an initial purchase of cattle in the amount of 3,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Shakhadat's hard work, she currently has 2 milk cows on her farm. Her monthly income is 12,000 som (KGS). For the purpose of further developing her business, Shakhadat turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." She is requesting a loan to buy calves to increase the size of her herd. Shakhadat plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further acquisition of livestock.

loans.use: to buy calves.

loans.name: Rukije

texts.en:
Rukije, 47 years old, is from the Ashkali community and a mother of six children between the ages of 15 and 28 years old. Her husband works transporting goods for a private company but lives in the minority community with them. They are very poor and live in substandard living conditions. Rukije has always wanted to see have a beautiful house, but never had the chance to renovate because of the lack of money. Despite the fact that she always hoped to find a job, she was never able to be successful in obtaining one. 

Now she is requesting a loan in order to do general renovations to their house. She has determined that she will need a loan of 350 Euros to complete all of the work necessary. This loan will help her to improve the living conditions for her and her family. Her goal is to give her children the best future. She still hopes to find a job soon so that she can contribute to the family. She wants to thank all of the Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To do general renovations on her house

loans.name: Al-Najah4 Group

texts.en:
Al-Najah4 is a group that consists of five women living in Hodeidah, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 180,000 YER from AMB. 

Iman is a 41-year-old married woman with eight children. She lives with her family in Hodeidah, Yemen. She is the leader of the group. Iman is an uneducated woman. Her husband's salary is really not enough to cover the family's expenses. Because she loves her family and wants to provide them with better living conditions, Iman decided four years ago to help her husband and start up a business selling perfumes, incense, and some different clothes for children and women door-to-door. She is making modest profits, but found it difficult to accumulate enough money to buy more clothes and incense because most of the profits she earns go toward her family's expenses. 

Therefore, she applied for a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase clothes and incense. She looks forward to opening a large store and stocking it with a large amount of clothes, accessories, perfumes, and incense.

loans.use: to buy more clothes and incense for resale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: purchase merchandise such as purses, perfumes, clothing, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to make improvements in her sheds and buy chickens and chicken feed.

loans.name: Uriel De Jesús

texts.es:
Uriel es u campesino humilde, trabajador y pujante, a sus 26 años de edad, vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos de 2 y 6 años, por quienes lucha constantemente para conseguir el sustento diario.
Las labores agrícolas que realiza en el campo, fueron aprendidas desde pequeño, cuando ayudaba a sus padres en actividades como cultivar diversos productos y criar y comercializar animales; con su experiencia, conocimiento y dedicación en estas labores, logró ahorrar para comprarse un lote de tierra, en el que posee, de manera independiente, 2000 matas de café sembrados y cultivos de plátano, además de criar y comercializar cerdos y, para complementar los ingresos, en sociedad con el dueño de una finca tiene 8000 árboles más de café, cuyas cosechas son recolectadas y vendidas en el pueblo, de esta forma genera los recursos suficientes para brindar sustento y educación a sus pequeños hijos.
Con el crédito que solicita comprará insumos agrícolas al por mayor (pesticidas, abonos, larvicidas) y pagará la mano de obra de los jornaleros que le ayudan a cosechar. Esto le permitirá continuar con su labor y podrá obtener una cosecha mucho más productiva, que pueda ser vendida a un mejor precio en el mercado.
Uriel manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es tener una finca mucho más grande para sembrar más cultivos de diferentes productos, así hará de su actividad un negocio más rentable y garantizar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y bienestar.
texts.en: Uriel is a humble, hardworking and enterprising farmer. At 26 years of age, he lives with his wife and his two children, 2 and 6 years old, for whom he constantly struggles to get daily food. He learned farming since he was young when he helped his parents in activities such as growing different products and raising and selling animals. With his experience, knowledge and hard work, he was able to save and buy a plot of land, in which he independently owns 2000 plants of grown coffee and banana crops, and where he raises and sells pigs. To add to his income, in partnership with the owner of a farm, he has 8000 more coffee trees. Its harvest is collected and sold in the town. In this way, he gets enough resources to feed and educate his small children. With the requested loan he will buy agricultural inputs at wholesale prices (pesticides, fertilizers, larvicides) and will pay the daily laborers who help him harvest. This will allow him to continue with his work and will be able to get a much more productive harvest that can be sold at a better market price. Uriel states that his greatest wish is to have a much bigger farm to grow more crops of different products, and this way he will have a more profitable business and will guarantee his family a better quality of life and well being.

loans.use: To buy agricultural inputs at wholesale prices (pesticides, fertilizers, larvicides) and to pay the work of daily laborers

loans.name: Douglas

texts.en: Douglas is a 28-year-old married man. He has one child. He describes himself as ambitious. Douglas operates an M-pesa business where he offers mobile phone-based money transfer services. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a busy and competitive area. He describes his biggest business challenge to be network delays. Douglas will use the 20,000 KES loan to increase M-pesa float (money for customers to withdraw). His business goal is to open another M-pesa business within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will educate his child. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to increase M-pesa float (money for customers to withdraw)

loans.name: Rithy

texts.en:
Rithy is a citizen from a rural area located in Battambang province’s Battambang district. He is married and is 27-years-old. To feed his household, he earns a living through working as an English teacher. Sometimes, his wife grows vegetables to earn additional income. He is able to earn up to US $8 per day from the business that he has been with for one year and he can manage to save only US $3 each day for future needs.

Rithy is a first cycle client with VisionFund. Now, he is applying for a loan to pay his university’s tuition fee. This loan will enable him to keep going to the university and he hopes to have a good and bright future from his academics and make a better living in the future.

loans.use: to pay his university’s tuition fee

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase agricultural input items for tending her coffee plants.

loans.name: Bethar

texts.en:
For the last three years, Bethar has been operating her fruit and vegetable business in Nyahururu, from which she realizes a monthly income of 20,000 KES.

She has applied for her first loan of 30,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to buy more stocks of fruits and vegetables to sell to her ever-increasing number of customers, thereby increasing her sales and profits. Bethar hopes to use her profits from the expanded business to educate her children, expand the current business and pay her loan back to VisionFund Kenya.

Bethar is 30 years old and married to Dickson. They are blessed with five children aged 10, seven, three and one. In the future, she hopes to educate her children to the highest grade possible and to open a supermarket.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of vegetables and fruits to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a married 45 year old mother of three living in Embu. Her husband is Kiura who also supports the family. Lucy has been running a food stall business for the past two years with a monthly income of KES 10000 which she uses to support her family. Lucy is applying for her first loan from VISIONFUND KENYA after she was introduced by an existing VISIONFUND KENYA client. 

She will use the loan to purchase wheat flour, kale, cereals, onions and cabbages in bulk for her stall. She will plough back the proceeds into the business and invest the rest in opening another food stall. 

She hopes to be financially stable and a very happy family.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, kale, cereals, onions and cabbages in bulk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a sewing shop.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 38 years old, married, and has four children. He describes himself as determined. He operates a retail business selling sugar, wheat flour, cooking fat, and other items, which he has been doing for four years. His primary customers are small scale. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the rent he pays for the business premise. 

Peter requested his first loan from SMEP DTM for 20,000 KES, which he will use to buy more stock of sugar, bread, cooking oil, and other items. His business goal is to excel within five years.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, bread, cooking oil, and other items

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 57 years old. She is married and has 10 children. 

She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Rebecca requested a 21,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She has been raising pigs for five years now and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Rebecca would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Arusyak

texts.en:
Arusyak is only 27 years old and she is already very respected and skilled teacher in the school of Shenavan village. Arusyak has graduated Vanadzor State Pedagogical Institute from the faculty of Armenian Language and Literature. She has worked in this school 4 years and among the pupils she has already become one of the most beloved teachers. She is always full of new ideas and she tries to follow all the new methods that can make the lessons interesting, interactive, and involve all the pupils in the classroom in discussions, even those pupils who have little interest or advancement in education. 
Arusyak is married and she lives with her husband in Vanadzor city in Lori region. They don't have children. Her husband is engaged in farming.
Arusyak asks for a loan of 300.000 Armenian drams to purchase a computer and some literature connected with her specialty, which she needs for teaching.

loans.use: to buy a computer and some literature connected with her specialty, which she needs for teaching

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase pigs and feed to support his business.

loans.name: Bernardo Antonio

texts.es:
Bernardo, a sus 52 años de edad, es padre de dos hijos a los que ha sacado adelante con mucho esfuerzo.
Hace aproximadamente 4 años, se quedó sin empleo pero los gastos y necesidades familiares no daban espera, es por ello que vio la oportunidad de dedicarse al transporte de personas en moto, ya que es una labor tradicional en el municipio donde reside; así ha logrado generar los recursos suficientes para llevar el sustento a su hogar.
El crédito que solicita será invertido en el mantenimiento de su vehículo de trabajo  y para la compra de repuestos, esto con el fin de continuar prestando un servicio ágil y seguro a sus clientes.
Bernardo manifiesta que su mayor deseo es comprar otra moto para ponerla a producir y generar empleo, así podrá garantizar una estabilidad económica para brindar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Bernardo, 52 years old, is father of two children, whom he has raised with great effort. Some four years ago he lost his job, but since he needed to pay for family and household expenses he saw the chance of working transporting people by motorcycle, a traditional job in the municipality where he lives. Doing this he has been able to get enough resources to support his family. The requested loan will be invested in maintaining his work vehicle and buying spare parts, so that he is able to keep on offering fast and safe service to his customers. Bernardo states that his greatest wish is to buy another motorcycle and use it to generate more work, and in this way to guarantee financial stability and offer his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: To perform maintenance of his work vehicle and to buy spare parts

loans.name: Lorm

texts.en:
Lorm is 44 years old, married, and has five children. She helps her husband on their own farm to make a living. She works as a paid day labor to earn additional income. She has gradually improved her farming and earned well for the family. 

Lorm requested her first loan, which she will use to buy a solar home system to install on the roof of her house, which is located in the off-grid area of the province. After this initial investment, Lorm will be able to gain access to clean energy, which she can use to support household appliances such as light, TV, and radio. Everyone in her family will be able to work or study at night. Lorm hopes to improve the general living conditions of the entire family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase a solar home system to install on the roof of her house

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Meet Hellen, a happy, hardworking farmer in the Nkubu area of Eastern Kenya, where she lives with her husband and 4 children.

She loves farming and has been doing it for 15 years, her primary income sources being milk, eggs, and horticultural crops. Her biggest challenge is insufficient water and capital.

Hellen chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because of their favourable interest rates. During the Juhudi training, she learnt a lot about planning and budgeting her finances so as to minimise costs and to maximize revenue. Through this loan she will aquire water pipes to channel water to her farm, thus enabling her to get more income from the produce, and she will also be able to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase water pipes to channel water to her farm.

loans.name: Caundesia

texts.en:
Caundesia, a 51-year-old married mother of six from Thika, has a mixed crop farm business. She has been in the farming business for the past 10 years. She earns a monthly income of KES 15,000, which she uses to support her family. This marks her first loan term with VISIONFUND KENYA after she was introduced by an existing client. 

With the loan she has applied for from VISIONFUND KENYA, she will purchase farm inputs. Additional income created will allow her to improve the standard of living for her family and use the remaining amount for the education for her children. 

In the future Caundesia would like to expand her farm land. She hopes to become a prominent farmer in Embu.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs

loans.name: Gemira De Jesús

texts.es:
Gemira, a sus 53 años de edad, es casada y madre de 7 hijos a los que ha sacado adelante con mucho empeño y dedicación. 
Con el fin de generar ingresos para aportar a la economía de su hogar, hace 6 años comenzó con una pequeña tienda de abarrotes, ubicada en una vía principal del municipio donde reside, por lo que su clientela está conformada por los viajeros que pasan por la carretera, los vecinos, amigos y transeúntes del sector; esto le ha permitido generar los ingresos suficientes para apoyar a su esposo con la carga económica y el sustento de su numerosa familia.
El crédito que solicita está destinado para la compra de surtido al por mayor (gaseosas, mecato, licor, cervezas y productos de la canasta familiar) esto le permitirá mantener bien surtida su tienda para satisfacer las necesidades y gustos de su clientela, mejorando notablemente el incremento en el margen de ganancias que percibe por su labor.
Gemira manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es darle continuidad a su negocio, por lo cual desea mantenerlo bien surtido y mejorar cada vez más la variedad de productos a ofrecer, entre ellos desea vender comidas preparadas, para mejorar las ventas y garantizar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Gemira is 53 years old, married, and is the mother of seven children whom she loves very much. Six years ago, Gemira started a convenience store in hopes of generating additional income to support her family. Her store is located on a main highway in her community, so her clientele is made up of travelers, neighbors, friends and transients from her community. This business has helped Gemira to generate some income and help her husband with the financial responsibilities and household expenses for their large family.

With the support from this loan, Gemira plans to purchase merchandise in bulk to stock her convenience store, including: sodas, beer, liquor, snacks and other basic food items. She hopes this investment will help her to strengthen and expand her business to meet customer demand and increase overall profits. Gemira's dream is to continue with her business and to constantly increase the variety and quality of products she offers to her customers so that she can improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise in bulk (sodas, liquor, beer, snacks and other basic food products) to stock her convenience store.

loans.name: Sreypov

texts.en:
Sreypov, aged 28, lives in a rural village of the Moung Russey district and has two children. She and her husband are farmers who grow rice and her husband also supplements the income by working as a carpenter. Having been in this business for several years, Sreypov can earn about 40,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s need. 
This is the micro loan for Sreypov and she is a second cycle client with VisionFund. The past two loans that she completely repaid have helped her relieve the financial burden and improve their livelihood. Now she is applying for a loan of 4,000,000 KHR to plow the rice field. She hopes to increase the yield to make a better living.

loans.use: to plow the rice field

loans.name: Saem's Group

texts.en:
A widow living in a rural village located in the Thmor Koul district of Battambang province, Saem is 58 years old and has six children. Saem is a grocery seller who has been selling for 20 years. She is able to earn about 50,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs. 
Saem has been with VisionFunf for nine cycles and has completely repaid her past loans, which have helped her to better support her family. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. Saem is going to use her portion to buy more grocery items for resale. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items for resale

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Susana works hard to support her family.

She has a farming equipment for rent business in the Philippines and earns additional income from food vending. Susana is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her farming equipment for her machinery rental business.

Susana has been sustaining her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to buy more farmland.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her farming equipment

loans.name: Qadhr Al- Nada'a Group

texts.en:
Qadhr Al-Nada'a is a group consisting of four women who are living in Sana'a, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 200,000 YER from AMB.
Sabah is 43 years old, married and living with her spouse in their own house in Sana'a, Yemen. She is the leader of the group. Sabah is an uneducated woman. The salary of her husband is not enough to cover all of her family's living expenses. She thought that the best thing would be to secure another income source. She decided to sell some of her properties to build another floor in her house in order to rent it. The monthly rent she gets will help to improve the living conditions of her family. She is now in the last stages of finishing the construction. What remains is buying the windows for the new floor.  Unfortunately, she has no more money, so she applied for a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase windows. She is planning to open a saving account with AMB in the near future.

loans.use: to buy windows for her house

loans.name: Lat

texts.en:
Lat, 33, is married with four dependent children, two of whom are still in school, while another two are too young for school. His family lives in a house with a thatched roof located in Kampong Cham province’s Memot district and the main sources of his family’s income are from growing cassava. He has been running his business for ten years, earning about KHR 20,000 per day to meet his family’s needs. 

Lat received his first loan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, not long ago and has effectively used it to sustain his family’s business and support his family’s needs. With a good business, he is applying for another loan of 2,000,000 KHR to buy fertilizers and pesticides for his farmland. He hopes to increase his crop yields to earn more income to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for his farmland

loans.name: Rodolfo

texts.en: Rodolfo is age 50, married and blessed with three children. He has owned and operated a business retailing liquid petroleum gas and oxygen tanks for almost 19 years. He earns a net income of PHP 5,000 every month. His net profits are usually spent to pay the electric bill, water bill, and food expenses. Due to insufficient funds for his business, he would like to avail a loan of PHP 40,000 to purchase Liquid Petroleum Gas and Oxygen tanks for retail sale. He's hoping that his business will continue to grow and become more profitable.

loans.use: To purchase Liquid Petroleum Gas and Oxygen tanks for retail sale.

location.town: Quezon St. District 1, Cauayan City, Isabela

loans.name: Vichka

texts.en:
