Vichka, 32, lives with one kid in a rural village of the Dambae district, Cambodia. To feed the family, Vichka and her husband earn a living as farmers who have been growing cassava for four years, earning about 50,000 KHR per day to spend for the family’s needs. 

Vichka has been with VisionFund for three cycles. She is now applying for a loan to buy pesticides and fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to increase her crop yields to generate more income to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Caridad

texts.en:
Caridad has been engaged in a vending business for many years for a living. She is preparing and selling snacks in her village. Aside from this, she also has a retail store, selling groceries. She earns well from this and also established a transportation business using a tricycle. 

With her generated revenue, her previous loan used for the business was successfully repaid. She was happy to have her business, as it helps her community, especially letting her neighbor rent her tricycle for their living. Recently, she took a new loan to purchase a new set of tires for the tricycle in order to improve and secure the services. 

In the future, she wants to improve the general living situation of the entire family.

loans.use: to purchase a new set of tires for her tricycle

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Soeng

texts.en:
Soeng, 54, is married and lives with her family in a village of the Prey Chhor district. She has three children, two of whom are in school. To make a living, she has been farming rice and raising pigs and the current business earns her family about 80,000 KHR per day. 

Soeng has been with VisionFund for one cycle and completely paid back the past loan. Now she is applying for a new loan. Soeng wants to use this loan to buy more piglets to raise. She hopes to increase her family’s income from her current business so as to make a better living and keep her daughters in school.

loans.use: to buy more piglets to raise

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Ma. Lourdes

texts.en:
Ma. Lourdes is 52 years old and a widowed mother of one child. 

Ma. Lourdes is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Ma. Lourdes has been farming vegetables for six years now and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is 58-years-old and married with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like snack foods, sugar, soap, shampoo, canned goods, and other groceries.

Julieta has borrowed and paid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from selling vegetables.

She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like snack foods, sugar, soap, shampoo, canned goods, and other groceries

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy women’s and men’s jeans and clothes

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David, a 54-year-old father of one from Thika, has a business as a mixed crop farmer. He is married to Martha, who helps him with farming. He also works as a mason, a business which supplements his income. He earns a monthly income of KES 17,000 which he uses to support his family. This marks his second loan term with VisionFund Kenya.

With the loan he has applied for, he will be able to purchase a motorbike to start a motorcycle transport business. The additional income created will allow him to improve the standard of living for his family. 

In the future, David would like to improve his businesses. He hopes to have a quiet life in his old age.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike to start a motorcycle transport business.

loans.name: Glenn

texts.en:
Glenn is a 31-year-old married man with two children, and he is a native of the municipality of Fugu, located in the northern region of the country, an area known for growing crops, having one of the largest refineries in the country, and also its commerce. Glenn is known to be a hard-working and responsible man with lots of desire to better himself. He's a micro-entrepreneur who works in the buying and selling of pigs and animal raising. 

His purchases are done in nearby areas and transacted in cash as well as credit, with regular and occasional customers. Payments are collected every week (sometimes every two weeks) and this isn't his only business. Thanks to his hard work and sacrifice he has been able to support his family with good management and the other businesses he has created, such as: selling pastries and raising chickens, among other things, and that's how he has obtained a bit of extra income. One of his dreams is to further expand his businesses and finish building his home. 

The purpose of this loan is to obtain working capital and purchase pigs, chickens, wood, lard, flour, and more. Santiago is grateful for the help that Kiva lenders provide to low-income people.

loans.use: To purchase pigs, chickens, wood, lard, flour, and more.

loans.name: Dennis

texts.en:
Dennis studied BSBA in a university. His parents worked hard in order to support his education. He has two sibling who are still depending on his parents. 

Dennis is very much thankful to GDMPC for granting loans to students who are courageous and eager to pursue ambitions, despite hindrances. Now, he needs to pay tuition fees and other charges for his final exam. He took another loan from GDMPC for this. Dennis wants to work in any company in the future, so that he can help his parents and his brothers' and sisters' educations.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees and other charges

loans.name: Maria Clara

texts.en: Maria Clara lives in Lanao del Norte  with her children. She runs a general store selling goods in their local community to earn a living and has had this business for four years. Aside from this, she helps her husband operate their own fishing business and she earns a better income from this. With her generated revenue from fishing, her previous loan used for fishing nets was successfully repaid. She provides for her family with her earnings.  She is determined and faithful in doing this for the family.  She borrowed a loan recently from GDMPC micro credit to buy additional grocery goods. She plans to expand her store in order to gain more income for her family's needs. She hopes to be able to get another fishing boat to be used for her fishing business.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Nicholas

texts.en:
Nicholas is a 44-year-old married father of five. He runs a butchery business in Embu. He currently lacks funds to purchase enough meat to serve his ever-growing customer base.

With a loan through VisionFund, Kenya, Nicholas will be able to purchase more goats for slaughter and sale in his butchery. Nicholas is requesting this first loan after having been recently introduced by an existing client of VisionFund. Additional income will allow him to reinvest in his business.

In the future, Nicholas would like to invest in his children’s education.

loans.use: to purchase more goats for slaughter.

loans.name: Aleksan

texts.en:
Aleksan lives in the village Khashtarak in the Tavush region. He is 41-years-old.  Aleksan used to work as a driver for different companies, but now he is a taxi driver, but at the same time he is engaged in farming and agriculture with his retired mother.  On his farm Aleksan has two cows and thirty chickens. On his plot of land he cultivates wheat (he makes flour from it for his family's use), some vegetables (tomatoes, cucumbers, greens and carrots) and he also has fruit trees (apple, pear and fig). All his farm goods, such as milk, butter, cheese (made by his mother), eggs, vegetables and fruits, he sells at the local wholesale market once a week. 

Aleksan is married and he has a daughter and a son. His wife works at the shop as a saleswoman.  Aleksan wants to start swine breeding and for this occupation he needs a loan of 300,000 Armenian drams in order to buy four piglets and also some animal fodder for his cattle farm.

loans.use: to buy four piglets and animal fodder for his cattle farm
